texts.es: Santos Inocente M. V. vive en  el municipio de Cuscatancingo en el departamento de San Salvador. A sus 61 años de edad, vive siempre acompañado de su esposa quien le ayuda a manejar una pequeña panadería  desde hace ya 10 años. La vida de la pareja M. no ha sido fácil, y han pasado varias dificultades, pero se han mantenido firmes, y con esfuerzo y fe, han logrado salir siempre adelante y alcanzar una década en su negocio. Santos y su esposa solicitan un préstamo para surtir nuevamente la panadería y comprar nueva materia prima para ofrecer cosas nuevas y de buena calidad.
texts.en:
Santos Inocente M. V. lives in the town of Cuscatancingo in the district of San Salvador. At 61 years of age, he has always been accompanied by his wife who has helped him manage the small bakery they have owned for the past 10 years. Life for the M. couple has not been easy. Despite many difficulties, they have remained firm in their faith and in their abilities to always pull ahead. As a result, they have remained in business for an entire decade.

Santos and his wife are requesting a loan to restock their bakery and buy ingredients so that they can offer new products of better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

Fatmeh is a 54-year-old married woman with 4 children.

Fatmeh has been working as a home-based tailor since 1990 to help her husband in the household and provide better life conditions for her children.

Today, Fatmeh is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise and tools for her work.

texts.fr: aby diene B. est parent beneficiaire depuis 2003.elle s'active dans la vente de fripperie.elle capitalise capitalise une experience de plus de cinq ans.elle sollicite un credit cent cinquante mille(150 000)pour augmenter son fond de roulement dans le but de pouvoir maximiser ses benefices et ,ieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Aby Diene B. has been a recipient parent since 2003.  She is active in selling second-hand clothing and capitalizes on over five years of experience.  She's requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to increase her working capital with the goal of maximizing her profits and assisting her family more. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: Roxana L. R. vive en Ciudad Delgado municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Roxana de 42 años de edad, vive con su madre, Doña María de 74 años de edad y sus hermanos quien es comerciante. Roxana desde pequeña siempre fue muy trabajadora y responsable, y no es sorpresa que sea ella quien cuide y se encargue de su madre y hermano. Su negocio es una venta de verduras en el mercado municipal de Ciudad delgado donde ella se gana la vida. Roxana solicita un préstamo  para comprar verduras, zapatos y juguetes y así tener mayor variedad de productos en el negocio.
texts.en:
Roxana L. R. lives in the municipality of Delgado City, which is in the district of San Salvador. She is 42 years old and lives with her 74 year old mother, Doña María. Her siblings are also merchants. Roxana was responsible and hardworking as a young girl, so it is not surprising that she would be the one who would take care of her mother and brother.

Roxana earns her living by selling vegetables at the municipal market in Delgado City. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, shoes, and toys so that she can have a wide variety of products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business with a wide variety of products

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 47 year old married man and father of 5 children.

He has been working in spare parts distribution since 2004.

Today, Mahmoud is requesting to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance to his car to be able to distribute the products and continue his work.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania P. is from the village of Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 68 years old. Epifania is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Epifania owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Epifania has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Epifania joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epifania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Epifania is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Epifania from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 41-year-old married woman with six children, aged between 22 and 9 years. She resides in a rented house. All her children go to school. Margret takes care of additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day.

Margret resides and works in a semi-urban area. She incurs extra transport to and from business shopping. She buys charcoal from Kibogo, a rural area, and sells it near her residence. She sells 4 sacks of charcoal a day. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for her family. She has been in this business for the last seven years.

Margret has been with MCDT for eleven years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more charcoal and increase her working assets in preparation for the forthcoming rainy season. Margret is aspiring to see her business grow and build a house for herself.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal stock in preparation for the forthcoming rainy season

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Maribojoc, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Helen is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Helen is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

texts.es: Gilberto Vidal A. C. vive en Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Gilberto tien tan solo 21 años de edad, vive en casa con su madre, quien trabaja vendiendo ropa y zapatos, y su padre que labora como albañil. Desafortunadamente el trabajo de sus padres no ha dado muchos ingresos últimamente, y fueron incapaces de brindar a Gilberto una educación completa. Gilberto no se rinde fácilmente, y a pesar de sus dificultades montó por sí mismo una tienda en su propia casa donde se gana la vida. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y aumentar sus ingresos para ayudarle a sus padres con los gastos de la casa que comparten.

loans.name: Charilyn

texts.en:
Charilyn V. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Charilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Charilyn owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Charilyn has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 4,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Charilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charilyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Charilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 31-year-old married man. He has owned a tire repair shop since 2000. Today, Mahmoud has requested to borrow US$ 1,200 to purchase a new specialized machine for his work in order to attract more clients.

loans.name: Cherry Rose

texts.en:
Cherry Rose R. is from the village of Poblacion 2 Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Cherry Rose is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Rose owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Cherry Rose has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cherry Rose joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Rose is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Cherry Rose from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

texts.es: Dalila E. vive en Tonacatepeque municipio dentro del departamento de San Salvador. Desde hace 10 años maneja una venta de zapatos dentro de un centro comercial. Dalila nunca estudió, pues nunca tuvo las posibilidades económicas para hacerlo, pero este obstáculo nunca ha podido detenerla, y siempre ha buscado la forma de crecer y avanzar en la vida. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería para su zapatería y así ampliar la variedad de productos que en ella ofrece.
texts.en:
Dalila E. lives in the Tonacatepeque municipality within the San Salvador department. For ten years she has managed a shoe sales place in a commercial center. Dalila never went to school; she never had the economic possibility of doing so. But, this obstacle never stopped her. She has always looked for the way to grow and advance in her life. She is currently asking for a loan to buy new merchandise for her shoe store. This way she will increase the variety of products that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel D. V. reside en el municipio de  Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San Salvador.  A sus 44 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos todos menores de edad, a quienes cuida y mantiene. El más pequeño tiene tan solo 2 años y los otros dos, cursan el bachillerato en la escuela. Israel maneja un negocio de venta de calzado ortopédico en su propia casa. Israel y su familia solicitan un préstamo para comprar materia prima para su negocio y así vender más, pues la educación de sus hijos mayores y la crianza de su hijo menor son gastos que Israel se ha prometido a si mismo cumplir.
texts.en:
Israel D. V. lives in the municipality of Ciudad Delgado in the department of San Salvador. He is 44, and he has three minor children that he takes care of and supports. The smallest is two years old. The others are working on their high school degrees. Israel runs a business that sells orthopedic footwear in his own home. Israel and his family are asking for a loan to buy raw material for his business in order to sell more. The education of his two oldest children and raising his youngest child are expenses that Israel has promised himself to provide for them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make footwear

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mrs.Gloria T. is a fish vendor in the public market. Her husband was an engine mechanic before and his present work is to maintain their fishing boats. They have three fishing boats and they have three children. Her eldest son is a graduate of automotive school. They have two daughters; the younger is a high school student in their barangay (district).

Mrs.T. is very active or, in other terms, she is a good member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative at Sindangan branch. There was a time that one of her motor fishing boats was damaged. At that time she decided to apply for another loan in Paglaum because she had not enough money to buy another motor for her fishing boat. Her loan was granted because her good performance in her past cycle.

The family of Mrs.T. is so very happy because they can continue and they can deliver a lot of fish in their public market because now she can use her fishing boats to catch a lot of fish. Now she gives her warmest thanks to the Paglaum for helping her business and giving her whole family confidence.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fishing equipment.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn C. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old and is married. To make a living, Jenelyn grows and harvests a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jenelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn is requesting her first loan from PMPC, for 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

texts.en: Dora is thirty – three years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Dora lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. Dora supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza A. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis, Occidental. She is 34 years old. Riza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Riza raises pigs for sale. Riza is just starting this business.

In 2007, Riza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Riza successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that she used to purchase baby livestock.

Riza is requesting her 5th loan from PMPC for 7000 PHP which she will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay her children’s tuition fees.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika is a 30-year married woman with eight children aged between 8 years and 10 months old. Seven of her children go to school. Zulaika takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in an urban area.

Zulaika owns a taxi, hires a driver, and supervises the vehicle. The taxi operates in Kampala, an urban area. Zulaika has been in this business for one year and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her residence and school fees for her children. Her major challenge is paying for a stage where her vehicle parks.

Zulaika has been with MCDT for six years, is servicing her eighth loan and working with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to put her vehicle in good mechanical condition. Zulaika aspires to buy herself a plot of land.

loans.use: To put her taxi in a good mechanical condition.

texts.en:
Theresa is 40 years old. She is married and has no child. She lives with her husband and some step children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family.  

Theresa is a trader. She runs a provision store in her community. Theresa buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario B.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 36 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Tinacla-an, Clarin Misamis Occidental. Rosario has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rosario joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell.

Rosario is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes P. is from the village of Napurog, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Lourdes is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling poultry products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

texts.en: Rhoda is twenty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Rhoda is a trader. She trades in textiles – under wears for ladies and ready-made clothes. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures her goods from Accra. Rhoda has been in business for ten years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet M. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is forty years old, married and has two school-aged children. Juliet has been an independent clothing dealer and dressmaker in her local community for over twelve years. She earns approximately 2,600 PHP a month.

In 2009, Juliet joined PMPC to gain access to their financial services. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to buy more inventory and to have some working capital at hand. This will be Juliet’s first loan from PMPC. Her goal is to use any additional profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that individual translations of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and establish working capital

texts.fr: aita sene W. est parent beneficiaire vendeuse de poissons capitalisant une experience de plus de six ans dans son activite.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour augmenter  son fond et gagner d'autres marches.son objectif est de mieux assister sa famille a ameliorer le cadre de vie.
texts.en:
Aita Sene W. is a recipient parent and a fish seller capitalizing on over six years of experience in her business.  She's requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase her capital and to reach other markets.  Her goal is to assist her family further in improving its living conditions.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Robinah is a 34-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of four and seventeen years. Her children attend school. She also takes care of other family members.

The family eats two meals a day. There is electricity but no plumbing in her home. Her major monthly expense is medical bills. She also incurs traveling expenses.

Robinah lives in a suburban area where she sells three sacks of charcoal a week. She buys the charcoal from rural Kiboga and sells it around her neighborhood. She has been doing so for the last five years.

Robinah has been with MCDT for five years working with the same group. She wants to use this loan to buy larger stocks of charcoal. Robinah wants her business to grow so she can meet all of her children’s school fees.

texts.es: Raúl Enrique P. L. vive en el municipio de Tonacatepeque en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos. La casa P. nunca esta callada, pues su hijo menor tiene apenas 3 meses de vida. Raúl maneja desde su propia casa un negocio de venta de pizza que administra junto a su esposa. Mantener a 4 hijos no es fácil, y por eso Raúl solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y hacer que este crezca más, para poder ofrecer una mejor vida para su familia y su hijo recién nacido.
texts.en:
Raúl Enrique P. L. lives in the town of Tonacatepeque, which is in the town of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and their four children. The P. household is never quiet because their youngest child is only 3 months old.

Raúl has a pizzeria in his home that he manages with his wife. Having four children is not easy. For this reason, Raul is requesting a loan to reinvest into his business so that it can continue to grow. This will enable him to provide a better life for his family and his newborn son.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes T. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, married and has three school-aged children. Lourdes owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily necessities to the local community. She has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and to have some working capital at hand. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. Her goal is to use any additional profits to improve her family’s living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translations by Kiva. Given that individual translations of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and establish working capital

loans.name: Jean Rusty

texts.en:
Jean Rusty M. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Jean Rusty is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jean Rusty makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Jean Rusty has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jean Rusty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean Rusty is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Jean Rusty from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

texts.fr: Adzo K. est une femme âgée de 31 ans marié et mère de 2 enfants. Elle vit  à Adéta une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Adzo avait un congélateur qui conserve mal les poissons. Avec ce crédit elle décide d’acheter un autre congélateur plus sophistiqué qui va lui permettre de bien conserver les poissons. Avec l’accroissement de la quantité de poissons vendus, Adzo pourra obtenir beaucoup de bénéfices, ce qui lui permettra de  mieux s’occuper de la santé et de la scolarisation de ses enfants. Plus tard  Adzo voudrait bien acheter des contenaires de  poissons congelés afin de les revendre en gros
texts.en:
Adzo K. is a 31-year-old woman who is married and the mother of two children.  She lives in Adéta, a town located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  Adzo used to have a freezer that kept fish poorly. With this loan, she decided to buy another, more sophisticated freezer that will allow her to keep fish well.  With the growth in the amount of fish sold, she will be able to obtain much more in profit.  This will enable her to do better in taking care of her children's health and schooling.  Later on, she would really like to purchase shipping containers of frozen fish in order to sell them wholesale.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin B. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old. Edwin is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Edwin raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Edwin has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Edwin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Edwin from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

texts.en: Hagar is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one son and one daughter who are both still in school. Hagar works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells beverages by the roadside in her community. Hagar procures her raw materials from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for more than 10 years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita D. is from the village of Maribojoc,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Esterlita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

texts.en:
Lyn T. lives in the village of Maribojoc, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a farm where she grows corn. Lyn has been engaged in this business for more than one year, and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Lyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to take advantage of business opportunities. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from PMPC. which she used to buy seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. Lyn is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living standards. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

texts.es: Blanca Marina L. G. vive en el municipio de Tonacatepeque en el departamento de San Salvador. Blanca Vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos todos menores de edad de 16,14 y 13 años respectivamente. Todos estudian en la escuela, y se ayudan mutuamente con los deberes y tareas. Blanca trabaja en su propio negocio de corte y confección, donde ha aprendido a tejer y coser. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio, ya que necesita vender más, para tratar de brindar a sus hijos la educación formal que ella y su esposo nunca tuvieron.
texts.en:
Blanca Marina L. G. lives in the town of Tonacatepeque in the district of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and three dependent children (ages 16, 14, and 13). They all attend school and help one another with their homework and assignments. Blanca works at her own dressmaking business, where she learned how to knit and sew.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan to reinvest into her business. She needs to sell more of her merchandise so that she can provide the formal education to her children that she and her husband never had.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw is 35 years old, married and has three children, one son and two daughters, all of whom are still in school. He works very hard to provide for his family. Yaw makes a living selling secondhand clothing and textiles. He lives in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana, but travels around to make sales to his customers and buy his supplies in the capital of Accra. He has been in business for four years, and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to his customers and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy secondhand clothing and textiles

texts.es: María Antonia A. vive en el municipio de Tonacatepeque en el departamento de San Salvador. La vida siempre ha sido difícil para María Antonieta, quien nunca recibió educación formal y nunca aprendió un oficio. Tras casarse, inicio poco a poco una pequeña aventura, la apertura de su propio negocio. No fue fácil, pero María ha demostrado que a veces el deseo de superación vale más que cualquier clase de matemática o idioma y mediante mucho trabajo y sudor, maneja ahora una venta de tortillas y productos de uso básico. María solicita un préstamo para surtir con nuevos productos su negocio, y dar un paso más en su desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
María Antonia A. lives in the town of Tonacatepeque in the distict of San Salvador. Life has always been difficult for María Antonia, who never received a formal education or learned a trade. After she got married, she eventually opened her own business. It has not been easy, but María has demonstrated that sometimes the desire to excel is better than any math or language class. With hard work and sweat, she now sells tortillas and products for everyday use.

María is requesting a loan to stock her business with new products. She feels this will enable her to take the next step in her personal development.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is from the village of Maribojoc,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Erlinda is married. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business

texts.en:
Margaret is fifty – two years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three sons and one daughter who are all still in school. Margaret works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar in her community. Margaret prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. She procures her raw materials from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for over fifteen years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.
To buy second hand textiles

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana tiene 33 años, esta casada con el Sr. hernan Villarroel por 11 años, por el momento no tienen hijos, pero desean en un tiempo tener unos dos, una niña y un niño.

La Sra. Juana se dedica a la lecheria desde hace 11 años, aprendio de su madre, quien le enseño todo sobre el cuidado del ganado lechero, ella empezó poco a poco a comprar su ganado y ahora cuenta con 3 vacas lecheras. Ella produce queso, su producto es de muy buena calidad. Vende el el mercado de la zona.

Requiere del dinero para comprar una vaca lechera mas, lo que incrementara su produccion de leche para poder producir mayor cantidad de queso para la venta y asi mejorar sustantivamente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is 33 years old and has been married to Sr. Hernan Villaroel for 11 years. At the moment, they do not have children but would like to have two of them, a girl and a boy.

Sra. Juana has been working on a dairy since she was 11 years old. She learned everything from her mother, who taught her how to care for the dairy cows. She began buying her own cows over time and she now has three of them. She produces high-quality cheese, which she sells in the area market.

Sra. Juana is requesting a loan to buy another dairy cow. This will increase her milk production so that she can produce more cheese for sale and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia G. lives in Balik Balik Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nort. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari sari (or variety) store and a binangkal, or Filipino snack-making business. Melodia has been in these lines of work for more than three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that can help improve her life and ability to take advantage of business opportunities. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from PMPC, and is requesting a third to further expand her business and improve her family's living standards. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.

loans.use: To further expand her snack-making business

texts.en: Stephen is thirty – three years old. He is married and has given birth to two children, both daughters who are still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. Stephen lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. He is a trader. He is into palm oil production business. Stephen supplies to retailers in his community. He procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand his business.

texts.es: Isis Lisseth A. D. P. vive en el municipio D. Apopa en el departamento D. San Salvador. A  su temprana edad D. 19 años, Isis abrió su propio negocio, una tienda D. cosméticos y ropa. Al principio no fu fácil, pues la juventud y la falta D. preparación  no combinan bien. A pesar D. sus limitaciones. Isis cuenta con una enorme cualidad, siempre ha sido emprendedora, y después D. 7 años manejando el negocio ha logrado hacerla crecer cada vez un poco más. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar nuevos productos y surtir su  preciado negocio.
texts.en:
Isis Lisseth A. D. P. lives in the town of Apopa in the district of San Salvador. At the tender age of 19, Isis opened her own business selling cosmetics and clothing. At first it was not easy since youth and a lack of preparation make for a bad combination. Despite these limitations, Isis demonstrated her enterprising spirit and has managed to grow her business gradually over the span of 7 years. She is currently requesting a loan to buy new products in order to stock her precious business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

Ethelinda A. a resident of Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 54 years old, married and has five children. She makes a living running a sari sari (or variety) store, but would also like to go into a new line of business by buying fishing nets. She plans to use the income made possible by this new venture to better support her family and pay for her children's education.

texts.fr: ndiaya laye S. est pqrent beneficiaire depuis 2004.elle vend des effets de femme tels que les chaussures sacs a main lait de toilette aux habitantes de son quartier.avec ses benefices elle elle assiste son mari pour les charges familliales.elle veut repondre a la demande accrue de sa clientele.
texts.en:
Ndiaya Laye S. has been a recipient parent since 2004.  She sells women's merchandise, such as shoes, handbags, and lotions to the women residing in her district.  With these profits, she helps her husband to meet family expenses.  She wants to respond to the increased demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Ana Vilma S. vive en el municipio de Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador. Ana, de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo, quien le ayuda en el negocio y su hijo de 19 años de edad, estudiante de bachillerato.  Juntos como familia manejan una tienda, en su casa desde hace ya hace 6 años, y  tras tener éxito en dicha empresa, sumaron un negocio en el mercado de apopa, donde  venden insumos para el hogar. Ana solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio y comprar nueva mercadería, para continuar superándose y desarrollando el negocio familiar.

texts.en: Alfred is 51 years old, married and has six children, two sons and four daughters, all of whom are still in school. He works very hard to provide for his family, and lives with his wife and their children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Alfred makes a living producing palm oil, which he supplies to retailers in his community. He has been in this business for 10 years, and has applied for this loan to buy more palm fruits from nearby towns so he can produce more oil and expand his business.

texts.fr: Kossiwa G. est une femme âgée de 57 ans mariée avec 3 enfants. Elle habite et travaille à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle aperçoit qu’elle fera plus de bénéfices si elle augmentait l’achat en gros des assiettes plastiques pour la revente. Ces bénéfices l’aideront à financer la scolarité de ses enfants et à répondre à leurs besoins de santé. Elle pense louer une boutique pour pouvoir étaler ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Kossiwa G. is a 57 year old woman who is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers (approximately 93 miles) from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She realizes that she will make larger profits if she increases her bulk purchases of plastic plates for resale. These profits will help her to finance her children's schooling and to respond to their health needs. She plans to rent a store to be able to display her merchandise.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La Sra. C. tiene 20 años, esta casada tres años con el Sr. Hugo Padilla Ayala, tienen una hija de 1 año de edad. todavia viven en casa de los padres en una zona lechera y agricola por excelencia.

La Sra. Lenny se dedica a la lecheria desde hace 5 años, toda su produccion de leche entrega a una empresa que elabora productos lacteos que posteriormente se venden el mercado local. 

Requieren del credito para comprar una ordeñadora, este equipo facilitará el trabajo haciendolo mas eficiente y facil. 

En un futuro desean poder adquirir otro credito para poder comprar una casa e independizarse.
texts.en:
Señora C., 20, has been married for three years to Hugo Padilla Ayala. They have a one year old daughter. They still live in their parents’ house in a region with excellent dairies and agriculture. Lenny has worked in a dairy for five years. She takes all of her milk production to a business that makes dairy products and sells them in the local market. They need a loan to buy a milking machine. This equipment makes the work easier and more efficient. In the future they hope to get another loan to be able to buy a house and make themselves independent.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

Juliana is 37 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Juliana lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She is in the palm-oil production business. Juliana supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es: Ana Cecilia R. D. H. vive en el municipio D. Apopa en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ana D. 42 años D. edad, vive con su  esposo, quien trabaja como motorista y sus cuatro hijo, todos menores D. edad. Tener una familia extensa fue siempre el sueño D. Cecilia, cuyos cuatro hijos son su razón D. vivir. Hace ya cuatro años  Ana Cecilia abrió una tienda donD. venD. productos básicos, y que poco a poco se ha vuelto el pilar económico D. la familia H.. En este momento Ana Cecilia solicita un préstamo para surtir su tienda con nuevos productos y mercadería, para obtener más ingresos y cimentar las bases económicas que se convertirán en el futuro D. sus cuatro retoños.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia R. D. H. lives in the municipality of Apopa in the department of San Salvador. Ana is 42 years old, lives with her husband, who works as a driver, and their four young children. Cecilia always dreamed of having a large family, and her four children give her a purpose to live. Four years ago, Ana Cecilia started a general store where she sells basic necessity products. Little by little, the store has become the financial pillar of the H. family. At this time, Ana Cecilia is requesting a loan to supply her store with new merchandise. She wants to increase her income to lay the foundation for her four children’s economic future.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

texts.en: George is thirty – three years old. He is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters who are all still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. George is a trader. He trades in second hand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. He hawks and treks to sell in other communities. George procures bales of second hand textiles from Accra. He has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 1, 3, 4 Group

texts.en:
Eneroliza is a warm-hearted mother of four running a small roadside bakery and ice cream store from her house.  She is a self-taught baker. Over eight years ago, she decided to start selling bread and had only a limited idea of how to make it.  Over the years, she slowly learned how to properly mix and bake her ingredients, including flour, yeast, sugar and coconut oil.  Now, Eneroliza finds business brisk as people from all over come to her house to purchase from her household bakery.  She has found business to be successful enough to be currently taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza.

Living with her husband and four children ages 24, 19, 15 and 13, she is grateful for the ability to supplement her husband’s income and provide more food for the family.  She is also hoping to provide her children with the opportunity to attend a university – her only daughter would love to study engineering, and her sons are considering studying law.

Beyond supporting her children’s future, Eneroliza dreams about owning her own beauty salon. She has been taking classes with the hopes of opening up her own location in the future, using the profits from her bread and ice cream sales today.  Extra funds from either business would go to improving her home which currently lacks a bathroom and other facilities.

Thank you for supporting this Kiva loan!

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, coconut oil and ice cream supplies

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes Del Carmen R. M. reside en Apopa municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Mercedes tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como albañil y su hija Silva estudiante de 16 años de edad. Mercedes posee su propio negocio donde maneja una pequeña tienda con productos de consumo, y también un pequeño inventario en frutas, como si no es suficiente Mercedes todas las tardes elabora pupusas en su negocio de esta manera logra obtener mayores ingresos, el crédito que solicita Mercedes es para destino de surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes Del Carmen R. M. lives in the town of Apopa in the district of San Salvador. She is 40 years old, married, and has a 16 year old daughter named Silva, who is a student. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Mercedes manages a small grocery store where she sells consumer products and has a small inventory of fruits. If that was not enough, Mercedes makes pupusas in the afternoons in order to earn more income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith D. is a resident of Sitio Lapak, Brgy. Robles, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She is 40 years old and married with six children, who are 4, 7, 9, 11, 13 and 15 years old.

To support her young family, Judith has a "sari-sari" or general store, a food vending business and billiard tables. The family also has a small farm. Billiards is a popular game among the men, and because it does not need electricity to operate, suitable for the rural setting and does not cost so much to sustain.

Judith is always on the lookout for new business opportunities that she can offer to her community in her effort to elevate her family into a more comfortable and secure existence.

The PHP 11,000 loan that Judith is borrowing for her 12th loan cycle is already budgeted. With it she intends to buy a second-hand refrigerator so that she can sell cold drinks and preserve food longer in her store. She also intends to restock her "sari-sari" or general store and buy fertilizer for her farm.

Judith is convinced that if she pursues her goal with unwavering fervor, she will reach her goal of improving her family's standard of living.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store and farm

loans.name: Juan Jose Dolores

texts.es: Juan Jose Dolores C. M. de 45 años de edad reside en Apopa municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Juan vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Juan se dedica a su negocio el que consiste en dar servicios de transporte de colonia a colonia,  ya que en esos lugares no hay transporte de buses que se dirija a colonias lejanas,  Juan es consciente que la seguridad de sus pasajeros es importante y es por eso que solicita este crédito; ya que su carro necesita de revisión y ajustes, lo cual le brinda a Juan la seguridad de sus clientes.

loans.use: Ajueste y revisión de su vehiculo

texts.fr: oumy G. est parent bénéficiaire depuis 2003.elle gère une boutique et capitalise trois annees d'expérience.elle sollicite un crédit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour renforcer son fond et qccroitre so stock marchandises a vendre.cette da,e assiste régulièrement son mari a améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Oumy G. has been a client since 2003. She runs a store and capitalizes on three years of experience. She is requesting a loan of one hundred thousand (100,000) francs to reinforce her capital and to increase her stock of merchandise to sell. This woman regularly helps her husband to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

Maria C. is an individual loan associate who has successfully completed two previous loan cycles and is looking to take out a third. Maria lives in San Pedro de Macoris, an area in the southeast of the Dominican Republic where electricity and running water are scarce. She enjoys working with Esperanza International since they provide her with more financing options and the ability to expand her businesses.

She plans on using this loan to expand her nail salon and small cafeteria. This loan will allow her to expand her restaurant by providing her with the money to purchase clothing, accessories, fruit, bread, and juice. Maria hopes to continue growing her business along with Esperanza International and looks forward to the large impact this loan will have in her life. With this loan and increased business, Maria continues to work towards her dream of one day having a restaurant apart from her house. Maria would like to thank you for your support.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel R. is 35 years old and married with teenage kids. She lives in San Agustin St., Brgy. 1, La Carlota, Negros Occidental.

When she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, she'd already been in the food-vending business for two years, but the PHP 3,000 she borrowed for her first loan went a long way in allowing her to increase her income capacity.

From her own efforts and with the help of the loans she got from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liezel was able to have her house repaired and she was also able to buy a motorcycle that they use to deliver her food products. 

This is already Liezel's 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon and she intends to borrow PHP 19,500 as additional capital so that she can increase the volume of the delicacies that she sells.

Because her kids are approaching college age, Liezel is working extra to earn more so that she can save up for the education of her children while continuing to help her husband support their growing family.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food-vending business

texts.es: Julio Cesar H. S. reside en Apopa municipio del departamento de San Salvador. Julio vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tres de ellos son menores de edad y estudiantes, solo su hijo mayo de 20 años de edad trabaja como mecánico. Julio posee un taller de hojalatería donde elabora diversos moldes en lata, el crédito que solicta Julio es para comprar mayor cantidad de letra que permita producir mayor cantidad de productos.

texts.fr: Astou G. est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle fait du commerce de fruits de saison. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux subvenir aux besoins nutritionnels et sanitaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
Astou G. is 43 years old, and is married with 7 children. She is in the seasonal fruit business. This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and to better provide for her family's nutritional and health needs.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: G. Olga Sylvie est née le 30/11/1971 à Porto-Novo. Olga Sylvie est mariée à ADANKON Roger, un analyste. Olga Sylvie et Roger ont cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Olga Sylvie et son mari supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. C’est les chaussures et les articles de mercerie que Olga Sylvie vend. Olga Sylvie a déjà six ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Olga Sylvie vend ses articles devant son domicile et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Olga Sylvie a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit d’ALIDé ; crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Olga Sylvie sollicite un deuxième prêt d’ALIDé pour acheter les chaussures en gros.
texts.en:
Olga Sylvie G. was born on 11/30/1971 in Porto-Novo. Olga Sylvie is married to Roger Adankon, an analyst. Olga Sylvie and Roger have five children who are all in school. Olga Sylvie and her husband bear the family expenses together. Olga Sylvie sells shoes and sewing supplies. Olga Sylvie already has six years of experience in this business. Olga Sylvie sells her items in front of her home and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the large international market of Bénin. Olga Sylvie has already received a loan from ALIDé; a loan that she has repaid well. Olga Sylvie is requesting a second loan from ALIDé to purchase shoes in bulk.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Jack Fisk

texts.es: Jack Fisk A. D. B.  vive en el departamento D. Ahuachapán. Jack tienen 23 años D. edad es madre soltera motivo por el cual vive con su madre y su pequeño hijo D. 4 años D. edad , Jack posee un negocio el cual le permite mantener a su hijo y  a su vez cuidar D. él, es una tienda con productos D. consumo y también posee un pequeño inventario D. ropa, el crédito que solicita ahora Jack es para surtir su negocio que le ayudaran a darle estabilidad económica a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Jack Fisk A. D. B. lives in the district of Ahuachapán. She is 23 years old and a single mother. Jack lives with her mother and her 4 year old son. She operates a store where she sells consumer products and maintains a small inventory of clothing. Her business enables her to generate an income and look after her son at the same time.

Jack is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store and proviD. financial stability for her little boy.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

texts.fr: Magatte N. est une dame de 48 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruit de saison et cet activité lui permet de contribuer aux charges familiales de la famille.

Awa F. est âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de divers produits sur étal. Avec ses revenus, elle contribue à la prise en charge des dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Awa F. is 52 years old, is married, and is the mother of 6 children. She has a small business selling various products in a stall. With her income she contributes to the payment of the daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Israel

texts.es: Israel J. M. reside en Apaneca municipio del departamento de Ahuachapán. Israel tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su familia  en casa en un pequeño terreno donde posee su negocio, Israel es un hombre muy creativo solo observando el cuido de pollos ha prendido y ahora es capaz de manejar su propia granja la cual tiene instalada es un galera construida por el mismo para cuidar y clasificar a sus pollos, el crédito que solicita Israel es para comprar concentrado que es el alimento de sus pollos de esta manera lograra venderlos a un mejor precio dependiendo del peso en que estos se encuentren.

loans.use: Compra de concentrado para crianza de sus pollos

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady F. est une femme mariée de 45 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des jus de fruits et de la glace. Les revenus générés lui permettent de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.

loans.use: Vente de glace et de jus de fruits

texts.fr: Astou D. est une jeune femme célibataire de 30 ans. Elle vend des fruits de saison tels que mangues, mandarine, orange et pastèque. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins et d’aider à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Astou D. is a single 30 year old young woman. She sells seasonal fruits such as mangoes, mandarins, oranges and watermelons. This business allows her to provide for herself and to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: Amy F. est une femme de 55 ans, marièe et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend de fruits locaux de saison. Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de mieux subvenir aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Amy F. is a 55 year old woman who is married with 3 children. She sells local seasonal fruits. This loan will allow her to increase her business in order to better meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Ana Mercedes D. D. F. vive en el departamento D. Ahuachapán junto a su esposo quien se encuentra ya pensionado por tener 87 años D. edad. Ana posee una tienda ubicada en su casa la cual le permite generar a Ana los ingresos  para ella y su esposo, ahora Ana solicita este crédito para surtir su negocio el cual le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias que son D. gran utilidad para su familia y su le concederá hacer un ahorro para la salud quebrantada D. su esposo.

texts.fr: Ndiendé N. est une femme de 44 ans, mère de 7 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de fruits de saison. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndiendé N. is a 44 year old woman and the mother of 7 children. She sells seasonal fruits. Her goal is to improve the living conditions, health and schooling of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

Antonia A. (fourth from right) is a loving mother of three receiving a loan to improve her clothing and shoe sales business.  She has been selling clothing and shoes for several years, and her successful business is now on its second loan with Esperanza.  Antonia is committed to making sure she gets the right products to her customers, and travels to Santo Domingo – a 3 hour bus riD. – to buy new clothing based on her orders.  She also makes a several-hour trek to the Haitian border to buy new and used shoes.

Living with her three children ages 10 and below, the success of her business is vitally important for their health and education.  Antonia finds herself using the profits from her business to feed her children and pay for their studies, books, uniforms and more.  This loan is vitally important to the growth of her business – and sub sequentially the education of her children!

The future is also exciting for Antonia – she would love to start her own car repair center alongsiD. the main road leading to the biggest nearby city – Samaná.  Though this goal is at least a few years away, she is hoping that the incremental growth of her business through loans such as the one you are funding today will proviD. her this opportunity.

Thank you for supporting Antonia and all others included in this Kiva loan!

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: Gloria Del Carmen F. H. reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Gloria tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien trabaja como vigilante y sus dos hijos Melvin de 18 años y Jeniffer de 10 años de edad ambos niños son estudiantes. Gloria se dedica hace diez años a su negocio una tienda con productos de consumo  y también maneja un pequeño inventario de ropa, ambos negocios se encuentran ubicados en su casa, el crédito que solicita Gloria es para surtir su tienda y a su surtir el inventario de ropa que posee ya que la demanda en la misma ha ido aumentando y es por eso que Gloria quiere aprovechar la oportunidad para explotar sus ventas con el consumo de ropa.
texts.en:
Gloria Del Carmen F. H. lives in the district of Ahuachapán. Gloria is 40 years old, married, and has two children, Melvin (age 18) and Jeniffer (age 10). Both children attend school. Her husband works as a security guard. For 10 years, Gloria has been selling consumer products from her store. She also maintains a small inventory of clothing. She operates both businesses out of her home.

Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can restock her store and increase her inventory of clothing. The demand for clothing has been increasing so she wants to take advantage of this opportunity to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store & increase her inventory of clothing

texts.en:
Ma Elena G. is a 49-year-old married woman who lives in the Barangay of Mabini, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental in the Philippines. She has four children, 3 girls and a boy, and her husband is a truck driver.

On Negros Island, driving a truck is a seasonal job. Truck drivers are mostly in demand during the sugar milling season, which runs for 10 months a year. Years with a poor sugar crop result in even less demand for truck drivers. In 2002 Elena made a wise decision to have an independent source of income by starting a "sari-sari, or general store after she received her first cycle loan.

Her efforts are paying off, and she proudly tells how her business income has allowed her to send her children to college. Her oldest child graduated in 2007 with a Midwifery diploma, and her second-oldest daughter graduated with a Bachelor's Degree in Education. Her youngest children are still in school. The third child is studying to be an Electrical Engineer, and the youngest is studying Computer Programming.

Recently, Elena started a new business offering vulcanizing services and selling gasoline to tricycle (a motorcycle with a side car) and motorcycle drivers who drive the narrow roads and rough farm paths in their area. Repairing flat tires and selling small amounts of gasoline has proven to be a lucrative business, especially since the nearest gasoline station is located in the town of Pontevedra.

Elena is happy to testify that she is thankful for the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon. With the help of NWTF she is moving forward in her objective to provide a good future for her children, and a comfortable living for her and her husband.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

texts.es:
El señor Pedro A. T. es un señor que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos; el esta observando que es demasiado gasto con los útiles escolares de sus nietos y sus  padres tienen que trabajar mucho mas para poder comprarles todo el material.
 El como abuelo  se siente comprometido en apoyar a sus hijos para la compra de ropa, uniformes y zapatos  para que se vean presentables para la escuela mas que todo el lo hace por que sus hijos le den la atención a sus nietos y no sean descuidados.
Pedro piensa que el ya creo a sus hijos de la mejor manera otorgándoles  el tiempo que necesitaron, como  viéndolos crecer y no quiere que sus hijos se pierdan ningún momento de ello por exceso de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro A. T. is a man who cares about the welfare of his children. He takes note of the high cost of school supplies for his grandchildren and that their parents have to work harder in order to pay for these materials.

As a grandfather, he feels committed to supporting his children by purchasing clothes, uniforms, and shoes so that his grandchildren will look presentable at school and give the impression that they are being cared for by their parents.

Pedro believes that his children are trying their best to provide for his grandchildren and spend quality time with them, but he doesn’t want them to miss any time with their kids because of excessive work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 52-year widowed woman with five children between the ages of 6 and 17. All her children go to school. Rose owns a four-room house where she stays with all her children and with four other family members she takes care of. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.

She owns a shop near her residence where she sells her food items. She says her business is good. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and medical bills. She has been in this business for the last five years. Rose has been with MCDT for eight years, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock.  Rose aspires to see her business grow to enable her to educate all her children up to university.

loans.use: To increase stock of food and be able to serve more customers

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Mrs. Salvacion C.. 63 years old and married with four adult children, joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 to have access to capital for her "sari-sari" or general store. Over the years, her loans have enabled her to expand her business: she sells charcoal, raises pigs and rents out a tricycle that buses passengers around their community.

She is happy that her business continues to flourish, allowing her to make improvements on her house, buy appliances including a television, a karaoke, and a refrigerator, another tricycle to rent out, and send her grandchild to attend college.

She is now requesting PHP 19,500 for her 17th loan to use as additional capital for her general store.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her General Store

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah G. is divorced and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Hannah sells groceries at a market in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1989. Hannah uses her income to pay for food for her children, to pay their school fees and also to pay their utility bills. 

Hannah will use the loan to buy more Milo milk beverage, milk, sugar and so on to fill her shop with items for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to further expand her business.

loans.use: Hannah will use the loan to buy more Milo, milk, sugar and so on

texts.en:
Hadijah is a 45-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 15 and 28. Two of her children go to school, while the other two are working. Hadijah owns a five-room house, where she stays with all her children and another four family members she takes care of. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping and this is the major challenge in her business. 

She rents a stall near her residence where she sells her food items. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food. She has been in this business for the last seven years. Hadijah has been with MCDT for four years, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock and working assets. Rose aspires to see her business grow to enable her to build a commercial house.

loans.name: Mary Rosemond

texts.en:
Mary Rosemond A. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Her husband works with a transport company.

Mary Rosemond sells garden eggs, peppers, apples, and maize at a market in Cape Coast, which she has done for 8 years now. Mary Rosemond uses her income to take care of her family and for other home expenses. Mary Rosemond will use this loan to purchase more food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary Rosemond plans to save towards building a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for resale

loans.name: Peniel 5, 6 Group

texts.en:
