Flavia D. P. (far back, blue shirt) is a committed mother of four children. She runs her own general store business. She sells various items out of a catalog to her customers, ranging from clothing to bracelets to shampoo to household cleaning products. She has been selling these products for some time now, though she is just continuing on her second loan with Esperanza.

In order to see an example of how wonderful of a mother Flavia is, one has only to look at her four children. Her lone daughter is currently attending a university in San F. and one son is studying at a university in Cuba. Another son is currently a professor of education in the Dominican. Much of her extra profits go to supporting her children where she can encourage their education and studies.

Flavia takes the care and love she gives to her children to help them be successful, and has applied these principles to her business. While this business has been steadily growing little by little, Flavia would someday love to own her own store selling only shoes. She enjoys selling various products, but would like to specialize when her money allows.

Thank you for this Kiva loan to Flavia and other Peniel group members! It will go to support small business owners who are dedicated to growing their businesses to create better lives for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To buy products for her general store

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. is married and has three children. She has no educational background. Ama sells groceries and other food supplies at cape coast, which she has done since 1979. Her husband is a pensioner. Ama uses her income to pay for feeding of her children, and also paying of their utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more of the food supplies for resale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to add to her capital to increase her business.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase more of the food supplies for resale at the market.

texts.en:
This is a photo of Isatu S., Posseh C., Mamusu F. and Alpha C.. They named their group Tonkolili Group, after their district of origin. They are small-scale businesspeople in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to improve their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their living standards. 

Isatu S. (second from right) is the leader of this group. Isatu is now age thirty-six, married to a businessman, and they have four children. Two of her children are in primary school and the other two are in secondary school. Isatu was born in Magburaka town, Tonkolili district, but now resides in Makeni where she sells local products like rice, palm-oil, ground-nuts, etc. Isatu has more than five years of experience in business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose E. sells clothes, other fabrics, and so on at a market in Cape Coast. Rose has received senior high education. She is a single parent with four children.

Rose has been selling clothes, fabrics, and so on since the year 2000. She is responsible for paying school fees and the utility bills of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more clothes and fabrics to sell at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards buying a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and fabrics to sell at the market

texts.es:
Los socios del banco comunal “QORICCOYLLOR”; tienen como afinidad, de que todos ellos viven en el mismo barrio, son vecinos del distrito de Santiago, dentro de la provincia del Cusco.

Nuestros socios tiene diferentes actividades, una de ellas es costurera tiene su propio taller, la otra es asistente de contabilidad de una empresa, 2 enfermeras, uno tiene su tienda de abarrotes, otra socia vende verduras y cereales en el mercado, un socio es asistente de antropología, una socia es cocinera para una institución infantil, un socio trabaja en construcción y la otra socia vende carne en el mercado. Todos nuestros socios tienen el deseo de aumentar sus ganancias, muchos de especializarse en lo que estudiaron y otros en invertir para mejorar sus ingresos, para esto solicitaron el dinero.

Nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo que les brindan mediante los préstamos y se comprometen en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, teniendo así su primera experiencia con este tipo de préstamos.
texts.en:
The members of the “QORICCOYLLOR” community bank all live in the same neighbourhood in the district of Santiago, in Cusco province. Our members run various businesses: one is a seamstress with her own workshop, another is an assistant company accountant. Two are nurses, one runs a grocery store while another sells vegetables and cereals at the market. One is an anthropology assistant, one member is a cook at a children's institution, one works in construction and the last sells meat at the market. All our members wish to increase their revenue, many aim to specialise their studies further, while others will invest to increase their earnings using the funds requested. Our members are grateful for the support received through these loans and undertake to make their instalments in accordance with the repayment plan. This is their first experience of this type of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Don Josè Dario, es casado, tiene un niño de 8 años de edad estudiando la primaria, esta solicitando el segundo crèdito con el fondo kiva, para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio pùlperia comprando productos varios y asì poder aumentar su inventario para satisfaser la demanda de los clientes de la comunidad, con su pequeña pulperia ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia pues es con los ingresos que le quedan de esta que les da el sustento diario, ademàs de la pulperia posee un pequeña parcelara donde obtiene otros ingresos de la comercializaciòn de venta de productos de la finca, tambièn se dedica a la actividad de engorde de cerdo; Josè Darìo se caracteriza por ser responsable con los compromisos que adquiere,  ha cumplido siempre con el plan de pago, es un excelente cliente, lider de la comunidad, èl tiene pricipio religioso.
texts.en:
José Dario is married and has an eight year old son who is in elementary school. He is asking for his second loan with Kiva to invest in his small mini market. He will buy various products to increase his inventory to satisfy the demand of the customers in his community. With his small store he has been able to get ahead with his family. The income from the store gives them their daily sustenance. In addition to the mini market, he has a small parcel of land where he gets other income from selling the farm products. Also, he fattens pigs. José Dario is responsible about his commitments. He has always completed his payment plan. He is an excellent client, community leader, and a man who possesses religious principles.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

This is Fatmata F., Kadiatu K., Marie F. and Kadiatu K.. They are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Masuba group. These entrepreneurs have been together as a group for over two years now, collecting loans from Kiva Lenders through SMT and investing those loans into their businesses. Through the help of these loans, they have been able to experience a vast improvement in their lives and businesses. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again asking for a new loan of Le 1,000,000 for each to further improve their businesses.  

Fatmata F. (second from right) is the leader of this group. She is thirty-four years of age, married to a teacher and they have two children. One of her children is now in Junior Secondary School III, and the other is in Senior Secondary School II. Fatmata sells cottons and has been in the business for more than ten years now. With this loan, she will buy a bale of cotton to add to her current stock. A bale of cotton will costs her Le 1,500,000.00 in Freetown. Fatmata will thus have to add some money to the loan in order to buy herself a bale of cotton.

texts.fr: mareme M. est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1997.elle est spécialisée dans la vente de mangues et autres fruits saisonniers.elle sollicite un crédit de cent mille (100 000)frs pour augmenter son fond et diversifier ses produits.elle participe activement a l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Mareme M. has been a client since 1997. She specializes in the sale of mangoes and other seasonal fruits. She is requesting a loan of one hundred thousand (100,000) francs to increase her capital and to diversify her products. She actively participates in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah G. sells groceries and food supplies at the market in Cape Coast, which she has done since 2005. She is single and has no educational background.

Sarah uses her income to pay her utility bills. Sarah will use this loan to purchase more food supplies for resale at the market. Sarah plans to plough the new profits from her expanded business back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for resale at the market

loans.name: Reine \

texts.fr: H. Reine est née vers les années 1976 à Adjara au BENIN. Reine est mariée à AZIZANON Benjamin employé à la société VITAL une société de fabrication d’huile. Reine et Benjamin ont 4 enfants. 3 de ces enfants en âge d’être scolarisé le sont déjà. La famille vit au quartier Ahouassa depuis 16 ans. C’est des diverses (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) et les condiments de sauce que Reine vend. Reine exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans. Reine a commencé par prendre de crédit à ALIDé depuis 2007. Reine est actuellement à son cinquième prêt avec ALIDé. Reine a pu amener son activité au  niveau où elle est grâce aux crédits d’ALIDé. Mais, Reine veut pouvoir faire ses achats en gros, c’est pourquoi  Reine sollicite ce prêt-ci de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Reine was born around 1976 in Adjara, Benin.  She's married to AZIZANON Benjamin, who is employed at VITAL, an oil production company.  She and Benjamin have four children.  Being of school-age, three of them are already in school.  The family has been living in the Ahouassa district for 16 years.  What Reine sells are sauce condiments and various other goods:  candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, candles, etc.  She has been in this business for 8 years. Reine began in 2007 by taking out ALIDé loans.  She's currently on her fifth loan with ALIDé.  She was able to take her business to the level it's at today, thanks to ALIDé loans.  But she wants to be able to buy wholesale.  This is why she's requesting this ALIDé loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of concentrated products; boxes of pasta, detergent, Maggi bouillon cubes (shrimp and chicken); and sauce condiments.

texts.en:
This is a photo of Mariatu K. and Adama S. K. of the Mayanka group. Members of the Mayanka group have benefited from previous Kiva loans. With the help of these SMT/Kiva loans, these women have been able to expand their businesses in size and quality, and to make more sales and better profits. As a result, they can better support their school-going children, feed their families and pay their medical bills. However, Mayanka group members still require a new loan of Le 1,900,000 to further strengthen their businesses.

Mariatu K. (right) is the leader of the group. Mariatu is approximately fifty years of age. She is married to a businessman and they have three children together. One of Mariatu’s daughters is already married, the others are in secondary and primary schools respectively. Mariatu was born in Magburaka but now lives and trades in Makeni city. Mariatu sells market food – ground-nuts, rice, onions, “margi” (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. at Makeni’s second-largest market. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for over thirty years.  With this loan, she will buy four bags of ground-nuts, three bags of imported rice, two bags of home grown rice, two bags of onions, two bags of salt, and three baskets of pepper.

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la Sra. ANA MARIA; ella es natural de Urubamba ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas.

Nuestra socia  tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera con 2 hijos y ella sola alterna sus actividades del hogar con producción de su pequeño terreno de cultivo el cual produce hortalizas, ella vende hortalizas y también se dedica a la crianza de ganados vacunos, este negocio lo conoce muy bien y lo viene haciendo desde hace 30 años, nuestra socia con todo lo que sola produjo pudo comprarse su casita propia, la cual ahora desea implementar más, aumentar cuartos y mejorar su calidad de vida, ella invertirá en su terreno de cultivo, en las semillas, para lo cual requiere el préstamo.

Vemos a la socia en medio de estas otras dos señoras, con chompa delgada de cuello redondo color guinda, lavando verduras en el río con sus amigas, para llevar a vender en el mercado.

Nuestra socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su préstamo en el plazo establecido.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en:
Helina W. is a married woman with four children. She has no educational background. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Helina sells bags of water at Moree Junction near Cape Coast, which she has done since 2006. Helina uses part of her income to support her husband in paying utility bills and school fees of her children. Helina will use this loan to purchase more bags of water for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Helina plans to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of water for resale.

texts.en: Linda is thirty – five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters who are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Linda is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. Linda supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. is married and has five children. She has no educational background. Her husband is a trader.

Ama is a small canteen operator at Moree Junction near Cape Coast, which she has been doing since 1984. Ama uses her income to support the payment of utility bills, and also the school fees of her children.

Ama will use the loan to purchase more cassava, maize, fish and other food supplies which she will need in preparing food for resale at her canteen. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to give a quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia Sabina, es natural de Urubamba ella vive en san isidro chicon.

Nuestra socia tiene 32 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tienen 4 hijos menores, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades como madre con el comercio minorista, ella es una señora muy trabajadora y se dedica actualmente a la crianza de animales porcinos y cuyes  al por mayor y para su futura venta, nuestra socia también tiene en casa un espacio donde vende chicha (bebida a base de maíz), a su vez la socia tiene un terreno dedicado al cultivo de maíz y papa, que en esta fecha están ya limpiando el terreno y regándolo para volver a poner semillas y así tener lista su cosecha para el año entrante, la socia con mucho esfuerzo logró comprarse su terreno propio, y poco a poco lo esta construyendo, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar mayor número de animales a criar y así tener mayor productividad. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner, Sabina, is a native of Urubamba and lives in San Isidro Chicón. She is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and they have 4 young children. She alternates her activities as a mother with retail trade. This hard-working woman currently raises pigs and guinea pigs for wholesale and also has a space in her house where she sells chicha (a drink made from corn). At the same time, our partner has a plot of land for cultivating corn and potatoes, which she is currently clearing and irrigating in order to plant seeds again and have her harvest ready for the coming year. Through a lot of hard work, she managed to buy her own land, and little by little she is building it up, but she requires the loan to buy a greater number of animals to raise and therefore have greater productivity. She is grateful for and values the support, and she is committed to paying off her debt in the established time-frame.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more animals for raising and selling.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells sweet potatoes and pineapples at Moree Junction near Cape Coast. She is a single parent and has no educational background.

Ekua has been selling sweet potatoes and pineapples since 2007. She is responsible for the payment of utility bills. Her loan, which will increase her capital, will be used to buy more of the pineapples and sweet potatoes for sale along the highway. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to give a quality education to her children.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy more pineapples and sweet potatoes to sell

texts.en: Grace is twenty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a girl who is currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Grace is a trader. She is into palm oil production business. She supplies to retailers in her community. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. Grace has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

texts.es: Ivania Azucena U. tiene 62 años. Ella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 18 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio con ropa variada ofrecía su ropa en las comarcas en algunos departamentos, el desafío de Ivania con este negocio fue que no tenia transporte propio por lo que algunas veces se quedaba hospedada en otros lugares y esto le ocasionaba gastos extras que tenía que pagar hospedaje. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como pantalones, camisetas, faldas, calzados y shorts. Su deseo es mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que en las temporadas de lluvia tiene problemas en su casa.
texts.en:
Ivania Azucena U. is a 62 year old woman who enjoys working. For more than 18 years, she has been selling general merchandise. She started selling clothes in different parts of the district, but she didn’t have a way to take her merchandise with her. She would have to incur additional expenses to pay someone to transport her goods. In most of the places where she went, she was already paying a hosting fee to secure a space where she could sell her products.

Ivania has requested a loan to use as working capital to buy trousers, shirts, skirts, shoes, and shorts. She hopes to make repairs to the roof of her house because she experiences problems during the rainy season.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina is 47years old she is married and mother of three children. Currently two of her children are schooling in the community where they live.  She works very hard to support the husband in taking care of the home. Currently she trades in tambourine. Tambourine is mostly used by the churches for praising God. She makes market mostly on Sundays and hawks through various churches both near and wide to make sales. She has been in the business for the last three years with lots of experienced. She is requesting the support of the loan to buy bulk supply of the tambourine to meet the high demand of her customers.  She hopes to repay the loan in time. She again dreams to use her profit to provide quality education for the children.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of tambourine.

texts.en: Opoku is forty-eight years old. He is married and has six children, four sons and two daughters, who are all still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Opoku is a trader. He trades in foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, maize, etc. He sells in his community and also supplies other food vendors. Opoku procures the goods from nearby communities. He has been in business for seventeen years and wants a loan to buy food items in bulk to expand his business.

Faustina is thirty-seven years old and married with four children. Currently all are in school. She is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils, cookware, plastic buckets, bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She mostly sells through hawking, which is house-to-house selling. She has been trading for five years now.  She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She is asking for a loan to increase her inventory of products like cooking utensils, rubber buckets, etc., which are frequently requested by her numerous customers. With the loan she believes she will be in a better position to make enough profit to eventually build a store, which would reduce the frequent walking on the street to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two sons and one daughter, who are all still in school. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. Beatrice lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, maize, etc. Beatrice sells in her community and also supplies other food vendors. She procures the goods from nearby communities. Beatrice has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy food items in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs in bulk

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta N. sells kenkey at Moree Junction near Cape Coast. Benedicta has received a junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a teacher.

Benedicta has been selling kenkey since 2007. She is responsible for paying her utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more maize for cooking her kenkey, as well as firewood, rappers, and gari to sell at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy more maize for cooking kenkey, and firewood, rappers, and gari to sell at the market

texts.en:
Theresa is forty-three years old and married with three children. All her children are in school. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the children. She prepares and bakes bread. She started her operations with her mother when she was a little girl.  In spite of the challenges she faces, she has managed to acquire a portion of land where she wants to build her own house. It is her bread business that brings hope to the family and support from her husband. She has customers who come to her to buy in bulk. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials to meet the demand. She requests a loan to allow her to remain in business, and she also wants to save some of her profits for her children's education. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Dependable’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral in order to access the loan, and peer pressure to repay the loan.

texts.es: La Señora Rosa Argentina M. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Rosa tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. Sus propósitos son de seguir con su negocio adelante para sacar adelante a su familia ya que es difícil mantener la situación económica en la que ella se encuentra por  lo que tiene que ayudar a pagar los estudios universitarios de su hijo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda ella inicia este negocio porque necesitaba un medio que le generara ingresos para su familia y acude a vender ciertos productos como son los granos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de arroz, aceite, golosinas en general. Sus deseos son de seguir luchando para darle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que sus deseos son de transformar su casa y darle un lugar adecuado donde vivir a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Argentina M. is 53 years old, married, and has 1 child who she still supports. She wants to continue moving her business forward because it is difficult for her to maintain her family’s financial situation when she has to help pay for her child’s college education. Doña Rosa manages a grocery store out her modest home in order to generate income for her family. She sells various products such as grain.

The loan Doña Rosa is requesting will be used as working capital to buy rice, oil and candy. She hopes to continue pressing forward so that she can make improvements to her home and give her children a suitable place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana A. is married and has one child. She has received a junior high school education. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Adriana sells cooked rice and stew at Moree Junction near Cape Coast, which she has been doing since 2008. Adriana uses her income to support her husband in the upkeep of her family. Adriana will use this loan to purchase rice, oil, canned tomatoes, and so on to prepare her food for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adriana plans to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase rice, oil, canned tomatoes, and so on to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Adom Bi Apuei Group

texts.en:
Enoch is thirty (30) years old he is married and father of two children. One is currently in school whiles his last born is still breastfeeding. He currently lives with his family and he is a trader who trades in assorted footwear’s. He takes stock of goods from Togo and some time Accra in Ghana. He makes sure he purchased good ones to attract customers. He needs the support of the loan to buy additional stock of footwear’s. With the loan he believes he can have variety of them to retain his customers. He would be grateful for your assistance.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Adom Bi Apuei’. He is the one sitting in the group photograph. The members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of footwear’s.

texts.en: Mohammed is thirty – eight years old. He is married and has given birth to six children, four sons and two daughters who are all still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Mohammed is a trader. He trades in cereals such as beans, maize, etc. He sells in his community and also supplies to other food vendors. Mohammed procures the goods from nearby communities. He has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy cereals in bulk to expand his business.

loans.name: Ena Del Rosario

texts.es:
Doña Ena del Rosario L. B., es madre soltera, de 31 años de edad, que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia con mucho esfuerzo, amor y carácter.

Caracterizada por las cualidad más sobresaliente de la mujer Nicaragüense (Trabajadoras y luchadoras). Ena con la ayuda de sus hijos ha mantenido por más de 6 años sus negocios en pie y sin fracaso.

Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de refrescos típicos de la ciudad; También vende repostería; Esto lo hace en el mercado turístico de Masaya. En un puesto que con mucho esmero pudo adquirir

Aún que han pasado dificultades, la disciplina y honestidad les han ayudado a permanecer, además de eso Ena compra y vende ropa por encargo en su comunidad. Ella las compra en el mercad de Managua al por mayor y luego la vende al detalle a sus clientes.

Con su crédito pretende seguir creciendo en las cosas que ofrece en su puesto en el mercado. Además invertir en la compra de ropa para la venta de la misma.
texts.en:
Doña Ena del Rosario L. B. is a 31 year old single mother who has managed to support her family with much effort, love and character. She is known to have the outstanding qualities of most Nicaraguan women (being hard workers and fighters). With the help of her children, Ena has managed to stay in business for more than 6 years without fail.

She makes traditional refreshments and sells them in the city, as well as pastries. She carefully selected a vending post in the tourist market in Masaya, where she offers her products.

Even though she has faced difficulties in the past, discipline and honesty has helped Ena stay on track. In addition, she buys and sells clothing upon request in her community. She acquires her merchandise at the wholesale market in Managua and then sells them to her customers at a retail markup.

With her loan, Ena will continue to offer more products from her refreshment stand at the market. At the same, she will invest in more clothing for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her various businesses

texts.en: Joyce is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl, who are both still in school. She works very hard to help her husband provide for the family. Joyce lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. Joyce cooks and sells rice and stew in the morning on the street in her community. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. Joyce has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: For the past four years, Constance has been trading in palm oil. She is 37 year old woman, married three children who are schooling. She treks to Asamang, a town in the Eastern region of Ghana to purchase her palm oil from the producers in bulk and retail to her customers. She treks them to Accra and Togo to trade and she can no longer buy enough quantities. She hopes the loan will enable to inject more capital into the business to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk gallons of palm oil to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy bulk gallons of palm oil.

texts.es:
El socio Michael, es natural de Urubamba, vive en el barrio de san isidro de chicon.

Nuestro socio tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos menores aún, el alterna su labro de padre de familia con su pasión la carpintería, el actualmente trabaja en una carpintería como obrero, su deseo es tener su propia carpintería, pero mientras tanto el está aprendiendo mucho sobre está actividad, el socio tiene su pequeño terreno propio y el mismo ha construido sus habitaciones y muebles en su casita, tiene también  un triciclo de carga, el cual le permite un ingreso extra por que lo alquila, para mudanzas o para transportar algunas cosas pesadas. Nuestro socio requiere el préstamo para poder comprar material para construir unos andamios.

El socio esta sumamente agradecido con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Michael is from Urubamba, and he lives in the San Isidro de Chicon neighborhood. He is 27, in a common law marriage, and has two minor children. He alternates his work as father of a family with his passion for carpentry. He currently works in a carpentry shop as a workman. His wish is to have his own carpentry shop. Meanwhile, he is learning a lot about this activity. He has his own small piece of land where he himself has built the rooms and the furniture in his house. He also has a tricycle, which he rents out for moves or to transport heavy things. This allows him to have an extra income. He needs the loan to be able to buy material to build some scaffolding. He is completely grateful for the loan, and he promises to complete the payment of his debt on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

Agnes is thirty – eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children, one daughter and two sons who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her children as she dreams to give them better future. She lives with her children in a rented apartment. She sells and distributes palm nuts from to her loyal customers. Palm nuts fruits is used to produced soap, food and many others. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities. Agnes has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Kwame is 35 years old and unmarried. He is a business-minded young man. He trades in phone accessories like mobile phone chips, phone units, cell phones and so on. He identified this business as an opportunity, and now provides his customers with phone products. Kwame started this business four years ago with a small amount of money. He is jovial and has a very good approach to his work. He buys his stock of goods from Accra. He requests a loan to increase his inventory and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy phone units, mobile phone chips, phone accessories etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: For the past ten years, Rebeca has been trading in palm oil. She is 40 year old woman, married six children who are schooling. She treks to Asamang, a town in the Eastern region of Ghana to purchase her palm oil from the producers in bulk and retail to her customers. She treks them to Accra to trade and she can no longer buy enough quantities. She hopes the loan will enable to inject more capital into the business to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk gallons of palm oil to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy bulk gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. sells toffees, biscuits and gari at Moree Junction near Cape Coast. Aba has no educational background. She is married and has five children.

Aba has been selling toffees, biscuits and gari since 2007. She is responsible for paying the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more toffees, gari and biscuits for resale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: To buy more toffees, gari and biscuits for resale at the market

texts.es:
María Eugenia B. de 23 años de edad, es una mujer de negocios, según ella misma nos dice. “Desde muy chavala me ha gustado ganar dinero propio” dice María Eugenia; Por lo tanto, viviendo en una de las calles principales de Masaya, no dudó en iniciar un negocio propio. 

Así fue como decidió, vender productos variados, especialmente accesorios para celulares,  controles remotos, reloj, entre otros. Ena tiene ya tres años de estar administrando este negocio y ha sido exitoso, aunque se enfrentando a situaciones difíciles, ella cree que con ánimo y disciplina se logra al final el éxito. 

Es su cuarto ciclo en ADIM y se siente muy agradecida por que le dieron la oportunidad de poder ir mejorando su negocio. Su crédito pretende invertirlo en la compra de una variedad de gorras que tienen mucha demanda por parte de los jóvenes y unos estilos de reloj que le han encargado sus clientes.

La socia  Raymunda, es natural de Pisac en el distrito de Calca, ubicado en el valle sagrado de los inkas, ella actualmente reside en la provincia de Urubamba.

Nuestra socia tiene 53 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 6 hijos cinco de ellos ya tienen sus propias familias, la socia vive con su esposo y el menor de sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, tiene entre sus responsabilidades la crianza de  animales menores (cuyes, ovinos, gallinas) y mayores (vacas toros y terneros), también la socia tiene su stand en su casa en el cual venden chicha (debida a base de maíz), a su ves ella tiene un terreno de cultivo de maíz, papas y hortalizas. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más animalitos menores.

Nuestra socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Member Raymunda is natural from Pisac, in the Calca district, which is located in the Inkas’ sacred valley. She currently lives in the province of Urubamba. Our partner is 53 years old, married, and has 6 children. Five of them already have their own family. She lives with her husband and her younger child.

She dedicates herself to retail trade. Among her responsibilities is the breeding of animals both small (guinea pigs, sheep, chicken) and big (cows, bulls and calf). In addition, our partner has a small shop in her house where she sells “chicha” (a traditional beverage made out of corn). At the same time, she has a crop of corn, potatoes and vegetables.

Our partner requires the loan to buy more small animals. She thanks for the loan and commits to pay her debits on time.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Hernando Eulogio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Hernando Eulogio C. le está haciendo falta la lisa de concreto en la planta alta de la casa, estos cuartos son para sus hijos que son su responsabilidad ya que está separado de su esposa. 
Esta solicitando es préstamo para realizar la mejora ya que en esté momento no cuanta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la elaboración de la losa. Ya que desea que sus hijos tenga su propio espacio en la casa.
El señor Hernando Eulogio trabaja como inspector de una escuela, este es el ingreso que el genera para darles lo mejor a su familia, y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo.

loans.use: Colocación de la losa de concreto en la planta alta

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. sells egg at wholesale at Moree Junction near Cape Coast. Mary has no educational background. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Mary has been selling eggs at wholesale since 2004. She supports her husband in paying utility bills and the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to purchase more eggs in crates to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business towards building a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs in crates to sell

texts.es: Olga Marina Méndez tiene 49 años. Ella dio inicio con su pulpería hace más de 18 años. Y con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado obtener nuevos productos para su pulpería, la mayoría de sus clientes son sus propios vecinos, Olga se levanta muy temprano para realizar las tareas del hogar y dedicarse a sus hijos, es una madre muy responsable que le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que disfruta hablar con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos de consumo diarios, detergentes, jabón, cosméticos y refrescos. El mayor sueño de Olga es convertir su negocio en una pequeña distribuidora en donde ofrezca lo necesario.
texts.en:
Olga Marina Méndez is 49 years old and has been operating a grocery store for the past 18 years. With the help of financing, she has managed to obtain new products for her business. Most of her customers are her own neighbors. Olga wakes up early in the morning to perform household chores and then spends time with her children. She is a very responsible mother who enjoys her work and talking with her customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to buy everyday consumer products, detergents, soaps, cosmetics, and soft drinks. Olga dreams of converting her business into a small distribution center that offers all the basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte M. sells corn bread at moree junction near cape coast. Charlotte has received junior high education.  She is married and has two children .Her husband is a carpenter. Charlotte has been selling corn bread since 2006. She supports her husband in the payment of her children’s school fees. Her loan will be use to purchase more maize, sugar, and fire wood to bake her corn bread for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to give quality education to her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be use to purchase more maize, sugar, and fire wood to bake her corn bread for sale.

loans.name: María Beatriz Adriana

texts.es:
La señora María Beatriz Adrián C. tiene ya más de un año con su salón de belleza el cual es un fuente de ingresos, ya que su esposo el señor  Juan José Salazar trabaja en una compañía de trasporte en el departamento de chofer de camión estos son los ingreso que ellos tiene para  darles lo mejor a su familia.
Al negocio le está haciendo falta variedad de artículos de belleza y acondicionar el local ya que lo tiene establecido en un cuarto de su casa, para no desatender a sus hijos ya que tiene cuatro y están en la edad de la adolescencia y necesitan mucha atención. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y así su negocio crecerá más y con los ingresos que genera el negocio pagara el crédito ya quien se encargara de los gastos familiares será el señor Juan José.
texts.en:
Sra. María Beatriz Adrián C. has been operating her beauty salon for more than a year. Her business helps to supplement the income of her husband, Juan José Salazar, who works as a company truck driver. With their two incomes, they try their best to provide for their family.

Her business lacks a variety of beauty products. It is established in a room in her house because she has a four year old and a teenager, and they require much attention. Sra. María is requesting a loan so that she can grow her business. The income she generates will be used to make her payments. The earnings of Sr. Juan José will take care of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her beauty salon business

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
El socio Freddy, es natural de Urubamba, el vive aquí todo su vida.

El socio tiene 34 años de edad, y es conviviente, el tiene 3 hijos y alterna sus actividades con el trabajo en las municipalidades y trabajos particulares como albañil, cuando no está trabajando en obras el está en sus tierras, sembrando, podando, fertilizando y o cosechando, el es también agricultor, nuestro socio requiere el préstamo en razón de invertir en sus terrenos para un nuevo cultivo y una nueva producción, que inicia en septiembre de este año.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Freddy is a member and a native of Urubamba who has lived here all of his life. He is 34 years old and lives with his partner and three children. He alternates between working in the city and private jobs such as building; when not working on jobs, he is on his land, planting, pruning, fertilizing, and harvesting. Because he is also a farmer, Freddy requires a loan in order to invest in his land for a new crop and a new growing season, which will begin in September of this year. Freddy appreciates and values the loan given to him, and he commits to repaying his debts within the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and plow the earth for one growing season.

loans.name: Exodus Group

texts.en:
Doris is 42 years old and she is married and the mother of three children. All her children are currently schooling.

Doris always works hard to meet her targets and through that she has acquired lots of marketing and selling experience. She is a trader, selling her goods on a table in the main community market. She sells vegetables and spices like cabbages, tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding villages and retails them to her customers. She is requesting the loan to buy lots of cabbages, carrots, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables to upgrade her stock.

Doris is the leader of a trust bank group called “Exodus”. The members of this group are petty traders, food vendors, etc.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to upgrade her stock

loans.name: Nyame Bekyre Group

texts.en:
Matilda is 28 years old trader; she is divorcee and mother with four children. Her children are currently in the school. She trades in tubers of yam, maize,cassava etc. on top of table in the local market where she lives. She says through this business, she has endeavored to support her children in school. She requests for the loan to enable her buy increased stock of yam, cereals like maize, vegetables etc. to grow up her business to scale up the business progress. She hopes to increase her savings to support the child education to give him future and hope.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Bekyre’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: She wants the loan to buy increased stock of tubers of yam, cassava and maize etc.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita P. has successfully completed three group loan cycles and is looking to start her first individual loan cycle as an Esperanza associate. Benita lives in San Pedro de Macoris, an area in the southeast of the Dominican Republic where electricity and running water are unreliable, if available at all. She is looking forward to this loan through Esperanza International in order to invest more into her business.

Benita currently runs a small restaurant called Comedor Kirsy that she hopes to expand by buying more rice, beans, and flour to be able to service more clients. With the increased business, she will finish the living room in her house to provide her family with an improved living area. Through this loan, she will be getting closer to her dream of one day opening a bakery. Benita would like to thank you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, and beans for her restaurant

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La socia Silvia, es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, ubicada en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los inkas.

La socia tiene 34 años de edad, es  conviviente y tiene 3 hijos ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, la socia se dedica a administrar sus terrenos de cultivo y después vende su producción al por mayor, ella también cría animales menores pero para uso personal, la socia pidió el préstamo para comprar mejor semilla y limpiar sus tierras del mismo modo que desea abonar sus tierras y de este modo mejorar su producción.

Nuestra socia está muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado comprometiéndose a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Silvia, a member of Asociación Arariwa, is a native of the province of Urubamba, Peru, in the heart of the ancient Incan empire’s Sacred Valley.

Silvia lives with her long-time partner and three daughters. She alternates her housework with agriculture, cultivating her farmland and then selling her produce in bulk. She also raises small animals, but solely for personal use. Silvia has requested a loan in order to buy better seeds and to clear and fertilize her land, which will improve her yield.

Our member is very grateful and appreciates the loan granted to her. She has committed to paying off her debt within the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Alice Geglio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her farm's yield with seeds and fertilizer.

texts.es:
Gloria del Carmen M., Dina Ruth C. R. y José Humberto G. L. son los integrantes del grupo Los artesanos. Originarios de la comarca las Flores ubicada a tres Kilómetros de la Ciudad de Masaya, característica por la manera como sus habitantes trabajan la artesanía de Cuero.

Gloria M. de 31 años de edad, es artesana de familia. Inicio su trabajo desde muy joven, ya que sus padres y abuelos trabajaban en esto. No obstante, nos dice Gloria que después de casarse decidió empezar a trabajar en la Zona franca de Tipitapa; Pero se dio cuenta que eran mejor los ingresos en sus artesanías y decidió salirse e iniciar el negocio.

Desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y pretende seguir invirtiendo, actualmente elabora bolsos y fajas de cuero y los vende en el mercado turístico de Masaya. Pero no cubre la demanda que tiene de dichos bolso. Por tanto su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima.

Dina Ruth C. R. posee una pulpería la cual administra desde hace 9 años y José Humberto G. L. trabaja en la elaboración de Artesanías de cuero desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
Gloria del Carmen M., Dina Ruth C. R., and José Humberto G. L. are the members of the group “Los Artesanos” (The Artesans). They are originally from the region of Las Flores, which is located three kilometers from the city of Masaya. Most of the residents in that area design leather handicrafts.

Gloria M. is 31 years old and comes from a family of handicraft artists. She started working at a young age, just as her parents and grandparents did. After she got married, she decided to get a job at La Zona Franca (an industrial area where companies hire laborers to process goods for export) in Tipitapa. She realized that she earned a better income making handicrafts, so she quit her job and started her own business.

Since then, she has done very well and intends to continue investing in her business. She currently produces leather purses and belts and then sells them in the tourist market in Masaya. However, she is not able to keep up with the demand for leather purses. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy raw materials.

Dina Ruth C. R. has a grocery store that she has managed for 9 years. José Humberto G. L. also makes leather crafts and has been in business for 3 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Awurade Wope Enyeho Group

texts.en:
Grace is a 21 years old local restaurant operator she is single and has no child. She started her operations three years ago. She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals she has attracted lots of customers in the area where she served. Therefore it has become necessary to employ additional hands to assist her in food delivering service. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare his meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Awurade Wope Enyeho’ which literary means ‘God let your will be done’. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Upper Traders Group

texts.en:
Vida is 46 years old she is married and given birth to six children. Currently they are all in school. She sells porridge at her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taking with what we called Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise good income to support her kids in school.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Upper Traders’ which. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

texts.es:
El grupo Xiomara está formado por tres productores y vendedores de verduras y frutas; Ellos provienen de  la ciudad de Masaya, de zonas aledañas donde el principal rubro es el cultivo de las tierras.

Rosa Esther M. D., es la coordinadora del grupo, a sus 39 años es una productora de frutas y verduras, que conoció ADIM hace 3 años y desde entonces ha mejorado los ingresos por sus productos.

Ella distribuye sus productos en el mercado oriental de Managua. Está muy contenta con su trabajo, tiene nueve ciclos de estar trabajando con el grupo Xiomara y han sido muy responsables con sus créditos por que sus negocios son muy  buenos. Su crédito lo invertirá en lo que cosecha de esta temporada.

Rosa Esther M. D. distribuye en el mercado Roberto Huembes de Managua y Elsa María M.  distribuye en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The group Xiomara consists of three farmers who grow and sell fruits and vegetables. They come from the city of Masaya where the main line of work is agriculture.

Rosa Esther M. D. is 39 years old and is the group coordinator. She is a fruits and vegetables farmer who has worked with ADIM (micro-finance institution) for three years and, since then, has increased her income.

She sells her products at the oriental market in Managua and she is very happy with her work. She has had nine loans with the Xiomara group. They have been very responsible with their loans and their businesses are doing very good. They will invest this loan in this year’s harvest.

Maribel Del Carmen S. sells her products at the Roberto Huembes market in Managua and Elsa María M. sells her products at the market in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: God's Grace Group

texts.en:
Victoria is 33years old she is single and mother of a child. Her child is currently in school. She is determined to provide for her children through hard work and commitment. To support her child, she has been selling cosmetics, jewelry with products like spray, powder, blouses, lip stick, necklace, bracelets etc. and sells through hawking. She sells these cosmetics in the neighborhood to her loyal clients. And she takes delivery of stock from Accra which is a nearby town. She says selling of these products is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her make good income to sponsor her child education. She is so sure that your loan support will bring her to the desired results she expects.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘God’s Grace’ which. She is the one sitting in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetics and jewelry products.

texts.es: Verónica de la Concepción S. M. tiene 32 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la vena de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad económica. Lo más difícil para ella fue conseguir clientes por lo que tenía que salir a vender sus productos y con el tiempo fue obteniendo suficientes clientes. Verónica tiene mucho carisma y eso es lo que más les gusta a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para damas, para caballeros, niños, cosméticos, toallas, sabanas y colonias. El deseo de Verónica es terminar de construir su casa que por proporcionarla a sus hijos lo necesario no ha podido comprar los materiales.
texts.en:
Verónica de la Concepción S. M. is 32, married, and she has three children. For over six years she has sold general merchandise. The most difficult part for her was getting customers. She had to leave to sell her products. In time she got enough customers. Verónica has a lot of charisma, and this is what her customers like best. The money she is asking for is for working capital to buy clothes for women, men, and children. She will also buy cosmetics, towels, sheets, and cologne. Verónica’s dream is to finish building her house. Providing the necessities for her children has not allowed her to buy the materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Lizzeth Zoraida

texts.es: LIZZETH ZORAIDA A. T., es una persona joven y madre desde los 16 años, ahora su hijo tiene 8 años y tiene el negocio con el que mantiene a su hijo y a ella misma, es la segunda secuencia que saca el prestramo ella es una cliente responsable con sus pagos y tiene un carisma especial, trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 22:00 y no se mueve de su puesto ubicado en una de las zonas con mas movimiento de nuestra ciudad. Ella vive solo con su hijo en un pequeño ambiente en alquiler.

loans.use: Invertira en la compra de nuevo kiosco para venta de golosinas

texts.es: Luis Alberto T. R. tiene 42 años. Es un  hombre muy responsable y que disfruta mucho de su trabajo. La actividad económica que el realiza es la pesca artesanal. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este humilde trabajo. Anteriormente Luis laboraba en un barco pero necesita más ingresos para proporcionarles a sus hijos y a su esposa lo necesario ya que con lo que ganaba no era suficiente, mas tarde decide ahorrar y así comprar su propia lancha. El financiamiento que Luis solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales y materiales de equipo de pesca. El deseo de Luis poder obtener un establecimiento en donde pueda ofrecer los productos de pesca.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: El señor Victor F. tiene una vagoneta, que hace trabajar como taxi libre con un conductor asalariado. Victor una persona joven, además, es chofer hace siete años y trabaja en el Sindicato de Minibuses Señor de Mayo. Su esposa es la señora Epifania Callisaya que vende salchipapas y hamburguesas en la Av. 31 de Octubre. Ellos tienen 2 hijos pequeños que estan en la escuela primaria. La familia F. vive en zona San Antonio. Uno de los sueños de Victor y Epifania es ver que un día sus hijos sean profesionales. Ellos son unos padres muy responsables y dedicados con su familia. El préstamo que solicita Victor es para realizar un cambio de Gasolina a Gas Natural de su automovil.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor F. has a van which he uses in his work as a salaried taxi driver. Victor is young but has already worked as a driver for seven years, and is currently a member of the Señor de Mayo Minibus Union. His wife, Mrs. Epifania Callisaya, sells hamburgers, sausages, and French fries on la Avenida 31 de Octubre. They have two small children in primary school and live in San Antonio. One of Victor's and Epifania's dreams is to see their children become educated professionals. They are very responsible parents and dedicated to their family. Victor is asking for a loan to convert his van to run on natural gas rather than gasoline.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Conversion of van to run on natural gas rather than gasoline.

texts.en:
Miledys A. is an Esperanza associate who has successfully completed one loan cycle and is greatly looking forward to receiving a second loan. Miledys, her husband, and her four grandchildren live in a wooden house with a tin roof in Boca Chica, a city in the Southeast of the Dominican Republic where running water and electricity are unreliable.
She owns a bakery, run from a small shop a few blocks from her house, and hopes to use the funds from this loan to buy sugar and flour in larger quantities to receive a better price and to be able to bake more items. From the increased earnings she will receive from this loan, she hopes to gain enough money to add cement to her house as well as ensure prosperous education and health for herself and her grandchildren. Miledys would like to thank Esperanza and all the donors for helping this dream become a reality.

texts.es:
El grupo Dios de Salvación es originario de la Comarca las flores, está a unos kilómetros de la ciudad de Masaya, y pues se caracterizan como grupo por trabajar en la compra de frutas y verduras en zonas aledañas, a pequeños productores y luego las venden en los diferentes mercados del país.

Katy S. es la coordinadora del grupo Dios de Salvación, a sus 23 años,  ha aprendido de su familia el negocio de la compra y venta de frutas y verduras. Dado que la zona es especial para ese tipo de negocios, ha podido aprender con facilidad el oficio y sacar el máximo provecho de éste.

Su crédito lo invertirá en productos de la temporada como lo son el mamón, el nancite entre otros. Fidelina Del Carmen C. 34 años y Meyling del Carmen G. C. 22 años también trabajan en el mismo tipo de negocio y forman parte del grupo. Las tres distribuyen en diferentes zonas del país.

La señora Maria del Socorro O. tiene 39 años de edad. Ella es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian y están a su cargo. La actividad economía de Maria es la venta y destace de cerdo. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cerdos en su vivienda pero al tener muy pocos clientes decide conseguir un puesto en el mercado a pesar de ser Madre y Padre para sus hijos ha logrado salir adelante ya que fue muy difícil dejar a sus hijos mientras ella tenía que trabajar. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra  de cerdos. Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda y obtener un triciclo para el transporte de los cerdos.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro O. is 39. She is a single mother, and she has two children who go to school. Maria butchers and sells pork. She previously sold pigs at her house. But, because she had very few customers she decided to get a place at the market. In spite of being mother and father to her children, she has been able to get ahead. It was very hard to leave her children while she had to work. She is asking for a loan for working capital to buy pigs. Her wish is to improve her house and get a tricycle to transport the pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Aydalina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aydalina L. es originaria de la Ciudad de Masaya. Este Departamento está ubicado en el pacífico de Nicaragua y es uno de los principales centros de turismo y por ende de comercio del país.

Aydalina tiene 35 años de edad y trabaja junto con su esposo en el negocio de elaboración de calzado típico y calzado fino desde hace 8 años. Sus zapatos se venden en el mercado de artesanías de la ciudad y algunos son exportados fuera del país. Que son los zapatos más finos que ellos fabrican.

Este negocio data de muchos años atrás y lo aprendieron de sus padres; Ella tiene dos niños pequeños y por ellos han sido muy esforzados. Trabajó en un grupo solidario y pasó a individual por su record crediticio. Con el negocio han podido mejorar su casa; Su crédito lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima y poder producir más.
texts.en:
Aydalina Lopez lives in the city of Masaya. This Department is located on Nicaragua's Pacific Coast and is one of the country's main tourism destinations and thus an important center of commerce. Aydalina is 35 years old and has worked with her husband manufacturing typical and fine shoes for the past 8 years. They sell their shoes in the city's artesanal market and some, their finest, are exported outside the country. This business has been around for a long time; they learned from their parents. She has two small children and they are the reason they are so dedicated to their work. She began in a solidarity group and, thanks to her credit record, now works as an individual. Their business success has allowed them to make improvements on their home. This loan will be used to purchase raw materials in order to increase their production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoe making raw materials

loans.name: Nuevo Por Venir 1 Group

texts.en:
Maridanes is the group coordinator of the group Nuevo Por Venir (New to come) based in Las Galetas, a neighborhood surrounding the city of San Pedro in south of the Dominican Republic. Here she makes her home with her five children (three boys and two girls) and her husband. Additionally, they are expecting a boy in two months. Her home is maD. of wood, with a metal roof and cement floor that has begun to show some wear over the ages. Domestic services such as electricity are very unreliable.

With this new loan Maridanes aims to continue growing her business selling bedspreads and shoes. She plans to do this by purchasing more in bulk to obtain a better price. In addition, she has identified a need in her community for someone who sells eggs and lentils, especially around dinner time, and she will begin stocking both items.

With the increased income that she expects, she hopes to improve both her floor and her roof as well as to one day buy the house she lives in. Additionally, she plans to invest in her children through education and proper nutrition in the hopes that they will one day be doctors or engineers. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bedspreads and shoes as well as eggs and lentils

texts.es: José Luis es un joven de 20 años, se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y al alquiler de uno de los dos motocarros que tiene, los cuales adquirió a de base a mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, pues siendo tan joven es muy responsable, quiere progresar y forjarse un futuro mejor. Generalmente alquila su motocarro por día y con el otro trabaja él mismo desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Su actividad es agotadora, pues tiene que ir de un lado para otro según le indiquen sus clientes, además el ruido que hace el motor es muy incómodo, pero José Luis ha sabido sobrellevar muy bien estos pequeños inconvenientes y ponerle mucho más empeño a su labor, ya que su fin es tener una flota de mototaxis para consolidar así una empresa de transportes. Pero eso no es todo, ya que a José Luis también le agrada mucho la cocina y otro de sus sueños es tener un restaurante especializado en ceviche, para ello ya está buscando un terreno, tanto para guardar sus vehículos, como para su futura cevichería. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos, con el dinero que solicita hará el pago inicial para comprar otro motocarro.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is a 20-year-old young man who has two mototaxis, one of which he drives to transport passengers and the other he rents out. He acquired these vehicles through much effort and dedication because, though young, he is very responsible and wants to get ahead and make a better future for himself. He usually rents out one of his mototaxis on a daily basis and he drives the other one from very early in the morning until 8 at night. This is very exhausting work because he must go from one end of town to the other according to his passengers' wishes. Besides, the noise of the engine is very uncomfortable but Jose Luis has been able to rise above these inconveniences and work hard towards his ultimate goal of having a fleet of mototaxis thereby forming a transportation company. But that's not all. Jose Luis also loves to cook and another of his dreams is to have a restaurant specializing in ceviche and he is already looking for a piece of property that would be appropriate for his restaurant and to store his mototaxis. This is his first loan with MFP and he pledges to be punctual with his payments. These funds will be used as a down payment for the purchase of an additional mototaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Batey Nuevo Group 1 & 2

texts.en:
Yonery is the group coordinator of the group Batey Nuevo (New Batey) which is based in a Batey – a small agricultural village centered around sugarcane harvesting in the area surrounding San Pedro de Macoris in the Dominican Republic. Here she makes her home with her husband and three children aged 6, 4 and 3.

Yonery is on her third loan with Esperanza and with this new loan she plans to continue improving her business selling underwear in her community. She intends to purchase larger amounts of merchandise so as to have resources available to fill orders when they come in.

With the profits that she gains from this loan, Yonery’s goal in the short term is to purchase backpacks and folders for her children to use in school. In the medium term her plan is to purchase two goats to breed and use for milk to feed her family. In the long term her goal is to send her children to university and to purchase her own house in Quisqeya (a nearby town), to help her family leave the Batey (where the sugar company owns the house), thus escaping the cycle of poverty that plagues Bateys. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear to sell

texts.es: María es una madre muy trabajadora, tiene 46 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su pequeña bebé, en su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica al alquiler de lavadoras, actividad que consiste en arrendar sus máquinas de lavado a las personas que se lo solicitan, quienes se las llevan a sus casas para lavar sus prendas, por lo que le pagan a María un monto determinado, según el tiempo de alquiler y luego se la devuelven. Posteriormente, con un préstamo de MFP, María logró comprar otra lavadora y ahora tiene 5, por lo que se siente muy satisfecha, pues su negocio le resulta mucho más rentable. María está feliz porque sabe que poco a poco sus sueños se van haciendo realidad y ella espera poder alcanzarlos todos, por el bienestar de su pequeña hija y de su familia. Esta es su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos, tal como lo hizo en el ciclo anterior. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará otra lavadora para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a hard-working mother of a small baby. She lives with her partner and father of her child in her own home. For the past 4 years she has rented washing machines. This activity consists in her renting washing machines to those who request them who take them to their homes for a determined amount of time and pay an agreed rental fee according to the time they will use them and then return the machines to her. With a previous MFP loan, Maria purchased an additional washing machine bringing her total to 5 which has brought her much satisfaction and increased profits. Maria is happy because she knows that her dreams are little by little coming true and she hopes to reach all her goals for the well-being of her daughter and her family. This will be her second loan with PRISMA Microfinances and she promisses to be very punctual with her repayments such as she was with her previous loan. With these funds she will purchase yet another washing machine to further grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Zenaida tiene 29 años, vive con su hija Aní de 9 años de edad. Ella es natural de la ciudad de Huánuco (departamento en la zona central del país), vino a la ciudad de Lima hace 10 años, tiempo en el cual se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa. Esta actividad que le brinda los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos de su pequeña, quien es su razón de vivir. Zenaida es muy trabajadora, siempre trata de dar más de sí en todo lo que hace, pues sabe que si se esfuerza mucho cosechará grandes frutos. Felizmente, hasta ahora, esta filosofía de vida le ha dado buenos resultandos, ya que cada vez obtiene más clientela, pues Zenaida tiene un trato cálido y ofrecer prendas de muy buen gusto. Su deseo a futuro es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas en un gran mostrador y espera que con su esfuerzo estos sueños se puedan hacer realidad. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir con motivos primaverales, ya que se acerca esta estación.

El Grupo Solidario Mujeres Responsables está conformado por Justina Antonia Soriano B. y Modesta del Socorro G. M. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Ambas tienen diferentes actividades económicas Justina se dedica a la venta de refrescos ella se levanta muy temprano para una buena cantidad de refrescos para la variedad de clientes ambas son muy humildes, pero siempre están luchando para salir adelante con sus negocios. Ella quieren proporcionarle la oportunidad a cada uno de sus hijos para que el día de mañana logren estudiar. Ellas solicitan este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos para cada uno de sus negocios. El sueño que comparten es mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Responsables (Responsible Women) Solidarity Group is made up by Justina Antonia Soriano Briceno and Modesta del Socorro G. M.. Each one of them has slightly different economic activities: Modesta sells second-hand clothing and Justina sells soft drinks. Justina starts her day very early in the morning when she fetches a large quantity of soft drinks to supply her various customers. Both women are very humble but are always struggling to get ahead in their activities. Both of them want to provide for their children so that they may get good educations. They will use these funds to purchase inventory for each of their businesses. Their shared dream is to improve their families living standard.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Hipólita tiene 49 años, es una madre muy responsable y amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos: Jonathan de 18 y Yunior de 14 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Su negocio está ubicado en el distrito de Ananea (Departamento de Puno), a más de 4,600m.s.n.m, ella vende ropa a los moradores de dicho lugar y el clima frió de la zona hace que su negocio sea muy rentable, ya que la gente recurre a las cálidas prendas de vestir que ella vende. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el intenso frió que hace en Ananea, aun así sabe que tiene que seguir trabajando duro si quiere alcanzar sus metas. Hipólita anhela que con el tiempo su negocio mejore y le rinda mejores ingresos económicos. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y siempre ahorra para poder pagar sus cuotas, ya que no quiere meter en problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una de las socias más alegres y responsables. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa para su puesto de venta, ya que la lejanía del lugar hace que tenga que llevar grandes cantidades para gastar menos.
texts.en:
Hipolita is 49 years old; a dedicated and loving mother, who lives in her own home with her two sons, Jonathan, 18 and Yunior, 14, for both of whom she hopes for a good life. Her stall is locatged in the Ananea (Puno Department) district at an altitude of more than 4600 meters above sea level. She sells clothing to the inhabitants of the area and the very cold climate of this area makes her business quite successful since the folks here gravitate towards her warm clothing. She loves selling and has been in sales for 20 years. She feels that the hardest thing about the work is standing the cold weather in Ananea. But, despite this, she knows that she has to continue working hard if she is to reach her goals. This is her 6th loan with MFP and she always saves money to pay her installments because she wants to be in good standing with the communal bank where she is one of the most responsible and cheerful members. With the 3000 new soles loan she will buy more clothing to sell because the great distance of her location makes bringing large quantities of inventory attractive to keep her costs down.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Doña Camila es Originaria de la comunidad de Coxom Totonicapan situado a 8 Kilometros de  de la ciudad ella es casada con tres hijos su actividad principal es el bordado manual dicha actividad lo viene ejeciendo desde mas de veinte años con ello a podido darle estudio a sus hijos hoy necesita del apoyo de la institucion ASDIR para un credito como lo manifiesta que solicito un credito en el sitema Bancario por ser una persona humilde y muy sencilla no le consediero el credito ella confia que ASDIR  se le concede el credito que le permitira con ello una inversion en la compra de Materiales para bordados.
texts.en:
Doña Camila is originally from the community of Coxom Totonicapan, which is located 8 kilometers away from the city. She is married and has 3 children. She has been making embroidered items by hand for the past 20 years. Through her business, she has been able to provide her children with everything they need to study.

Today she needs the support of Asociación ASDIR. Being a humble and sincere person, Doña Camila tried to apply for a loan from a traditional bank but was denied. She has confidence that ASDIR will approve her request so that she can purchase more materials for her embroideries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en una casa alquilada y tiene muchas ganas de progresar en la vida, sabe que con mucho trabajo lo puede lograr.
