In the future she plans to set up a bazaar in her home where she can offer a variety of beauty products that her customers have been requesting. Her customers' needs motivate her to make progress. This is her 6th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA; she hopes to keep relying on their support and trust in giving her the loans she needs. The 1,000 PEN that she is requesting will allow her to take advantage of the supermarket sales where she purchases high quality articles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Beatriz tiene 40 años, vive junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos, con quienes habita en la casa que su esposo logró adquirir hace diez años. Sus deseos de cooperar en casa fueron uno de los motivos por el cual incursionó en la venta de cosméticos, actividad que viene realizando durante cuatro años. Gracias a la amistad que tiene con algunas promotoras quienes la enseñaron cómo y dónde ofertar los productos de belleza.  Ya que al iniciar no tenía relaciones con muchas personas y con el pasar de los años fue teniendo experiencia y ahora conserva una gran cantidad de conocidos a quienes ella visita cada semana con la finalidad de incrementar sus pedidos por catálogos y tener puntos de ventas adicionales que le beneficia recibiendo premios y obsequios que brinda la empresa de belleza. Tiene proyectado instalar un puesto de venta en su domicilio, donde pueda ofrecer cosméticos de diversas líneas de belleza y de calidad a sus vecinos y conocidos con el fin de tener ingresos diarios sin esperar la entrega de los productos de pedidos por catálogos. Ella ya tiene seis créditos con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera seguir contando con su confianza y apoyo, desea también seguir integrando su banco comunal que le brindó oportunidades para el progreso de su negocio y la de sus compañeras con quienes son socias dentro del grupo. Con los 1000 soles que solicita, serán invertidos en la compra de productos de belleza por docenas pues es una estrategia para aumentar sus ventas.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Bernardina tiene 49 años, es madre D. dos hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro y junto a su pareja tratan D. brindarles las comodidades posibles para su desarrollo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras y frutas en el mercado D. su localidad, donD. trabaja por seis meses, tiempo que logró conseguir un puesto en alquiler, ya que es la única forma D. iniciar su negocio dentro del mercado. DesD. entonces realiza su actividad con mucho ánimo todos los días desD. las seis D. la mañana hasta las cuatro D. la tarD., aprovechando la demanda que hay por las mañanas. Sin embargo para hacer su negocio rentable tiene que ofrecer productos D. calidad y sobre dar una buena atención a las personas, ya que es un factor importante para los clientes. Bernardina siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy sociable y esto le ayudó a  incrementar su clientela. Sin embargo, el empeño que pone a su trabajo por adquirir un puesto D. venta le está resultando muy caro, pues el costo del alquiler perjudica con las ganancias que obtiene del trabajo. Bernardina espera le concedan nuevamente el préstamo para sacar adelante su negocio y tener su propio puesto D. ventas, además ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y ha cumplido a tiempo sus pagos. Los seis préstamos que tuvo con Microfinanzas PRISMA le permitieron formar un equipo D. trabajo muy ameno, ya que las socias que conforman su banco comunal tratan siempre D. trabajar organizadamente. Los 800 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra D. mercadería para ampliar  su puesto con nuevos productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Bernardina is 49 years old, and the mother of two children that she treasures. Together with her partner, she tries to proviD. them with all the comforts for their progress. She dedicates herself to selling fruits and vegetables at the market in her locality, where she has been working for six months. In this time, she has managed to attain a stall that she rents, as this is the only way to start her business within the market. Since then, she has carried out her activities with great enthusiasm every day from six in the morning until four in the afternoon, taking advantage of the demand there is for her product in the early part of the day. Despite this, in order to make her business profitable, she has to offer quality products and good customer service -- important factors for her clients. Bernardina has always characterized herself for being very friendly, and this has helped her to increase her customer base. Regardless, the effort she has maD. to rent a stall for her work is proving to be quite expensive, since the cost of her space cuts into the profits from her sales. Bernardina hopes that they will re-lease the space to her so she can grow her business and have her own place from which to sell her product. In addition, she has proven herself as a responsible person and has maD. her payments on time. The six loans that she had with Microfinanzas PRISMA allowed her to form a good working team, as the members that make up her cooperative bank always try to work in an organized manner. The 800 soles she requests will be invested into the purchase of merchandise to expand her stall with new edible products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Dominga tiene 48 años, está separada de su esposo y sus anhelos de superación la llevan a mejorar su condición de vida, vive en casa de sus padres, quienes le heredaron la vivienda donde habita. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños desde hace ocho años, pero particularmente vende  prendas usadas con la intención de llegar a las personas de escasos recursos. Vende además, prendas íntimas en el mercado de su localidad, es así que trabaja todas las mañanas caminando largas cuadras con la finalidad de vender. Esta actividad la realiza sola, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de familiares, pero la gran acogida y compañía de sus clientes y amigos la llena alegría y motivación, y por ellos desea mejorar su atención y calidad, siendo un factor importante como vendedora. Sus más ansiados deseos son de conseguir un puesto o un espacio de venta fijo para ampliar y mejorar su negocio, pero para conseguirlo continuará saliendo por las mañanas a vender su mercadería, así como también visitar a las casas de sus amistades con el fin de dejar a crédito alguna prenda para luego ir los fines de semana a cobrar. Este sería su séptimo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera de nuestra ayuda para que se cristalicen sus deseos y darle la seguridad de alcanzar las metas que se propuso. La alegría y optimismo que hay dentro de su banco comunal que conformaron hace siete años la motivan a seguir formando parte de tan agradable equipo. Los 1700 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de mercadería para iniciar su negocio de venta de ropa a crédito.
texts.en:
Dominga is 48 years old, separated from her husband, and her desire to succeed leads her to improve her standard of living. She lives in her parents’ house, which she inherited from them. She has dedicated herself to selling children’s clothing for eight years, specifically used clothing for people with scant resources to buy. In addition, she sells undergarments at the market in her locality. She works every morning, walking long blocks, with the aim of selling her products. She carries out her activities alone, as she doesn’t have the support of any relatives, however the great reception and company of her customers and friends fill her with happiness and motivation. For them, she wants to improve the quantity and quality of her products, an important factor to her as a salesperson. Her greatest wishes are to obtain her own stall or space to expand and improve her business, but to manage this she will continue to go out every morning to sell her merchandise, as well as to visit her friends’ homes with the aim of leaving a garment on credit to later collect her payment on the weekend. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she hopes for our help to make her wishes a reality, and to meet the goals that she has set for herself. The happiness and optimism that there is within the cooperative bank they formed seven years ago motivate her to continue being a part of such an agreeable team. The 1,700 soles she is requesting will be invested into the purchase of merchandise to start her business of selling clothing on credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Elsa tiene 44 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, juntos viven en la casa que su pareja les brindó desde que se casaron. Desde muy joven se dedicó  a la venta de diversos productos, ya que ser comerciante es una de las actividades que más le agrada, pues su madre cultivó en ella cualidades para ser una gran comerciante. Inició su actividad vendiendo ropa al crédito, logrando cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, sin embrago la demora de los pagos de éstos no le resultaba rentable, obligándola a cambiar de rubro e invertir su capital en un nuevo negocio. Es así que abrió una bodega en su localidad, negocio que marcha bien, ya que los productos que vende son de buena calidad y precios al alcance de la economía de sus compradores, además de encontrarse a gusto por los productos y la atención que reciben. A pesar de tener cinco meses de funcionamiento ha tenido gran acogida y espera seguir progresando, ya que su meta es trasladar su bodega a su domicilio para dejar de pagar el alquiler del local donde vende. Este sería su séptimo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera le concedan el préstamo para cumplir tal propósito, ya que ha demostrado ser una personal responsable y con mucha voluntad de progresar. Los anteriores seis créditos le permitieron formar un organizado equipo de trabajo conformado por un grupo de amigas, socias de su banco comunal donde trabajan con entusiasmo. Los 2500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su bodega.
texts.en:
Elsa is 44 years old, married, and has two young children. They live together in the house that her spouse provided when they got married. Since she was very young, she has sold different products. Being a shopkeeper is one of the activities she most enjoys, since her mother cultivated in her the qualities to be a great shopkeeper. She began selling clothes on credit, successfully fulfilling her customers' requests. However, their delay in payment made it unsustainable for her, requiring her to change tracks and invest her capital in a new business. That is how she opened a shop in her area. It is a successful business because she sells high-quality products and the prices are within her customers' reach, on top of finding herself liked for the products and the attention they receive. Despite only being open five months, she has been well-received and hopes to continue progressing, given that her goal is to move her shop into her home to avoid having to pay rent on the place where she works. This would be her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She hopes you will provide her the loan to fulfill her goal, given that she has shown herself to be a responsible person with a lot of desire to progress. The previous six loans allowed her to form an organized team consisting of a group of friends, members of their communal bank where they work enthusiastically. The 2,500 soles that she requests will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cyd Therese

texts.en:
Cyd Therese D. is from the town of Sapang Dalaga. She is 29 years old. Cyd Therese is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Cyd Therese owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Cyd Therese has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cyd Therese joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cyd Therese is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Cyd Therese from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 47 años, es soltera  y vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes son su mayor tesoro y a quienes desea apoyar con los diversos gastos que tienen en la famita. Dedicarse a la entrega de periódicos es una de las tareas más difíciles en la ciudad, ya que las personas desde muy tempranas horas salen a las calles con tal de mantenerse informadas de los últimos acontecimientos y ella en lo posible distribuye los periódicos a sus clientes de manera oportuna. Para lograr su record de ventas de estos diarios se levanta de madrugada para dirigirse a las agencias periodísticas donde solicita cantidades de ejemplares para luego distribuirlas en las tiendas y puestos en los mercados. Su rutina es distribuir por las mañanas y en las tardes realiza las cobranzas, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace veinte años, tiempo que logró ganar experiencia y tener un gran número de clientes, quienes están acostumbrados con la visita de Eusebia. Su meta próxima es la instalación de un puesto en el mercado de su localidad para ofrecer productos comestibles como un negocio adicional al que ya está acostumbrada. Ella necesita ayuda para tener mayores ingresos con el fin de darles seguridad a sus ancianos padres. Este sería su séptimo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y demostró ser una persona bien cumplida con sus cuotas. A Eusebia le gusta el entusiasmo que tiene su equipo de trabajo, ya que es una de las características que le agrada de banco comunal, el cual está conformado por dieciséis socias. Los 2200 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de más periódicos con el fin de aumentar clientela dentro de su localidad.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 47, is single and lives in her parents’ house. They are her greatest treasure, and she wishes to help them with the various family expenses. She delivers newspapers, which is one of the most difficult jobs in the city. People are on the streets very early wanting to stay informed of the latest events. She distributes the papers to her customers at the optimal time whenever possible. To achieve her sales record of these papers, she gets up at dawn to go the newspaper agencies to get papers to distribute to stores and stalls in the markets. Her routine is to distribute in the mornings and collect in the afternoons. She has been doing this for 20 years. In that time she has gained experience, and she has a great number of customers who are used to visits from Eusebia. Her next goal is to set up a stall in the regional market to sell food products as an additional business, which she is used to. She needs help to have greater income in order to give her elderly parents security. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She has shown herself to be a person who does well in making her payments. Eusebia likes the enthusiasm her work team has. It is one of the characteristics of the community bank, which has 16 members, that pleases her. The 2,200 PEN that she is asking for is to buy more newspapers in order to increase customers in her region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Evelyn is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting cassava for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

texts.es: Guillermina tiene 48 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que construyó junto a su pareja hace varios años. Desde muy joven trabajó para fábricas textiles realizando el acabado de las prendas de vestir que el enviaban, las cuales, en su mayoría, son exportadas al extranjero. Es por ello que trata de elaborarlas con suma delicadeza y creatividad, con el fin de mostrar en sus trabajos diversos paisajes de la serranía del país. Sin embargo, cuando la demanda se acrecienta requiere de materiales para agilizar su trabajo y debido al escaso recurso económico pierde algunos contratos con clientes importantes. Es por ello que desea obtener el capital necesario para la implementación de su taller dentro de su casa, donde trabaja todo el día. Sus planes a futuro son de diseñar algunas prendas y conformar una asociación de exportación, pues es muy creativa y emprendedora. La responsabilidad es lo que la caracteriza y lo demostró en los anteriores créditos que solicitó a Microfinanzas PRISMA. Lo que le agrada de su banco comunal, el que conforma hace siete años, es cumplir con las cuotas y los objetivos que se proponen. Los 2000 soles que requiere le permitirán adquirir los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de las prendas para exportación.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Jenny es madre soltera, vive con su hija en la casa de sus padres a quienes trata de apoyar con los gastos del hogar, tratando siempre de progresar junto a su familia. Desde que se casó inicio su negocio de venta de ropa junto a su pareja, esta actividad la realiza en el puesto que adquirió en el mercado de su distrito, donde vende todos los días desde las nueve de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche. Asimismo, vende prendas usadas por las noches y son las que tienen mayor demanda a esa hora. Y debido a los peligros nocturnos, su esposo la ayuda por las noches. Sus planes a futuro son de adquirir un puesto más en el mercado para incrementar sus ingresos. Este es su 6to préstamo con MFP y con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para llenar su puesto con nuevas prendas de temporada.
texts.en:
Jenny is a single mother who lives with her daughter in her parents home. She tries to help them with household expenses, ever attempting to progress together with her family. When she married she began selling clothes with her partner in a market stall which she acquired in her district market. She sells every day from 9 in the morning well into the night. In addition, at night she sells used garments which are in great demand at those hours. Due to nocturnal dangers, her ex-husband helps her at night.

Her plans for the future are to acquire another stall in the market in order to increase her income. This is her sixth loan from MFP. With the $350 she is requesting, she will buy a larger quantity of merchandise and fill her stall with new seasonal clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Lita tiene 43 años, está casada y tiene 3 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que construyó con su pareja a base de mucho esfuerzo. Hace veinte años se especializó en la labor de costurera y trabajó en diversos talleres y fábricas especializadas, donde realizaba trabajos manuales. Sin embargo, se pudo dar cuenta que los mismos trabajos los podía realizar dentro de su hogar e hizo contratos con algunas fábricas quienes le dan mercadería cada quince días para que realice los acabados de carteras, las cuales son bordadas y cosidas con mucha paciencia, pues los diseños son muy variados. Pero Lita tiene proyectado instalar un taller de costura y realizar trabajos con diseños propios y venderlos en los mercados centrales de la capital donde la demanda es mayor, al igual que las exigencias de las personas, por ello que trata de trabajar arduamente para ir implementando su propio taller. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFF y con los 3000 soles que solicita comprará la maquinaria necesaria para la producción de sus propios diseños.
texts.en:
Lita is 43 years old, married, and has three children with whom she lives in the home that she and her spouse built with much effort. For 20 years, she has specialized in tailoring and worked in different workshops and factories, where she did manual work. However, she realized that she could do the same work in her own home. She contracted with some factories that give her merchandise every 15 days. She adds the embellishments on handbags, which are very patiently embroidered and sewn, given that the designs are quite varied. But Lita plans to establish a tailoring workshop, work with her own designs, and sell them in the central markets in the capital. In those markets there is higher demand, equal to the demands of the people. Because of that, she works arduously to set up her own workshop. This is her sixth loan with MFF, and with the 3000 soles she requests, she will buy the machinery necessary to produce her own designs.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: María tiene 45 años, vive con sus dos hijos en la casa que su ex esposo le dejó hace diez años. Se dedica a la fabricación de adornos para el hogar, siendo las manualidades una de las habilidades que posee y que desde hace poco logró descubrir, gracias a una amiga quien le enseñó hacer este tipo de trabajos decorativos. Con el tiempo, María aprendió a elaborar diversos objetos novedosos, los cuales tuvieron gran acogida en los mercados de su localidad. Debido al incremento de sus pedidos, con los que no podía cumplir decidió asociarse con una amiga para trabajar en pos de incrementar sus ganancias. María compra la mercadería en el centro de la ciudad y luego de terminados sus artículos los lleva a los mercados de su localidad donde tiene clientes muy fieles, así también lleva su mercadería a las ciudades alejadas de la capital donde la demanda es mayor y los ingresos más satisfactorios. Sin embargo, sus deseos de superación la motivan a seguir trabajando con mucho ánimo con la finalidad adquirir un puesto de venta fijo dentro de algún mercado donde pueda ofertar la gran variedad de diseños que elabora junto a su socia. Este sería su treceavo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y espera de la confianza para obtenerlo, pues así podrá concretar su proyecto. María solicita la cantidad de 1000 soles para realizar sus compras, al por mayor, de los materiales necesarios para sus adornos y manualidades.
texts.en:
María, 45, lives with her two children in the house that her ex husband left her ten years ago. She makes decorations for the home. She has a talent for handicrafts. She discovered this a short while ago thanks to a friend who taught her how to make this type of decorations. With time, she learned to make diverse new objects. They were well received in the regional markets. Due to the increase in orders, which she could not complete, she decided to work with a friend in order to increase her earnings. María buys the merchandise in the center of the city. When she has finished the articles, she takes them to the markets in her area where she has loyal customers. She also takes her merchandise to the capital’s neighboring cities where there is greater demand and the income more satisfactory. Nevertheless, her desire to improve motivates her to keep working enthusiastically to be able to eventually get a fixed sales location inside of a market. There she could sell a great variety of designs that she makes together with her colleague. This is her 13th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She confidently hopes to get it in order to firm up her project. María is asking for 1,000 PEN to buy wholesale the necessary materials for her decorations and handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Mónica tiene 36 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos, quines son su mayor tesoro y por quienes sacrificó muchos años de trabajo con el fin de brindarles el hogar apropiado dónde habitar. Sus deseos de progreso le dieron la idea de invertir en la instalación de una bodega, la cual viene atendiendo hace 14 años, tiempo que consolidó su negocio como uno de los más solicitados y conocidos dentro de su localidad. Su negocio va debido a ofrecer productos de calidad a precios cómodos, pensando siempre en la economía de cada hogar. Sin embargo, su mayor anhelo es abastecer su bodega con nuevos productos, tales como objetos para el hogar y útiles escolares, pues la demanda aumenta y los pedidos son muy continuos, pero el poco capital que posee la limita en su crecimiento como comerciante. Este sería su séptimo crédito que solicita a Microfinanzas PRISMA y con el que espera mejorar su negocio. En su banco comunal lo que más le gusta es el compromiso y responsabilidad de sus compañeras, con las que trabaja por más de 7 años. Mónica necesita 1200 soles para invertir en la compra de mercadería de calidad para su tienda.
texts.en:
Monica is 36 years old, married, and has two children who are her greatest treasure and for whom she sacrificed many years, working with the goal of providing them with a suitable home. Her desire to progress gave her the idea of investing in a grocery store, which she has attended to for 14 years. In that time, she has established her business as one of the most sought-after and well-known in her area. Her business' success is due to having quality products at comfortable prices, always considering each household's finances. However, her greatest desire is to stock her grocery store with new products, like household products and school supplies, given that the demand is increasing and the requests for them are continuous. However, the little capital that she possesses limits her growth as a business person. This would be the seventh loan that she requests with Microfinanzas Prisma, with which she hopes to improve her business. In her communal bank she most likes the commitment and responsibility of her fellow members, with whom she has worked for more than seven years. Monica needs 1200 soles to invest in the purchase of quality merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Nadea tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo en la casa de su madre, quien le brinda el apoyo necesario para progresar. A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que vivió trata de salir adelante, y una de las formas es trabajando como costurera dentro de su casa, ya que gracias a su madre pudo realizar contratos con algunas empresas de exportación de ropa donde presta sus servicios desde hace dos años. Esta actividad es una de las más creativas, pues Nadea trata de realizar trabajos de alta calidad  y diseños muy novedosos, sin permitirse la falla, sino implicaría un descuento. Es por ello que trata realizar acabados perfectos para seguir prestando sus servicios a la empresa, siendo una de sus ambiciones asociarse con un grupo de amigas para diseñar prendas para exportación y contactarse con empresarios para luego venderlas. Este es su sexto préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y cumplida con sus cuentas. Asimismo, conforma un banco comunal con un grupo de amistades con quienes trabaja de manera comprometida. Con los 500 soles que solicita adquirirá los materiales necesarios para realizar los acabados de las prendas elabora.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es: Yesica tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, con quienes trata de disfrutar gran parte del día, aun cuando tiene que salir a trabajar. Sus ganas de progresar la motivan diariamente a salir a las calles con la esperanza de vender  algunas de sus prendas de vestir en las puertas de los mercados. Esta actividad la viene realizando por tres años, tiempo que ganó experiencia en ventas y ahora busca variar sus productos acorde a la exigencia de sus clientes. Yesica desea adquirir un puesto de ventas dentro del mercado para realizar su actividad con mayor comodidad e implementar un negocio de venta de comida, el cual viene realizando sólo los fines de semana o fechas festivas con la finalidad de mejorar el capital que tiene e invertir en sus dos negocios. Este es su 6to crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y sus anteriores préstamos fueron de gran beneficio para ella y todas sus compañeras con quienes conforma su banco comunal. Los 800 soles que solicita los invertirá en su negocio de venta de comida, pues ha tenido gran acogida por las personas.
texts.en:
Yesica is 33 years old, married, and has two young children, with whom she tries to enjoy a large part of the day, even when she has to go to work. Her desire to progress motivates her daily to go out with the hope of selling some of her clothing in the entrances to markets. She has been doing this for three years, in which time she has gained sales experience. She is now looking to vary her products in accordance with her customers' demands. Yesica wants to acquire a booth within the market to work more comfortably and to start a business selling food, which she only does on weekends and holidays in order to increase her capital and invest in her two businesses. This is her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Her previous loans were of great benefit to her and all the members of her communal bank. The 800 soles she requests will be invested in her food business, since it has been well-received.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her new food business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion P. is from the village of Tungawan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 51 years old, is separated from spouse, and has three adult children. Visitacion operates a clothing-sales business, selling clothes to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Visitacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

texts.es: Alejandrina de 44 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. En su pequeño cuarto, Alejandrina teje las artesanías más coloridas del mercado, las lleva a vender a la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde sus clientes se dan cita todos los domingos y la buscan para comprar sus novedosos diseños. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, lleva 14 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es trasladar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que le resulta muy cansado y agotador. Para el futuro espera abrir una tienda de tejidos artesanales, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Este es el quinto préstamo de Alejandrina con MFP y es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudara a progresar. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para producir más tejidos y aumentar la variedad de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 44, is a happy and hard working woman. She lives in her own house, and what she wants most is to get ahead in life. In her small room Alejandrina weaves the most colorful handicrafts in the market. She takes them to sell in the Laguna Temporal plaza (place where there are fairs in the city of Juliaca). This is where her customers meet every Sunday looking to buy her new designs. What she likes most about her work is weaving. The more she does, the better she feels. She has been doing this for 14 years. The hardest part about her work is transporting her handicrafts to her sales location. It makes her very tired and exhausted. In the future she hopes to open a store of woven handicrafts where she can offer better service to her customers. This is Alejandrina’s fifth loan with MFP. She is very punctual with her payments given that she does not want to cause problems for her community bank. She feels very happy with her community bank, and she knows they will help her to progress. She will use the 1,500 PEN that she is asking for to buy more wool to produce more weaving and increase the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Ana tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su familia y lo que más desea es darles una buena calidad D. vida. El puesto D. venta D. zapatos D. Ana está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donD. se hacen ferias en la ciudad D. Juliaca), pero ella no sólo se dedica a vender calzados, sino que también los confecciona, es muy buena realizando su trabajo, motivo por el cual también reparte sus calzados a otras vendedoras. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es confeccionar los zapatos, por lo cual le pone mucho empeño, lleva 11 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los zapatos hasta los puestos D. venta, ya que tiene que visitar muchos puestos. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda muy granD. donD. pueda vender los zapatos que confecciona. Es el cuarto préstamo D. Ana con MFP, ella ha pagado puntualmente sus anteriores créditos y este último espera pagarlo a tiempo también, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos materiales para confeccionar una mayor cantidad D. zapatos.
texts.en:
Ana, 41, is a very hard working woman. She lives with her family in her own house. What she wishes for the most is to give them a good quality of life. Ana’s stall for selling shoes is located in the Laguna Temporal plaza (place where there are fairs in the city of Juliaca). But, she does not just sell shoes. She also makes them. She is very good at her work, which is why she also distributes her footwear to other sellers. What she likes the most about her work is making shoes, which she does with much effort. She has been doing this for 11 years. The most difficult part is transporting the shoes to the sales locations because she has to go to many locations. In the future she hopes to have a very large store where she can sell the shoes she makes. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has paid her previous loans punctually. She expects to pay this last one on time as well. She is very active in her community bank. She will use the 2,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy new materials to make a larger quantity of shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 25 años, es una joven muy decidida, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila. Su negocio son los tejidos artesanales, ella aprendió esta actividad desde muy pequeña cuando ayudaba a su madre a terminar los tejidos que le solicitaban, actualmente tiene su puesto en la explana Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más a un si son artesanías, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los tejidos hasta su puesto, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le genere mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el primer préstamo de Lourdes con MFP y espera pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy activa. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar su producción y ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 25, is a very determined young woman. She lives in her parents’ house, and her biggest desire is to give them a peaceful old age. Her business is woven handcrafts. She learned this activity when she was very small. She helped her mother finish weaving orders. Lourdes currently has a stall in the Laguna Temporal plaza (place where there are fairs in the city of Juliaca). It is very busy with customers. What she likes most about her work is weaving – even better if it is handcrafts. She has been doing this for five years. The hardest part is transporting her weaving to her stall. But, she knows that this is her work, and she has to do it. In the future she hopes that her business grows and generates better income. This is Lourdes’ first loan with MFP. She expects to make all of her payments on time and not cause problems for the members of her community bank. She is a very active member of her community bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN that she is asking for to buy more wool to increase her production and offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Mariela tiene 40 años, es una madre muy cariñosa y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa con sus 2 hijos: Maycol de 15 y Reveca de 12 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Tejiendo chompas, chalinas, guantes, chullos (prendas para la cabeza), etc, Mariela pasa sus días. Sus tejidos los vende en su pequeño puesto ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde con mucha rapidez son adquiridos por sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es realizar los acabados a las prendas que hace. Con todo el esfuerzo que realiza, espera para el futuro tener una tienda más grande donde pueda brindarles una mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Mariela se encuentra en su quinto préstamo con MFP y ya está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que produce.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Maruja tiene 50 años, es una madre que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho para sacar adelante a sus hijos, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Son 25 años los que lleva Maruja produciendo y comercializando productos artesanales, su negocio está ubicado en una zona altamente comercial, en la Explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), ella está convencida que la variedad de sus productos incrementarán sus ventas y con ello la mejora de su calidad de vida. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, esto la pone de muy buen ánimo, pero considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de lunes a sábado metida en su taller y los domingo salir a vender, lo que no le deja mucho tiempo para realizar otras cosas que le gustan. Para el futuro espera que su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos. Ya son cuatro los préstamos que Maruja ha solicitado en MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar más tejidos y aumentar la cantidad de prendas que tiene en stock.
texts.en:
Maruja, 50 years of age, is a mother who has worked hard all her life to give her children a good start in life. She lives in her own house and what she desires most is to have a peaceful old age. Maruja has spent the last 25 years making and selling artisan handicrafts. Her business is located in Explanada Laguna Temporal, an extremely commercial area where fairs are held in the city of Juliaca. She is convinced that the variety of her products increases her sales, and consequently improves her quality of life. What she likes best about her work is knitting, this puts her in a good mood. But what she thinks is most difficult is having to remain in her shop from Monday through Saturday, and then going out on Sundays to sell her work. That doesn't leave her much time to do other things that she enjoys. She hopes that in the future her business will grow and provide her with a better income. Maruja has now received four loans from Microfinanzas Prisma. She has been very punctual with her payments and has never had any problems with her communal bank where she is in charge of setting the payments and the other members have been very happy with this. The 1,000 New Sols she is requesting will be used to buy wool to produce more knit goods and to build up her inventory of garments.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Nelva tiene 28 años, es una amorosa madre de familia, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Roger de 28 años y sus dos hijas gemelas Tania y Erika de 7 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. El negocio de Nelva es el alquiler de cabinas de Internet, ella brinda este servicio desde muy tempranas horas, su local es muy concurrido, sobre todo por los jóvenes de su barrio, quienes al ver el buen trato que reciben y la comodidad de las cabinas, no dudaron en hacer de este lugar su preferido. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender bien a sus clientes, ya que sabe que de ellos dependen sus ingresos. Lleva 2 años con este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su local, ya que no le da mucho tiempo para salir a pasear con sus queridas hijas, por eso espera que en el futuro su negocio crezca y le genere mejores ingresos. Es el quinto préstamo de Nelva con MFP y tiene muchas ganas de pagarlo a tiempo y sin demora, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos. En su banco comunal es muy tranquila, pero siempre participa en las decisiones que toman entre todas las socia. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados planea hacer arreglar los muebles para computadora que tiene, ya que con el tiempo se han ido deteriorando.
texts.en:
Nelva is 28 years old and a loving mother to her family. She lives in a rented house with her husband Roger and their twin daughters, Tanya and Erika, who are 7 years old. She hopes to give them both a good life. Nelva manages an Internet café. She offers her services starting in the early morning hours because her location is very popular among the young people in the neighborhood. They enjoy being treated well and the convenience of the cubicles, so they don’t hesitate in making her business one of their favorite places to visit. What Nelva likes most about her job is serving her customers, because she knows her income is dependent on them. She has been in business for 2 years and the hardest part of her job is having to be present at her business the entire day, which does not give her much time to spend with her daughters. She hopes that her business continues to grow in the future and generate more revenue.

This will be Nelva’s fifth loan with MFP. Since she wants to access more loans in the future, she is eager to make her payments on time and without any delays. Her Communal Bank operates in a calm manner because everyone participates in all of the group decisions. With her loan of 800 soles, she plans to refurbish her computer furniture since it has deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie G. is from the village of Purok 2, Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Rosemarie owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rosemarie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda C. is from the village of Gango Rizal, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Nilda owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nilda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

Lucita owns and operates a motorcycle transport business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lucita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina B. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 70 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Marcelina owns and operates a business selling charcoal, manufacturing and selling charcoal products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Marcelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials such as coconut shells for manufacturing charcoal. This loan will be her 23rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as coconut shells to manufacture charcoal

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.en:
Nemesio S. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 51 years old. Nemesio is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nemesio owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcab services to local community members. Nemesio has been engaged in his business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Nemesio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nemesio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5200 PHP from GDMPC. Nemesio is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Nemesio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business

texts.en:
Remedios C., age 54, is a multi-tasked businesswoman, as are most Filipina entrepreneurs. She has been a widow for years and currently lives with her six adult children.

Remedios owns a general store which has been around for 35 years. She also prepares barbecue and sells it to customers. Remedios makes rags from textile trimmings and sells them to customers. She also finds time to sell cosmetics and apparel through the direct-selling scheme.  From these activities, she could realize a monthly income of $980.  

She joined the Kiva field partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, in 2006.  Her previous loans with the co-op were used to purchase textile trimmings from garment factories.  She used some of the money to buy more items for her store, such as soft drinks.  Now on her tenth loan cycle, Remedios is applying for a new loan amounting to P45,000.00 which she will spread out through all her business activities.

Remedios would like to see her general store someday grow as big as a commercial grocery chain, so she could help a lot of people by providing quality products at a cheaper price.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.name: Elma's Group

texts.en:
Elma J. and her family lives in Tumana, Marikina City, on the eastern side of Metro Manila.  She is 43 years old.  Her husband Gil works as a company driver.  They have two children, both of school age.

Elma owns and manages a bakery and a grocery store.  She opened her first outlet seven years ago with only one assistant working at the oven.  Now, her bakery employs ten bakers who rotate as store attendants as well.  She earns at least $3000 a month from the combined operations of the bakery and the grocery store. 

She has just finished repaying her previous loan with Kiva's field partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, so she applied for a new loan in the amount of P50,000 to cover the costs for the opening of her second bakery outlet.  This is her fourth loan with the cooperative.

Elma believes that education would be the best gift she could give her children, so she and her husband are working hard hand-in-hand to provide the best education for their children.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Capital for the opening of another outlet

texts.en:
Rosela C. is from the village of Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Rosela is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosela raises crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale. Rosela has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosela is requesting a new loan of 5589 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad S. is 56 years old and lives in Amang Rodriguez Village, Concepcion, Marikina City. Her husband Celedonio, 61, is a retiree. They have two adult children.

Felicidad manages a home-based optical shop, providing eyeglasses and other eye-care services for vision-impaired individuals. She has been in this business for 30 years. She earns a net income of $400 a month.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of P15,000 in order to buy more frames for eyeglasses and optical supplies. She dreams of opening another optical shop soon. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy frames and lenses for eyeglasses

texts.en:
Anecita P. is from the village of Tungawan, Tambulig, Zamboang del Sur. She is 32 years old. Anecita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling beverages and frequently-used retail products. Anecita has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Anecita joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to expand the business. This will be the first loan Anecita has taken out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

This is Carmen Minda P., 43, who hails from Concepcion, Marikina City, a bustling city on the eastern side of Metro Manila.  She is married to a preacher and is blessed with one child.

Carmen owns a sari-sari (general) store and she also manages a transport operation (taxi).  On idle days, she finds time to carve bar soaps, fashioning them to form any artistic shape imaginable, from figurines to flowers.  She found it to be an interesting hobby and source of income as well, especially during special occasions like mother’s day, birthdays, etc.  Combined, she makes $300 a month.

She joined the Kiva field partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, in 2007. She also wants to share with her friends the many blessings she has received since joining the CCT, so she invites them to attend their weekly meetings.    

Carmen currently needs a loan of P12,000.  She will use the funds to purchase replacement spare parts for their taxi.  She has been saving a lot so as to be able to buy more taxi units so she can help employ other people.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.name: Mary Fe

texts.en:
Mary Fe T. is from the village of Purok 5, Montol, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Mary Fe is single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Fe owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling frequently-used retail products in the local community. Mary Fe has been engaged in her business for more than 6 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Mary Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Mary Fe is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mary Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea A., 53, lives in Maricaban, Pasay City.  Her husband Felipe, 54, is a kitchen attendant.  They have two children, one of whom passed away last year.  

Andrea is selling assorted RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing.  Her business is very new.  She started five months ago but has already earned back her investment, despite still grieving for a lost child.  She now earns $260 a month from selling clothes.

She has been a member of the Kiva field partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, for five years.  She has finished repaying her previous loan with CCT and is requesting a new loan in the amount of P10,000 as additional capital for her clothing business.

Andrea dreams of owning a stall inside a shopping mall.  She also hopes to purchase a farm lot in the future where she can plant vegetables and fruit trees. 



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Mrs. Marianita S., 28 years of age, is married and is a resident of P5 Sumirap, Tangub City. She has been an active Barangay (district) Health Worker for almost ten years in that community. She is blessed with three children who are all now in school. Her husband is a motorcycle driver and sometimes does some labor/masonry work in construction.

Presently, Marianita is engaged in sari-sari (general) store business with an average net income of not less than P3,000 a month. Another source of income comes from her honorarium and amounts to P3,000 a month.

Marianita joined Paglaum MPC in July 2009 because she is very interested in our products and services, especially in our savings and education programs. As a new member in our cooperative, she is given the privilege to apply for her first loan loan of P5,000. She hopes that someday her business will become a mini-grocery store and she will be able to send her children to a better school.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

Rowena operates a business buying and selling t-shirts, pants and other Ready To Wear items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately of 2,000 Philippine pesos a month. 

In March 2009, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC.

Rowena is requesting a new loan of 3,000.00 PHP, which will be used to purchase more items to sell. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

texts.en:
Maria Theresa D. C. is from the progressive town of Dasmarinas, Cavite. She is 36 years old. Her husband Rafael, 46, is a farmer. They have a very young child.  

Theresa owns and manages a general store. She also sells prepaid credit for mobile phones. Her store is six years old and has a monthly profit of about $370 per month.  

She attributes her store’s success (and her personal success as well) to having joined the Kiva field partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative, in 2007.  

Theresa needs a loan of P13,000 to build up inventories for her store. Competition is stiff in her area. “A store with many items to sell is always inviting to the customers”, she says.  She dreams of converting her general store to a big grocery outlet someday.


About CCT

For over three years, Rashid has owned and managed a shop where he deals in phones and phone accessories. He is using the loan to purchase phones, as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, ear phones, etc. The loan will increase his capital as well as improve his stock.

Rashid is an open-minded person who is helping his relatives by supporting their children who want to study. He is active and hardworking, and has a structural setup through which he hopes to complete the constructions that will generate enough income to support him and his family in the future.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima M. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a business selling charcoal, green vegetables, and fruit to customers in Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases goods for her business directly from wholesale sellers and then sells to her customers at retail. Green vegetables and fruit are purchased from the city market at Buguruni and Kariakoo. She meets her family's daily needs with the income from her business. She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 TZS to buy more goods in order to meet customers' demand.

texts.en: Mrs. Rita N. is a resident of Khokhana-Dobato. Khokhana-Dobato is located in Lalitpur district. It is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur, and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. N. lives in single-family home with her husband and two children. Her husband, Mr. Bashanta N., works in a government office. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 7, and her daughter is only a year old. Mrs. N. opened her butcher shop two years ago to improve the living standard of her family. She sells chicken and buffalo meat in her shop. Now, due to the increasing demand for meat, she is requesting her first loan of 10,000 NPR to invest in her shop.

He is using the loan to purchase phone accessories to sell phones, phone housings and batteries and to repair phones for his customers and so forth. B. is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to prosper in life.

She meets her family's daily demands from the business income and also capitalizes the business. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost up the business.

He sells a variety of food products in his shop, including wheat flour, maize flour, beans, ground nuts, sugar and cooking oil. His wife is fully engaged in running the hardware shop while he runs the food shop.  Business income is used to meet the family's daily demands and for business capitalization. loans.name: Anju

texts.en:
Mrs. Anju N. is a tailor in the village of Khokhana-Dobato in Lalitpur. She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, makhshi, and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. N. took a 6-month training course in tailoring.

Now Mrs. N. is requesting a 15,000 Nepalese rupee loan to buy raw materials for her work. Mrs. Nepalil lives in a single family home with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Rabendra N., and he works in private office. Her son is studying at the primary level.

loans.name: Sveta's Group

texts.en:
Sveta, the 46-year-old leader of this group, comes from Jumgal, a marvelous mountainous region, where main activity is cattle breeding. She has three children. Sveta's husband operates a gas station. Her daughter, a seamstress, works in the capital. Her middle son is a plumber and the youngest son is a student. 

Twenty years ago, Sveta moved from Jumgal to the Chui region, where she commenced commerce. After a while, she swapped all her goods for 40 sheep.  The Chui region, being famous for its fertile land, is suitable for raising livestock. Sveta realized that cattle could be her gold mine. After increasing the total population, she exchanged a hundred sheep for a house and has been able to pay for her children’s education. 

Now, Sveta sells 20 liters of milk a day. She has a stable income of $114 per month. Sveta is seeking a loan to purchase a calf for feeding and also purchase some fuel for tillage. In future, she is going to give her children education and help her middle son to buy a house. Sveta’s partners are Batma, Talaikul, Burulush and Nurjamal. 

Batma, 53, is a mother of four children. She is a housewife and meets her daily needs by selling milk. She needs a loan to purchase seven sheep for feeding and resale.

Talaikul, 41, has four children. Her husband is a builder.  Her parents–in–law gave her two calves as a present. Since then she has been raising livestock. She is seeking a loan to purchase three calves. 

Burulush, 58, raised seven children, who live separately. Burulush makes her living by keeping hens. During summer she sells apples, plums and apricots. Burulush hopes to get a loan and purchase feed for winter: hay and barley, and to buy four sheep.

Nurjamal, 49, is a shepherd’s wife and the mother of four children. She looks after the household and sells milk. She wants to obtain a loan and buy a calf for breeding, and purchase fodder: hay and barley.
 
======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf for feeding and also purchase some fuel for tillage

texts.en:
Neema Mnzava is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs the Beautiful Salon at Tabata ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases goods from the wholesales cosmetics shops at Kariakoo city shopping center. Sales are highest over the three days of the weekend, from Friday to Sunday, when people are preparing themselves for the coming work week.

Using income from the business she has managed by herself to buy a plot for house construction in Dar es Salaam. She has been running the business for six years. She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 Tanzanian shillings to boost up the business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in Kihesa,Morogoro,she is 24 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 9,7, and 2 years.

Asia started her own business selling clothes and Vegetable 4 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Asia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes and to farm more vegetable for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Asia hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and vegetable

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cassava flour and silver fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase cassava flour and silver fish for sale.

texts.en:
Leah is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child is aged 22 years.she also care for other 1 dependent.

Leah started her own business selling charcoal 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Leah`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Leah hopes to save money and expand her business.

Zuhura H. is a married Tanzanian businesswoman who runs a tailoring mart business at Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. She designs and makes varieties of clothes for men, women and children and also makes school uniforms for pupils. Zuhura's business income has enabled her to buy three sewing machines and meet the family's daily needs. She is now requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to expand the business.

loans.name: Yustina

texts.en:
Yustina is a member of the Dodoma borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 12,10,4 years.

Yustina started her own clothing business selling kanga,vitenge(fabric) 5 years ago,she works 4 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Yustina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Yustina hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child is aged 2 years.

Christina started her own business selling charcoal 6 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 170,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Christina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Christina hopes to save Money,and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam J., 40 years old and married to an accountant. has four children, all attending school. Currently in the business of selling onions and cooking oil, she is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes and Irish patatoes to sell.
