With the extra profits from her loan, Salam hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes and Irish patatoes to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina J. is currently in the business of selling various hot drinks at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more wines, beers and many other drinks. Thirty-nine years old and married to a businessman, she has three children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, Regina hopes to be able to build a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more wines, beers and many other drinks to sell

texts.en: Yuriy is married with two children. He owns a small store and sells window curtains and shades. Yuriy has been in this business for 12 years. There has been a high demand for this type of goods. It enabled Yuriy to develop his business and open a store. Moreover, Yuriy has got a discount policy to bring the clients back. Yuriy employs two sales managers giving them jobs and opportunity to make living. Yuriy would like to borrow 18,100 UAH to increase his inventories. He has used mircoloans before and finds them very instrumental in his business development.

Olga is married with two children. She shares a business with her husband and sells various decoration items for houses. Olga has been in this business for 12 years. Olga enjoys helping people to choose various decoration items and make their homes look more nice and attractive. Olga would like to borrow 18,100 UAH to increase his inventories. Olga would use additional income to improve her living conditions.

Valentina has a husband and two adult children. She owns a business selling clothing. Instead of having a single business location, she travels and sells her inventories at six small markets in the area.  Valentina has been in this business for 12 years. She enjoys selling women's clothing and providing her clients with what they need where they are. Valentina lives with her husband in a small apartment. Valentina would like to borrow 12,200 UAH to increase her clothing selection.

loans.name: Cristina Gregoria

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CRISTINA R. Q., ES UNA PERSONA DEDICADA AL NEGOCIO DE LA LIBRERÍA Y TIENDA DE ABARROTES, QUIEN CON SU SACRIFICIO Y ESFUERZO SUSTENTA A SU FAMILIA Y A SUS HIJOS QUIENES TAMBIEN LE AYUDAN A SOBRE SALIR EN SU EMPRENDIMIENTO. SU NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO EN LA POPULOSA ZONA DE VILLA VICTORIA.

loans.use: Invertira en la compra de papeleria

texts.en:
Ganna is married and has two adult sons. She sells fruits and vegetables at the central market in Ivano-Frankovsk. Ganna started this business when she lost her job as result of downsizement at the meat factory where she worked. For the past 12 years this business has been the main source of her family income. 
Ganna would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase more of seasonal inventories. She hopes to make some additional income and use it for coming wedding of her son.

loans.name: Mugobe Central Kalina Fambe Group

texts.en:
Kalina F. is a loan group representative. She is forty-six years old, married with two children and looks after two siblings. Kalina F. deals in cassava flour and silver fish which she has been selling for over nineteen years, since 1990. She is using the loan to purchase cassava flour and silver fish for sale. 

The loan will improve her business and her dream is to build a house and educate the children.

loans.use: To purchase cassava flour and silver fish for sale.

loans.name: Mugobe Central Ngerirwoth Rosely Group

texts.en: Rosely N., a 39-year-old single mother of four children, two of whom are in school and looking after an orphan, has owned a restaurant and sold firewood for 15 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase firewood and restaurant items such as cassava flour, meat, fish, vegetables, sweet potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. to satisfy customer demand. A hardworking businesswoman who is hoping for her business to improve, Rosely's dream is to purchase a plot of land and educate the children.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and restaurant items such as cassava flour, meat, fish, vegetables, sweet potatoes, bananas, rice, etc.

texts.en: Tatyana is married with one daughter. She sells dishes and cups at a small open market. Her income is about 3,000 UAH per month. Tatyana has been in this busies for 14 years. Large experience helps her to choose the right kind of inventories that will sell well. This helped Tatyana to get free shipping from her suppliers. Tatyana's business goal is to get a larger kiosk and develop her business further. Tatyana would like to borrow 15,500 UAH to increase the assortment of her inventories.

texts.es:
Doña María del Socorro González es originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, a sus cuarenta y tres años de edad, nos dice estar llenos muchos deseos de seguir adelante, de luchar por el bienestar de su familia y sobre todos de sus hijos.

Madre de cuatro hijos, actualmente es solamente responsable de el menor de ellos, que tiene 15 años. Ella quiere que se supere y sea un hombre de éxito.

María actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos, sandalias y además esta incursionando en el mercado de la ropa. Su crédito lo quiere para compra ropa para damas y caballeros; Ya que en lo poco que ha vendido le ha ido muy bien y desea abastecer la demanda de los clientes.

Es su primer ciclo como cliente individual pero tiene muchos años de estar en ADIM trabajando con grupos solidarios. Es una clienta A y quiere seguir manteniendo su categoría.
texts.en:
Doña María del Socorro González is 43 years old and a native of the city of Masaya. She tells us that she desires greatly to get ahead and will fight for the welfare of her family.

She is the mother of four children, but is only responsible for the youngest one, who is 15 years old. She wants him to excel and become a successful young man.

María currently sells shoes and sandals, and is also dabbling in the clothing market. She will use her loan to purchase clothing for women and men. What little inventory she had sold very well, so she wants to meet the demand of her customers.

This is María’s first individual loan, but she has several years of experience participating in solidarity group loans with ADIM. She is an “A” client and wants to maintain that status.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto Velazque, es casado, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad estudiando la primaria, labora en la Alcaldia municipal de Nueva Guinea como responsable territorial desde hace 6 años, vive en la zona # 7 de este municipio, esta solicitando refinanciamiento de su segundo crèdito para realizar mejora de vivienda poniendole la ceramica a su casa de habitaciòn y de esta menera tener mejor calidad de vida de su familia, fue recomendado por un excelente cliente de AFODENIC con sus ingreso puede asumir sus cuotas mensueles, en tiempo y forma, espera ser beneficado con el fondo KIVA para poder finalizar la mejora de su vivienda de esta manera, poder brindarle mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.

loans.use: Poner la ceramica a su casa

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Leyla del Socorro G. M. de 43 años de edad, trabaja en la elaboración y venta de pantalones de vestir (Estos son pantalones de tela suave), tanto para uniformes de colegio como para uniformes de trabajos entre otros.

En algunas ocasiones los clientes le proporcionan la tela, pero la mayor parte del tiempo ella la compra y la incluye en el costo de venta.

Es por esto que Leyla necesita un capital propio para poder dar abasto a sus clientes. Aspira poder llegar a poner una tienda de ropa que ella misma confeccione.

Leyla ha trabajado en grupos solidarios en ADIM y este es su primer ciclo grupal. Se siente muy orgulloso de haber ganado éste merito.

loans.use: Compra de telas para la elaboracion de pantalones

loans.name: Kathya De La Cruz

texts.es: Kathya de 29 años de edad es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive junto a su mamá, quien le dio un pequeño terreno para construir un cuarto el cual tiene bien acondicionado, repellado y el techo con perlines gracias a los creditos que AFODENIC le ha brindado, actualmente esta solicitando su 4to credito para continuar mejorando su cuarto pintandolo, reparando el baño y los perlines que no quedaron bien ajustados y cuando llueve se le moja un poco.  El mayor sueño de Kathya es poder tener su cuarto con lo necesario para cuando ella se case y tenga sus hijos ofrecerles una vida digna.

loans.use: Pintar su cuarto, reparar el baño y perlines

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nueva Generación está formado por  tres jóvenes emprendedoras,  muy esforzadas y trabajadoras. Ellas son Esthela del Socorro R., Perla del Carmen R. y Dalila Mercedes G. H..

La coordinadora del grupo es Esthela Rodriguez, quien a sus 21 años trabaja exitosamente en la venta de cosméticos de varias líneas de renombre como lo son AVON, Zermat y Vogue. Trabajo que realiza desde hace 4 años. En el cual se a desmpeñado muy bien ya que se encuentra entre las mejores vendedoras de AVON y Vogue.

Éste grupo lleva 3 ciclos con ADIM y están muy satisfechas con el trabajo realizado. Las demás miembras del grupo como los son Perla quien trabaja en la venta de verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 3 años y Dalila quien trabaja en el destace de cerdo desde hace mas de 3 años.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Generación” Group is made up of three young enterprising women who are very strong and hardworking. They are Esthela del Socorro R., Perla del Carmen R., and Dalila Mercedes G. H..

The coordinator of the group is Esthela R., who at 21 years works successfully in cosmetics sales. She sells various renowned brands such as AVON, Zermat, and Vogue and has been doing so for the past 4 years. She does her job well, as she is now among the best AVON and Vogue sellers.

This group has been through 3 loan cycles with ADIM and they are very satisfied with the work done. The other group members are Perla, who has worked in vegetable sales in the Masaya market for 3 years, and Dalila, who has worked butchering pork for more than 3 years.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of different brand products to distribute them

loans.name: Deyanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Deyanira A. P. de 42 años es originaria de la cuidad de Masaya, una mujer esforzada y que ha logrado tener éxito en su vida gracias a la disciplina en su negocio.

Deyanira posee un tramo en el mercado principal de Masaya desde hace  25 años, en el cual se encarga de vender frutas y verduras, este es el Decimo ciclo en ADIM (Más de cuatro años de estar trabajando con créditos en esta institución).

En los últimos créditos ella pretende ir aumentando el nivel de venta, tiene la idea de que mientras ella vende fijo en su tramo, sus hijas se pueden ir a vender ambulantes. Esto lo quiere expandir a cantidades mayores hasta lograr ser una distribuidora de frutas y verduras. Para así abastecer a los otros tramos.

Es una excelente clienta y muy responsable en sus créditos.
texts.en:
Deyanira A. P. is 42 years old and is from the city of Masaya. She is a hardworking woman who has been successful in her life thanks to the discipline of her business.

Deyanira has had a place in the main market in Masaya for the past 25 years in which she sells fruits and vegetables. This is her tenth loan with ADIM (she has been working with loans from this institution for more than four years).

With the last loans, she has tried to increase her level of sales. She has the idea that while she stays in her booth to sell, her daughters can go sell on foot. With this, she wants to expand to greater quantities until she is a fruits and vegetables distributor.

She is an excellent client and is very responsible with her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Juana De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Juana de los Ángeles M. A. es originaria de Jinotega, pero reside en Ticuantepe, municipio de Managua, a sus 40 años de edad se desempeña como ejecutiva de ventas de una casa comercial donde venden electrodomésticos.

Pero Juana nos dice que dado la situación y el hecho de que es una madre soltera, ha tenido que buscar otros medio para tener un mejor nivel de vida. Es por eso que aun que trabaja en un lugar fijo, ella conserva su negocio de venta de útiles de cocina como lo son Cucharas, cuchillos, tenedores, platos, entre otros.

Ella ha trabajado en la venta de este tipo de productos “Desde chavala”, nos dice Juana. Desde que inicio sus créditos en ADIM ha mantenido firme ese negocio, actualmente quiere expandir su clientela con la ayuda de su hija de 22 años, quien le ayudara a colocar todo los productos. “Dos vendedoras son mejor que una”  dice Juana.
texts.en:
Juana de los Ángeles M. A. comes from Jinotega but now lives in Ticuantepe, in the municipality of Managua. She is 40 years old and works as a sales executive at a business that sells electrical appliances. Juana tells us, however, that given the economic situation and the fact that she is a single mother, she has had to look for other ways to improve her standard of living. That is the reason why despite having a permanent job, she has also maintained her business of selling kitchen utensils such as spoons, knives, forks, plates, etc. Juana has worked selling this type of product “Since I was a girl,” she tells us. Since she started receiving loans from Kiva partner ADIM she has kept her business steady, and now wants to expand her clientele. She wants to do this with the help of her 22-year-old daughter, who will help her sell all of her products. “Two saleswomen are better than one,” Juana says.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more products so she can expand her clientele

texts.es: Este grupo de señoras se encuentran a 35 kilometros de la ciudad de Totonicapán, viven especificamente en una comunidad llamado Tierra Colorada, el cual se organizo hace más de 5 años, entre las razones importantes de estar organizadas esta de superarse economicamente y ellas han optado por la elaboración de canastillas de plasticos que a traves de su comercialización generan ingresos para el bienestar de sus familias, este es un producto que contribuye con la protección de la naturaleza ya que los materiales son muy resistentes que evita la utilización de bolsas plasticas que son una fuente de contaminación a la naturaleza, a raiz de querer ampliar su capital de trabajo ellas han decidido trabajar con la institución ASDIR, a travez del crédito de Bancos Comunales lo que permitirá aumentar su producción y por ende el aumento en la generación de sus ingresos.

Alba Nubia R. M. es una mujer esforzada; casada, madres de tres hijos y de mucho potencial para los negocios.

Ella se dedica a la compra venta de verduras desde que era muy joven, oficio que aprendió de su abuela con quien iba a trabajar. Hace tres años dejo de trabajar con su abuela e inicio el trabajo sola, ahora ayudada de su hermana y cuñado, ellos se encargan de comprar en diferentes departamentos a pequeños productores frutas y verduras como tomate, chiltoma (Pimiento dulce), plátano, piña, entre otros.

Para poder trasladar el producto tienen que alquilar camiones o camionetas, lo cual incurre en un gasto extra. Por lo tanto con este crédito iniciara los trámites para la adquisición de un carro cómodo que le facilite el transporte de sus productos y seguir ampliando el negocio.

Este es su primer ciclo como clienta individual, pero tiene mucho tiempo en trabajar en grupo, sabemos que ella es muy responsable y que nunca ha quedado mal.
texts.en:
Alba Nubia R. M. is the married mother of three children. She is very hard-working and has great potential for business.
She has bought and sold vegetables since she was very young, when she learned the trade from her grandmother. Three years ago she stopped working with her grandmother and started on her own, now with the help of her sister and brother-in-law. They buy tomatoes, chiltoma (sweet pepper), plantains and pineapple, among others, from small fruit and vegetable growers in different departments of Nicaragua.
They have to rent large and small trucks to transport the produce, costing them extra. This loan will therefore be the first step in acquiring a comfortable vehicle to facilitate transport and continue expanding the business.
This is her first loan cycle as an individual client, but she has a lot of experience working in a group. We know that she is very responsible and has never failed to make a repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Yarleny Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Yarleny Concepcion G. se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años de realizar dicha actividad, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superacion.
en estos momentos esta vendiendo poco ya que no tiene dinero para comprar mas materia prima para tener una mayor produccion. ella esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas leña, costales de harina de maiz, cal, agua. 
Yarleny no puede cubrir o cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes, ella vende su producto en pulperias, mercaditos y por encargos. 
ella se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para empezar a producir tortillas, hace dos producciones al dia.
nos comentos que su sueño es comprar una maquina para elaborar tortillas y asi poder vender mas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yarleny Concepcion G. makes and sells tortillas, which she has done for several years. She is a hard-working person with a strong desire to overcome challenges.

Right now, she is selling few tortillas, and doesn't have money to buy raw materials to be able to increase her production. She is requesting a loan to buy more firewood, bags of corn flour, lime, and water. Yarleny can not meet all the needs of her customers. She sells her product in grocery stores, small markets, or by special order.

She gets up at 4 in the morning every day to start making tortillas. She makes them twice a day. She told us that her dream is to buy a machine to make tortillas, so that she can sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, lime, salt, and bags of corn flour

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Arab

texts.en:
Arab is a young woman who is married with two children. She holds a masters degree in English language literature. Arab is a school teacher and she also has a part time job as a lecturer in the Arab American University in Jenin.

Arab is a very hardworking woman who wants to improve her income so as to have a better life for herself and for the whole family. For three years, she has worked in a language institute where she teaches English. Two years ago, she bought that institute and now she needs a loan to buy computers for the center in addition to doing some redecorating. She appears in the photo while teaching some of her students.

loans.use: To buy computers for her education center

loans.name: Thaera

texts.en:
Thaera is married and has one baby girl who suffers problems with her heart. Thaera's husband used to be a daily worker in Israel, but currently he can't get a permit so he thought of opening a new business that sells used car parts. Since he has good experience in this field, he thought of opening this business using some savings he has in addition to a loan from FATEN. Thaera and her husband previously received a loan from FATEN to renovate their house and they repaid it in full and on time.

Thaera and her husband and their child appear in the picture.

loans.use: To open a new business selling used car parts

texts.en:
A married father of three, Mr. Shadi is 30 years old.  He opened a cafeteria whose profits enable him to provide for his family.  He is running out of stock of the essential ingredients he needs to cook, such as milk, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc., so he is seeking a loan of $3000.  Mr. Shadi hopes that his tireless work plus a little help from the loan will take him a few steps nearer to the achievement of his dream:  Financial security for his family. 

On behalf of everyone here at Ryada, and from Mr. Shadi himself, we thank you for your support with this micro loan!

Bahia is a hard-working woman. She has been working in agriculture for at least 20 years. She works with her husband in farming and her five kids help her after finishing their school work.

Bahia's family used to have land that depended on rain for irrigation. A few years back, they added one greenhouse on land that equals around half a "donum" (unit for measuring land). Now they have greenhouses over two "donum" and they plan to establish a new greenhouse with the help of this FATEN loan.

Bahia appears in the picture while planting her land.

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem is married with four children. He has this small grocery shop in the center of his village. Hazem has had this shop for around two years, and it is the main source of income for the family. In addition to it, he has some land planted with olive trees where he sells  some olive oil in season.

In his grocery shop he sells vegetables and canned and frozen food, in addition to candy, sweets and other things, Hazem needs the  loan to buy more products for his shop since it is now Ramadan and there is high demand.

Hazem appears in the picture at his shop.

loans.use: To buy some products and vegetables for the shop

texts.en:
Tarek is 35 years old and married with four children. He is a hard-working man who is confident that he can work well. 

He has a shop in which he sells car accessories and oil for cars. He wants to take out an individual loan of $3,000 to purchase additional materials to expand his business. He hopes to be a good businessman in the future to support his family and his society. He says thank you.

Arwa is married and has 7 children. Arwa started raising sheep and goats five years ago. She started with only 2 sheep near her house in a small shed where she made cheese and yogurt from their milk for sale. She also sold milk to neighbours. She started this project to help her husband, who is employed in a sewing workshop, support their family.

Now, after five years, she has 70 sheep and goats. She has built a small barn for them and is still selling dairy products and also selling goats and sheep after raising them.

She needs this loan to buy a small carriage to use when they want to sell an animal. Arwa also has some land that she farms.

Arwa appears in the picture at the barn.

Jameel is married with 6 children. He has a workshop where he makes doors and furniture. There is good demand for his products since this is the only workshop in the area. This workshop is the only source of income for the family. 

Jameel needs the loan to purchase good quantity wood since if he pays cash he will get a much better price. 

Jameel appears in the picture at his workshop.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita G., 51, is a fruit vendor from Silang, Cavite. Her husband, Bernardo, is a farmer. Their only child is already out of school. Like most business entrepreneurs in the place, Teresita buys and sells assorted fruits that are in season. She has been doing this for the last five years and earns at least P4,000 a month. From her profits, she was able to purchase a tricycle and a brand new washing machine for the family. Teresita joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005. She is now on her 12th loan and expects to receive a new loan in the amount of P15,000 as additional capital to buy more fruit from the farms. Teresita is optimistic her tricycle will soon become a jeepney (a small bus) or a car. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati C. T. lives in Khokhana-Dobato.  She has two daughters and two sons. Her older daughter is studying in grade 11 and her younger daughter is studying in grade 10. Her sons are in primary and pre-primary school.

Mrs. T. is married to Mr. Ram C. T., who owns his own microbus. Mr. T. drives the microbus from Kathmandu to Birjung. Unfortunately, he was in an accident and his bus was damaged. To repair the microbus, Mrs. T. is requesting  a loan of NPR 30,000. She has already repaid her first loan from Kiva.

Mrs. Kamala Bashnet lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Nepal. Kamala has two sons; both are studying in Higher Secondary School. Her husband is a taxi driver and drives his taxi in Kathmandu valley. 
Kamala already has one cow and she sells cow's milk door-to-door daily, morning and evening. The demand for cow's milk is increasing in that area because grass-fed cow's milk is good for health. 



Now Kamala is requesting the second loan of Rs 25000.00 to purchase a young cow because of the increased demand for cow’s milk in her area. She has grassland of her own, so she does not has to buy food for her cows.

loans.name: Beli Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Beli Maya N. and her husband, Shyam N., both are tailors in the town of Bhaishepati, Lalitpur. They have their own tailor shop. Tailoring is their traditional work, which they learned from their forefathers. Their specialty is making custom-fitted dresses like the Kurta Sulwar pants and shirt, which are very popular in Nepal. They seek a Rs20000.00 loan to buy raw materials for their tailoring work. 
They have three sons and a daughter. Their older son works in a restaurant. Their second and younger sons are studying in grade 10 and 7, and their daughter is in grade 11. 

Their economic condition makes it very hard to fulfill the basic needs of their family. So they need the loan to expand their business so as to earn more money to support their family.

loans.use: to buys raw materials for her work

texts.en:
Miss Pranita T. is a single woman who lives in Thikedewol. Thikedewal is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.
Miss T. has four members, including herself, in her family. Her father's name is Mr. Pratap T., and he is a retired principal. Her older sister is a teacher and younger sister works in a beauty parlor.
Miss T. started the beauty salon with the help of her first kiva loan. The most popular services at Pranita’s beauty clinic are threading (a different method of removing hair to waxing) and facials. She took 6 months of training for the work.
Now she is requesting for Rs 15000.00 loan to buys different types of make-up tools for her business.

loans.name: Anu

texts.en:
Mrs. Anu S., 29-years-old, is a tailor in the town of Thikedewal in Lalitpur. She opened her tailoring shop three years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Salwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi and others. 

Before starting her own business, Mrs. S. took a six-month training course in tailoring. Now, Mrs. S. is requesting a NPR 15,000 loan to buy raw materials for her work. Mrs. S. lives in a single family with her husband and son. Her husband's name is Mr. Sanjay S. and he works in his own workshop. She has one son, who is studying in primary school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

texts.en:
Rice Farm is a group of five borrowers, led by Krubo K., who live in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Krubo is 40 years old with five children ranging in age from 8 to 15. Her 15-year-old is in the 3rd grade because education was not available during the war, which was centered in Lofa County.

Krubo is a warm, friendly, natural mother who took care of many orphans during the war. She is illiterate because until recently school was not available to girls because women were expected to marry men who would provide the income.  Her brother and sister in-law died in 1993 during the civil war so Krubo also provides for their child. Krubo’s husband is a farmer but doesn’t earn enough to support the family. She lives in nearby Bokeza Town in a refugee camp because the town was burned to the ground during the war.

Krubo’s business is dry goods, such as food, housewares and clothing, which she imports from nearby Guinea. She sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors. She is successful because her customers like her personality and customer service. Her dream is to grow her business until she can build a permanent shop.  With the profits from her business Krubo dreams of building a permanent house to raise her family and send all her children to school.

loans.name: United Club Group

texts.en:
United Club is a group of five borrowers, led by Gamon Y., who is living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Gamon is 29 years old with three children, aged two to four years old.  She is illiterate because although she wanted to attend school, her husband pressured her against it since the cultural norm is for girls to rely on their husbands to provide. Gamon’s husband is a farmer but doesn’t earn enough to support the family.  She now lives in nearby Borkeza Town in a refugee camp because the town was burned to the ground during the war.  

Gamon’s business consists of selling dry food goods, such as onions, biscuits and spices, of which she imports from nearby Guinea. She sells these items in a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors.  She has been running her business for three years now.  She is successful because her customers like her personality and customer service.  Her dream is to grow her business until she can build a permanent shop.  With the profits from her business, Gamon dreams of building a permanent house, sending her children to school, and learning how to read and write.

loans.use: To increase her dry goods inventory and sales so that she can build a permanent house, send her children to school, and learn how to read and write.

loans.name: Bengoma #1 Group

texts.en:
Bengoma #1 is a group of five borrowers, led by Makula D., who is living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Makula is 36 years old with three children, aged two to nine years old.  Currently, the nine year-old is in 2nd grade. She is Muslim and is from Guinea where schools at the time were not available for girls. Thus, she is illiterate. Makula's husband is a fisherman but doesn’t earn enough to support the family.  She now lives in nearby Borkeza Town in a refugee camp because the town was burned to the ground during the war.  

Makula’s business consists of selling fish wholesale in the market in a stall alongside approximately 10 other vendors.  She has been running her business for three years.  In the dry season, fish are plentiful so she sells her husband’s catch, but in the rainy season she needs to purchase fish wholesale to sell in the market.  She is requesting a loan for this fish purchase and also to buy additional baskets and bags to transport them.  She is successful because her customers like the way she prepares her fish for consumption.  Her dream is to grow her business to be a year-long business, unlike those who go out of business during the rainy season.  With the profits from her business, Makula dreams of building a permanent shop for her year-round business, sending her children to school, and building a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish and to buy baskets for transporting them

loans.name: Put Hands Together Group

texts.en:
Put Hands Together is a group of five borrowers, led by Weedor M., who is from Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Weedor is 42 years old with five children, aged 14 to 23 years old. None of the children has gone to school.  Weedor was forced to drop out of high school and was given to an elderly man as one of his many wives. The children weren’t allowed to attend school since as the last of his wives, this opportunity was not granted.  She also cares for her four nephews because her brother was killed in the civil war, along with her first husband.  She now lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Weedor’s business consists of selling dry goods, including food items, clothing, and housewares, in the Bokeza market in a stall alongside other vendors.  She has been running her business for the past two years.  She’s requesting a loan to purchase additional inventory so that she can run a small store out of her house instead of traveling each day to markets in nearby villages.  She treats her customers so well that she believes they will come to her larger store run out of her house. In the long-term, she wants to build a boarding home, to complement her shop, for displaced victims of the war.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory so that she can run a small store out of her house instead of traveling each day to markets in nearby villages

loans.name: Togetherness #2 Group

texts.en:
Togetherness #2 consists of a group of five borrowers, led by Manyunbry K., who is from Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Manyunbry is single, as a result of having refused to live a life of polygamy with her husband.  She has three children, aged eight to 13 years old who are in fourth through sixth grades. Weedor was forced to drop out of high school and was given to an elderly man as one of his many wives. She now lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Manyunbry business consists of selling palm oil wholesale, which is used for cooking and making soap in the Bokeza market and other markets in a stall alongside other vendors.  She has been running her business for the past two years.  Today, her business is only open when she has inventory, even though the demand is constant.  She’s requesting a loan so that she can purchase raw materials and increase her inventory sufficiently so she can keep her business open year-round.  She treats her customers so well that she believes they will come to her store year-round from adjacent villages.  With the profits, she will invest in the future of her kids, especially to send them to school - of which she was unable to attend.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for soap production so that she can run her business year-round

loans.name: Try And See #1 Group

texts.en:
Try And See #1 consists of a group of five borrowers, led by Krubo K., who is from Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Krubo and her husband were escaping from the war when they were attacked in an ambush; he did not survive.  Krubo is 41 years old.  She had eight children but four died during the war. Her four children are aged nine to 25 and all live with her.  The 25 year-old is still in high school.  She also cares for two orphans of unknown parentage.  Krubo now lives in nearby Borkeza Town. 

Krubo’s has a bakery, where she makes bread, chips, and other products. With the loan she hopes to purchase raw materials to increase her inventory to meet customer demand.  She sells her goods in the Bokeza market and other markets.  She has been running her business for the past two years.  Her products are sought-out by customers because of their taste.  With the profits, she will invest in the business to expand it and also to improve the bakery to make it safe for her staff (fire pit).  She also hopes to take care of her four kids and two orphans to continue school.

loans.use: To purchase of raw materials in order to increase her inventory to meet customer demands for baked goods

loans.name: Group Of Love

texts.en:
Group of Love consists of five borrowers led by Yarkpawolo Z. who live in Borkeza Town, which is near Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia. Yarkpawolo is 27 years old and married with three kids, ages two to nine. He has recently returned to high school part time to complete his degree after dropping out during the war.

Yarkpawolo runs a rice production business, using a machine to ready the rice for storage and consumption. He has been running his business for five years. Yarkpawolo is an innovator, one of the few people in Lofa County with a machine like this, so he is much sought after during the dry season. 

Yarkpawolo will use his loan to purchase fuel and make improvements to his machine to keep it running longer and be more profitable. He then plans to invest in a bigger machine to meet demand and make sure his three kids can complete school.

loans.use: For expenditure on a used and new rice machine

loans.name: Bengoma #3 Group

texts.en:
Bengoma #3 is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Musa K., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia. Musa is married with 2 kids, age 1 and 3. Musa is 27 years old, and was 3 years old when he was orphaned. He lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Musa runs a soap production business, both producing and selling it in the Borkeza market. He has been running his business for 3 years, and with the loan he will purchase raw materials (custy soda, fuel, palm oil, etc) to grow inventory in order to meet demand. Musa is successful because of excellent products and customer service. With the profits he will build a permanent shop in town and save for his children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for soap production.

texts.en:
Dengola is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Mafata K., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia. Mafata is married with 9 children, age 8 to 30. Mafata is 45 years old, and lives in nearby Borkeza Town.

Mafata has been running a fried fish restaurant for the last 10 years, purchasing the fish locally and preparing them in her Borkeza market stall. With the loan she will purchase materials (palm oil, fish, flour) to serve more customers. Mafata is successful because she prepares and markets her fish well. With the profits she dreams of building a permanent restaurant in town and saving for her children's education.

texts.fr: Bintou Sané, 52 ans, marié avec 10 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de ALWAR depuis 8 ans. Elle a contracté ce prêt pour réfectionner et renforcer  sa gargote où elle vend tous les matins le petit déjeuné. Parallèlement à cette activité elle vend des sacs à main et des chaussures pour dames. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent d'assurer la plus part des dépenses quotidiennes, et de prendre en charge la santé de la famille
texts.en:
Bintou Sané, age 52, is married and has ten children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de ALWAR for eight years.  She has taken on this loan to refurbish and reinforce her eatery, where she sells breakfast every morning.  Concurrently, she sells handbags and shoes for women.  The profits she earns enable her to cover the bulk of day-to-day expenses and to support the family's health.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

God Gave is a group of five borrowers led by Yassa M. who lives in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia (Yassa lives in nearby Bokeza). Yassa is 33 years old and married with three children, ages one to ten. Yassa deals in wholesale palm oil, which is used for cooking and making soap. She has been operating her business for ten years in a stall alongside other vendors in Bokeza. 

Today her business is only open when she has inventory, even though the demand is constant. She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory so she can keep her business open year round and extend her sales beyond Bokeza market. With the profits she plans to build her own shop as part of her house and invest in the future of her kids, especially for school, which she was unable to attend.

texts.fr: Cécile Manga est une femme de 47 ans, elle est célibataire et a 5 enfants en charge. Depuis 8 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ALWAR dont elle est la trésorière. Avec ce prêt elle développe un petit commerce de tissu. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de cette activité lui permettent d'assurer la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants et de leur offrir de meilleures conditions de vie.

texts.en:
Poor, No Friend is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Krubo K., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Krubo is married with 5 children, age 2-7.  Krubo is 33 years old, illiterate, and lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Krubo’s business is palm oil wholesale.  Palm oil is used for cooking and making soap.  Krubo sells in the Bokeza market and other markets in a stall alongside other vendors.  She has been running her business for 3 years.  Today her business is only open when she has inventory, even though the demand is constant.  

She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can keep her business open year-round and increase her sales beyond Bokeza market.  With the profits she dreams of building a market out of her house, and investing in the future of her kids.  She especially wants to send them to school, as she was unable to attend.

loans.name: Dieneba

texts.fr: Diénabou S. est une femme mariée de 45 ans, elle a 6 enfants en charge. L'objectif de son crédit est d'acheter et de revendre des tissus et des draps de lit. Ses bénéfices lui serviront à appuyer son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille, d'améliorer les conditions de vie des enfants et de leur assurer la santé et la scolarité.
texts.en:
Diénabou S., age 45, is a married woman who has six children to support.  The goal of her loan is to buy and resell fabric and bed cloth.  Her profits will be used to support her husband in providing for the family, to improve the children's living conditions, and to ensure that their health care and schooling are covered.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop a business of bed cloth and fabric

texts.en:
Bangoma #2 is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Kagbah D., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Kagbah is married with 6 children, ages 12-29.  Her oldest is in the 9th grade, she is behind due to the war.  Kagbah is 40 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Kagbah’s business is palm oil wholesale in the Bokeza market and other markets in a stall alongside other vendors.  Palmoil is used for cooking and making soap.  Kagbah has been running her business for 3 years.  Today her business is only open when she has inventory, even though the demand is constant.  She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can keep her business open year-round and increase her sales beyond Bokeza market.  With the profits she dreams of building a market out of her house, invest in the future of her kids, especially school which she was unable to attend.

We Thank God is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Yassa S., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Yassa is married with 1 child, age 4.   She  is 20 years old, has completed the 9th grade, and lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Yassa’s business is a cookshop, a form of fast food for day laborers, in Bokeza town. She has been running her business for 1 year.   She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can serve more customers.  With the profits she dreams of building a bigger restaurant to serve more than just day laborers, invest in the future of her kids, especially investing in sending them to school since she was unable to finish.

Nothing for Nothing is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Rebecca L., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Rebecca is married with 4 children, age 6-12, who are all in school.  She also takes care of 2 orphans.   She is 34 years old, is illiterate, and lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Rebecca’s business is selling rice retail, which she buys wholesale, in Bokeza town. She has been running her business for 3 years.   She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can serve more customers.  With the profits she dreams of building a more permanent shop, investing in the future of her kids, especially school which she was unable to attend.

texts.fr: Fatou Idy S. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est mariée et a la charge de 2 enfants dont une est à l'école. C'est une femme très dynamique et participe beaucoup au développement de son terroir en animant des émissions éducatives en langue locale au niveau de la radio. Elle est également présidente de son Banc Villageois dont elle est membre depuis 8 ans. Les revenus de son commerce lui servent à prendre en charge la scolarité de sa fille et les autres besoins de la famille
texts.en:
Fatou Idy S. is a 59-year-old married woman who has two children to support.  One of them is in school.  A very energetic woman, she contributes a great deal to developing her terrain while hosting educational radio broadcasts in the local language.  She is also the president of her village lending group, in which she has been a member for eight years.  The revenues from her business are used to meet the schooling needs of her daughter and the needs of the family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Gavelela is a group of 5 borrowers, led by James Z., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  James is married with 1 child, age 7, who is in kindergarten.  He  is 28 years old, has an 8th grade education, and lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

James’ business is selling dry goods retail, including clothing, toiletries, and jewelry, which he buys wholesale in neighboring Guinea.  He has been running his business for 8 years.   He’s taking a loan to increase his inventory sufficiently so he can serve more customers.  With the profits he dreams of building a more permanent shop, and investing in the future of his son, especially investing in education he was unable to complete school.

loans.name: Wake Up And Help Me Group

texts.en:
Wake Up and Help Me is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Gaydeo M., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Gaydeo is married with 3 children, age 9-13, who are all in school.  He is 30 years old, is illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Gaydeo’s business is selling dry foods in the market.  The dry food he sells include manpo (local spice for cooking), salt, sugar, etc.  He buys these items wholesale in neighboring Guinea.  He has been running his business for 8 years.   He’s taking a loan to increase his inventory sufficiently so he can serve more customers.  With the profits he dreams of building a more permanent shop and investing in the future of his children, especially investing in education since he was unable to attend school.

texts.fr: Khady D. Est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et a 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois De ALWAR depuis 2 ans et demi. Avec son prêt elle achète des balais, du jus de citron et de l'huile de palme qu'elle revend à Ziguinchor et à la capital (Dakar). Avec les bénéfices qu'elle réalise elle soutien son mari par rapport à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Khady D. is a 30-year-old married woman who has three children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois De ALWAR for two and a half years.  With her loan, she's purchasing brooms, lemon juice, and palm oil that she resells in Ziguinchor and in the capital (Dakar).  With the profits she earns, she support her husband in regard to improving family living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Sorryful Women is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Gamai K., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Gamai is married with 7 children, age 14-20.  The oldest is only in the 9th grade because she was forced to drop out during the war.  Gamai is 35 years old and she is illiterate.  Currently, shelives in Borkeza Town.  

Gamai’s business is selling vegetables and other food goods in the market.  Items she sells include cassava, potatoes, yams, peppers, watermelon, lemon and other fruit.  All these food items come from her neighboring country, Guinea.  Gamai has been running her business for 8 years.   She’s taking a loan to increase his inventory sufficiently so she can serve more customers.  With the profits she dreams of building a more permanent shop and investing in the future of her children, especially investing in education since she was unable to attend school.

Togetherness is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Krubo Y., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  

Krubo is married with 4 children, ages 5-22.  Her 15 year old is only in the 6th grade because she was forced to drop out during the war.  Krubo is 35 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Krubo’s business is selling dry food goods in the market, including onions, manpo (local spice), sugar, salt, tomato sauce, etc.  She buys these food items wholesale in neighboring Guinea.  She has been running her business for 2 years.   She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can serve more customers.  With the profits she dreams of building a more permanent shop and investing in the future of her children, especially investing in education since she was unable to attend school.

texts.fr: Marie G. est une femme de 50 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ALWAR  dont elle est responsable d'un groupe de solidarité "TACKO" Avec son prêt elle développe un petit commerce de jus de citron et d'huile de palme. Les profits générés de son activité lui permettent de participer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Marie G. is a 50-year-old woman who is a widow and the mother of four children.  She is a member of Banc Villageois de ALWAR where she is the manager of the solidarity group "TACKO".  With her loan, she's developing a small business for lemon juice and palm oil.  The profits generated from her business will allow her to help cover family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

God Give is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Krubo K., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Krubo is a widow with 2 children, ages 12 and 18, who are in 3rd and 9th grade.   Both her children are a bit behind, because they were forced to drop out of school during the war.  Krubo is 35 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Krubo’s business is selling dry goods retail in the market, including onions, manpo (local spice), biscuits, batteries, etc. She buys these items wholesale in neighboring Guinea.  She has been running her business for 3 years.   Now, she is taking a loan to increase her inventory so she can serve more customers.  With the profits she dreams of building a more permanent shop and investing in the future of her children, especially investing in educations since she was unable to attend school.

loans.name: Let's Love One Another Group

texts.en:
Let’s Love One Another is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Eyea L., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Eyea is married with 3 children, age 5-10, all are now in school.  Eyea is 31 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Eyea runs a soap production business, both producing and selling it in the Bokeza market.  She has been running her business for 4 years, and with the loan she will purchase raw materials (custy soda, fuel, palm oil, etc) to grow inventory in order to meet demand.  Eyea is successful because of excellent products and customer service.  With the profits she will build a permanent shop in town and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: purchase custy soda, fuel, and palm oil for soap production

texts.fr: Opelly G. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Tilène Central depuis 3 ans et demi. Avec son prêt elle va réfectionner sa petite boutique qui se trouve au marché et la renforcer en marchandises (choux pommé, carottes, pomme de terre et piment et d'autres condiments pour cuisine) Avec le bénéfices générés par son commerce elle prend en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et leurs offre de meilleures conditions de vie
texts.en:
Opelly G. is a 47-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois de Tilène Central for three and a half years. With her loan, she's going to refurbish her small store, which is found at the marketplace, and to bolster it with merchandise (cabbages, carrots, potatoes, chili peppers, and other condiments for cooking). With the profits generated by her business, she covers the cost of schooling her children and provides better living conditions for them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Teegaluo Group

texts.en:
Teegaluo is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Forkpa L., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Forkpa is married with 2 children, ages 3 and10.  The older child is in the 1st grade because school was interrupted during the war.  Forkpa is 26 years old, with an 11th grade education, and he lives in Borkeza Town.  

Forkpa’s business is selling rice retail, which he buys wholesale, in Bokeza town. He has been running his business for 3 years.   He’s taking a loan to increase his inventory so he can serve more customers.  With the profits he dreams of building a more permanent shop, investing in the future of his kids, especially in education since he was unable to complete school.

loans.use: Purchase bags of rice to increase inventory

loans.name: New Life Group

texts.en:
New Life is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Yassa E., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Yassa is married with 3 children, ages 4-12.  The oldest child is in the 4th grade because school was interrupted during the war.  Yassa is 26 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Yassa runs a soap production business, both producing and selling it in the Bokeza market.  She has been running her business for 5 years, and with the loan from LEAP, she will purchase raw materials for making soap such as custy soda, fuel, palm oil.  This will allow her to grow her inventory in order to meet the demand.  Yassa  is successful because of excellent products and customer service.  With the profits she will build a permanent shop in town and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to produce soap

texts.en:
United Group is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Kebbeh M., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Kebbeh is married with 5 children, ages 6-15.  None of these children are able to attend school.  Kebbeh is 36 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Kebbeh’s business is selling palm oil wholesale.  Palmoil is used for cooking and making soap.  Kebbeh sells in the Bokeza market in a stall alongside other vendors.  She has been running her business for 3 years.  Today her business is only open when she has inventory, even though the demand is constant.  She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can keep her business open year-round.  She treats her customers so well that she believes they will come to her year-round from adjacent villages.  With the profits she will invest in the future of her kids, especially in education since she was unable to attend school.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Sr. Félix está casado con la Sra. Segunda hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos mayores todos casado e independientes de ellos.-
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados.-
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando han  educando a sus hijos y comprado todas las necesidades de su hogar.-
El Sr. Félix además de la despensa trabaja como empaquetador de carbón en su domicilio
El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones,-
texts.en:
Sr. Félix has been married to Sra. Segunda for several years. They have 4 grown children who are all married and living independently.

Together they run a small grocery store in their home, which is located in a very crowded neighborhood of the district. They began with a little capital that they got from other jobs they had carried out previously as wage earners. Thanks to the work they are accomplishing they have educated their children and purchased all the necessities of their household.

Aside from the grocery, Sr. Félix works at packaging charcoal in his house. He has shown himself to be a very responsible and honest person in keeping his commitments. He has already had other loans with us and fulfilled his obligations in excellent fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of varied merchandise:  sugar, rice noodles, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora María es soltera, tiene 51 años, con 5 hijos,  todos casados y con ingresos propios.
La despensa montó gracias a un pequeño capital que había  ahorrado durante varios años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta ambulante de ropas. 
Quiere comprar mercaderías al por mayor, pues, así consigue más barato y tiene un margen importante de ganancia. 
La señora María es una persona muy activa tiene un espíritu jovial, y cuenta con un carácter muy agradable por lo que muchas personas siempre está alrededor de ella. Manifiesta que quiere mejorar su negocio ya que es la fuente de su ingreso. 
Ella se esfuerza al  máximo para mejorar su casa, pero sin descuidarse del capital de su negocio por lo que considero que es una persona a quien debemos apoyar constantemente, ya sea económica y moralmente.

loans.use: Compra de Gaseosas, Yerbas, Vinos y Otros

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es separado tiene 3 hijas que viven con él, sus hijas ya son mayores de edad., todas trabajan con él en el negocio de la familia
         El se dedica a la venta de gaseosas en el micro centro, para dicha actividad le fabricaron unos carritos para la venta de gaseosas, vende solamente las gaseosas personales ya que son muy accesibles al público y la de mayor demanda en la zona. 
      Se inicio con un pequeño capital que tenía guardado de un trabajo que realizaba anteriormente, un amigo le fabrico los carritos. 
        El crédito solicitado va invertir en la compra de botellas ya que para el verano las ventas aumentan. 
        El demostró ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel is separated and has three daughters that live with him. His daughters are already adults. They all work with him at his family business. He sells soft drinks at a small market. To do this, they made little carts to sell their soft drinks. He only sells single-serving soft drinks since they are very accessible to the public and have the biggest demand in the region. He started with a small amount of capital that he had saved from a job he used to have. A friend made the carts for him. He will invest the requested credit in the purchase of bottles since his sales increase during the summer. He has proven himself to be a very hard-working and responsible person with his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bottles for soft drinks

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramón esta casado con la Sra. Laura hace varios años tienen 3 hijos menores que aún están en la escuela primaria, el mayor tiene 12 años y ya le ayuda a sus padres en el negocio,-
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que está ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente. El Sr. Ramón además trabaja como transportista en el micro centro,- 
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando pueden   educando a sus hijos y comprando todas las necesidades de su hogar.-
Ellos han demostrado ser  personas muy responsables y honestas en sus compromisos. 
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones,-

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías Varias, azúcar, arroz, fideo, jabones varios y otros,-

texts.es:
La señora Petrona está casada con el Sr. Porfirio tienen dos hijos  menores que estas cursando el nivel medio en un colegio del estado. 
Ella es costurera tiene un pequeño taller de costura. Petrona estudio corte y confección cuando aún vivía con sus padres.  
Su marido le ayudo con su trabajo a comprar sus maquinas, ella también trabajaba con una amiga y así junto un poco de dinero para ayudar a su marido. 
Hoy día ella es una profesional en su trabajo todo tipo de prendas de vestir. 
El Sr. Porfirio es asalariado trabajando en una empresa privada como vendedor y de esa forma le ayuda a la señora con los gastos del hogar, 
Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable en sus compromisos
texts.en:
Sra. Petrona is married to Sr. Porfirio. They have two dependent children who are starting the next grade level at a state school.

She is a seamstress who owns a small sewing workshop. Petrona studied dressmaking while she was still living her parents. Her husband supported her business by purchasing her machines. She employed a friend of hers who is working to earn a little money to help support her husband.

Today Petrona is a professional at her work and is capable of making all types of clothing. Sr. Porfirio is a salaried worker at a private business. He works as a salesman and is able to help his wife with the household expenses. Sra. Petrona has demonstrated that she is very responsible with her financial commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
La Sra. Estefana González de Rodríguez es propietaria de un negocio de compras de aluminios, cobres, plásticos, y fabricación de baterías para automóviles. Posee el negocio desde el año 2,000, y trabajan en forma familiar debido a que es madre de 6 hijos.
 inició con un capital que obtuvo de una empresa financiera lo cual mantiene buenas referencias comerciales ,  cabe mencionar que el negocio está ubicado al costado de una de las avenidas más concurridas de la ciudad, se trata de personas trabajadoras y pioneras en la zona del Alto Parará.
texts.en:
Señora Estefana González de Rodríguez is the owner of a business that buys aluminum, copper, and plastic, and that makes car batteries. She has had this business since the year 2000, and they work as a family since she is the mother of 6 children. She started with capital that she obtained from a financing company that has good commercial references. It is worth mentioning that her business is located on one of the most frequented streets in the city. It has hard-working people and pioneers in the Alto Parará region.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aluminum, copper, plastic, and other items

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es:
La señora María es casada, tiene 48 años, el nombre de su negocio es en alusión a uno de sus hijos, pues tiene 2 hijos, un varón y una mujer. Ambos ya son mayores de edad y trabajan; por lo tanto ya no depende del ingreso de la señora.
La despensa montó gracias a un pequeño capital que le había aportado su marido, el negocio tiene más de 19 años de antigüedad, con una vasta clientela y esta a nivel de la competencia. 
Ella necesita aumentar su stock de mercaderías para poder satisfacer la demanda, cabe destacar que es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de superación, por lo tanto, recomiendo a que se le apoye constantemente para que ella pueda alcanzar su meta. Su máximo sueño es mejorar su negocio y llegar a un nivel de vida superior a lo que está actualmente.

loans.use: Compra de Harinas, Yerbas, Vinos y Otros

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es:
El señor Sixto es casado, tiene 54 años de edad, con 5 hijos, de los cuales 1 solo depende de él económicamente.

El montó su despensa hace 9 años, con un pequeño capital que había ahorrado, además de la despensa tiene un ingreso agregado por servicios de fletes en su camión de cargas. 
La jornada de el comienza muy temprano, pues, a las 5 de la mañana está en pie dispuesto a cualquier actividad que se presente. 
Por fortuna tiene el apoyo de todos sus hijos y su esposa por lo que los compromisos asumidos por él pueden cumplir con cabalidad. 
 Su máximo sueño es comprar un camión más grande.

loans.use: Compra de Vinos, Yerbas, Azúcar y Otros

texts.es:
El Sr. Angel S. de 43 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Gloria Mareco de 37 años de edad, con 2 hijas.
   Don Angel se inició en esta actividad, cuando regreso del vecino pais Argentina, aproximadamente en el año 2.002; ya que su profesión es mecánico general compró todas las herramientas y máquinas necesarias para empezar a trabajar. En la actualidad ya cuenta con una gran clientela que concurre a su local por los buenos servicios que les ofrece. 
   El invertiría este crédito en generar un nuevo empleo a su esposa, como vendedora de ropas.
Desea un país prospero para todos los paraguayos.
texts.en:
Mr. Angel S. and Mrs. Gloria Mareco are 43 and 37 years of age and are married with two daughters. Angel started his business when he returned to Paraguay from Argentina in approximately 2002. Since he is a general mechanic, he bought all of the tools and equipment necessary to start working. Actually, he already has a strong clientele supporting his business because of the good services he offers. He will invest the loan to create a new job for his wife as a clothing salesperson. He hopes for a prosperous country for all Paraguayans.

Translated from Spanish by Cristina Bejarano, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Casildo

texts.es:
El Sr. Casildo O. de 28 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Antonia Espinola de 26 años de edad, ellos aun no tienen la dicha de tener hijos.
   Don Casildo se inició en esta actividad hace ya mucho tiempo, como empleado, durante ese tiempo el ahorraba su dinero poco a poco, hasta llegar a juntar el capital necesario como para comprar todas la herramientas y maquinas, para poder habilitar su propia chaperia y pintura, aproximadamente en el año 2,007. 
En la actualidad trabaja con una entidad vendedora de automóviles, y otros clientes ocasionales. 
   El invertiría este crédito en la compra de materiales, como pinturas, masillas, lijas y otros.

loans.use: Comprar Materiales como: pinturas, masillas, lijas y otros.

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
El señor Neri R. de 53 años está casado hace 28 años con la señora Edelia Cristaldo de 46 años de edad, el matrimonio cuenta con siete hijos de los cuales 6 siguen viviendo con sus padres, las dos últimas de los hijos de 15 y 17 años están estudiando, el primero está cursando el primer año del bachillerato en contabilidad y la otra sigue el bachillerato en salud y el anhelo de los padres es que estos hijos puedan terminar una carrera universitaria ya que los otros no tuvieron esa posibilidad.-
El Sr. Neri está en este negocio como vendedor ambulante hace 7 años, con un capital que pudo juntar de su  trabajo anterior porque trabajo mucho tiempo en una cervecería y de esa liquidación compró para su vehículo y más tarde empezó a dedicarse a la venta ambulante de mercaderías. 
Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como pinturas para cabellos, hilos, sombrillas, pinza para  cejas, maquillajes, portarretratos, reloj de pared, medias y ropas  interior para damas. 
 Así logrará aumentar su stock de mercaderías y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Para la compra de pinturas para cabellos,compra de hilo, compra de sombrilla, compra de pinza para cejas, compra de maquillaje, compra de portaretratos, compra de reloj de pared, compra de media, etc.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
El señor Nestor de 33 años de edad vive hace 4 años con su pareja, la señora Juana  de 30 años. La pareja tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.
   Desde hace 5 años, Don Nestor se encuentra al frente de un taller de baterias para vehículos y motos. En dicho rubro se inició con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba de su antiguo empleo en donde se desempeñaba como mecánico otro taller en el cual trabajo 10 años. En su taller recibe la ayuda de su hermano  que le ayuda, para ofrecer los que exige la clientela.
 Actualmente ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada gracias a su personalizada atención y de buena calidad.
Como sueño personal desea ampliar el negocio de venta y taller de baterías, teniendo en cuenta que este rubro lleva mucho capital. 
    Solicita el préstamo para la compra de baterías.
texts.en:
Sr. Nestor is 33 years old and has been living the past 4 years with his partner Juana, who is 30 years old. The couple has a 2 year old son.

For the past 5 years, Don Nestor has been operating a retail shop where he sells batteries for automobiles and motorcycles. He started this business using his savings from his previous job as a mechanic at another shop, where he worked for 10 years. He manages his business with the help of his brother, who helps assist customers in finding what they need. His existing clientele appreciates the personalized attention and high quality of his products.

Don Nestor dreams of expanding his battery store and increasing his sales. Acquiring additional batteries takes a considerable amount of capital, which is why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his inventory of automobile & motorcycle batteries

texts.es:
El Sr. Ramon V. de 56 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Maria Benitez de 50 años de edad, con 2 hijos.
   Don Ramon se inició en esta actividad,  aproximadamente en el año 1.988; con el capital que su padre le dio, con lo cual  compró mercaderías, en un principio ropas y perfume, en la actualidad solo perfumes, además proveyendo a más de trecientas personas en forma continua. 
   El invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías (perfumes) atendiendo que  comercializará a crédito a en una zona nueva.

loans.name: Boverlita

texts.en:
Boverlita L., 59, is a rice grower. She owns a 1.5-hectare rice field, which she inherited from her parents. She has 11 children who are all her inspirations to do well in the farming business. Her eldest child is 40 years old.

She would like to request a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy quality rice seeds as well to pay for fertilizers to improve the soil's condition. 

She dreams of having a bigger farm someday, of hiring more workers and of having an abundant harvest. In that way, she could not just support her own family but other people as well.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio P. is a 49-year-old farmer. His main crop is rice. He saves half of his rice harvest for family consumption and sells the remaining half to his friends for additional income for his family. 

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pay the laborers who help prepare the farm.

He wishes that someday he could buy more farms so that he could better support his five children.

loans.use: Fertilizers and payment for the laborers

texts.en:
Rosalie J. is a pig farmer. She likes pigs very much, and that is why she has made them her business for quite a long time now. In 2007, she began to raise one piglet, and increased to two, three and now five pigs. She sells each pig for PHP 9,000 each, and she says that hog raising is a very feasible business to gain income with.
She would like to request a loan of PHP 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy piglets and piglet feed. The loan is truly worthwhile because she currently doesn't have enough money to support her piggery, and receiving a loan will save her business from suffering. 

She likes the services of CEVI so much. She says, "In CEVI, clients receive not just loans, but education as well."

54-year old Nelly Fajagutama owns and manages a small basic store. She has five children, the eldest of whom is 32 years old, and her children are her inspiration to perform better in her retailing ventures. She started her business in 1992. The business grew well, and now she has plenty to display. 

She hopes to open a grocery store next year , where she could hire workers, display more goods and earn a larger income.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. Receiving this loan will help her enough to grow her business and attract more customers.

She likes CEVI services a lot. She says that "In CEVI, people are taught to do business and savings, and are provided with financial assistance in the form of credit or loan."

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
56-year-old Evelyn E. is a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice to help pay the expenses in their home, which are increasing because her grandchildren are living with them also. She started her business in 2005. Farming is not a difficult job for her because she grew up on the farm and her parents are farmers.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy insecticides and to pay the laborers who will harvest her crop. Someday, her dream is to have a larger farm so that she will have many workers and more harvest to share with other people.
She likes CEVI a lot and she hopes to make use of CEVI loans again in the future.

loans.use: To pay the farm laborers and purchase insecticides

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Idunda D borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 10,5 years.

Hilda started her own business selling charcoal 8 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 185,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Hilda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Hilda hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe A. is 33 years old, and was born in Yerevan. He has graduated from the State Engineering University of Armenia, Machine Building Economy Department. After graduation he worked in a hothouse as an economist. Vahe is married and his wife is a manager in a travel agency.

Six years ago he began his business, which consists of adornment production of precious metals. He rents a place in a jewelry trade market. Vahe needs $3,000 to fulfill an order for one of his clients, a set of jewelry which contains a ring, earrings and a bangle.

loans.use: Making a set of jewelry, which contains a ring, earrings and a bangle.

texts.en:
Devotha is a member of the Idunda D borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 20 years old woman,she is singe,she cares for 1 dependent.

Devotha started her own business selling fabric materials like kanga,vitenge 5 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 145,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Devotha first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Devotha hopes to save money and expand her business

loans.name: Anne Kwamboka

texts.en:
Anne is married and runs a bookstore as her primary business. She also does farming on the side. She has been in the bookstore business for the past five years and she is able to earn a profit of 7000/= per month.

Anne has never borrowed from any financial institution before. She has applied for a loan which she hopes to use a part of to add more stock in her shop and also to buy fertilizer and other chemicals for her secondary business which is farming.

Anne plans to build a bigger bookshop in the future.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To add more books to her shop and to buy fertilizer for her farm

texts.en:
Antony K. is a married man who is blessed with one son. He is a tailor and also sells ready-made clothes. He has been operating the business for the past two years with a monthly profit of approximately 11,000/=.

He wants to use the loan to boost his business by buying plain fabrics and to purchase ready-made dresses.

In the future, he hopes to venture into public transport.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.name: Kemuning Sari Group

texts.en: Ni Putu Miryani (-) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu. She is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Kemuning Sari (DNR.M-0592). Ni Putu Miryani is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month. In 2008, Ni Putu Miryani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 1,100,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 4th from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.
