About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** NI Putu Miryani - (-) merupakan 35 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu. NI Putu Miryani adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 13 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Kemuning Sari (DNR.M-0592). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. NI Putu Miryani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI Putu Miryani menghasilkan sekitar 0,300 IDR. Dalam 2008, NI Putu Miryani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. NI Putu Miryani telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.100.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and sell

texts.en:
Maren Akinyi is a 40-year-old lady. She is married to Austine and they have two children. She is in the business of selling second hand clothes in Migori, a populous town about 300 miles from the capital city Nairobi. Her clients mainly comprise the low income group, and she has been in this business for six years. She gets her stock from Nairobi and sells at a profit. 

Maren learnt about KADET through a friend who is an existing client. This will be her second loan and she intends to use the money to purchase more stock. She also hopes to diversify into selling school uniform, which is usually in season after the December festive season to ensure that she has a steady income from her business.

She aspires to start a boutique in a permanent structure, since currently she sells from a semi-permanent structure.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a member of the pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 20,18,12 years.

Zubeda started her own  fishing  business selling fish 12years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 240,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Zubeda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more fish for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Zubeda hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza M. is a resident of Labakid, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 33 years old, married and has one school-aged daughter. To make a living, Liza owns a rice retailing business.  

In June 2007, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase more sacks of rice for sale. She believes that with the help of Paglaum MPC, her business will prosper.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice retailing business

texts.en:
Fatuma is a member of the pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,He is 50 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 26,24,22,19,15 years.

Fatuma started her own business selling Ice 19 years ago,she works 6 Hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Fatuma`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy feezer for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Fatuma hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

Maria C., 46, is from the village of Poblacion, Clarin,Misamis Occidental. Maria is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a clothing business. Her main source of income comes from general clothing sales to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP a month.

In 2009, Maria Glenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Maria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Wanglei A Amia Juliet Group

texts.en: A. Juliet is forty-two years old, married with five children and taking care of three dependents that one dependent is schooling. She sells fish so far twenty years while in her business. She is using the loan to purchase fish in much more volume for sale. With the loan she is hoping to improve upon her business. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to obtain a goat for keeping and purchase a bicycle which may help her while in transporting fish from source to markets.

loans.use: To purchase fish in much more volume for sale.

texts.en: Natividad D., 63, is from Pangalalan, Sindangan,Zamboanga del Norte.  She is married to Crisanto D. and has three children, all married.  Natividad is a member of the PAGLAUM MULTI-PURPOSE COOPERATIVE and is an active member seeking PHP 5,000 for her sari-sari (general) store.  She gives a warm thank you to you and the PAGLAUM MULTI-PURPOSE COOPERATIVE for helping her business and for insurance.

Leonora C. is from the village of Mialen,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Leonora raises livestock, primarily pigs for sale. Leonora has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the business.

------------------ About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Magdalena is a member of the Wazo borrower group in ilala,Iringa,she is 41 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 25,19, and 16 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Magdalena started her own grocery business selling beer ,soda 11 years ago,she works 14 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 210,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Magdalena`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more soda and beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Magdalena hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.name: Wanglei A Paculal Joyce Group

texts.en: Joyce P., 37, is married with four children, three of whom attend school, and she looks after three dependents that are schooling as well. In business for over ten years, Joyce sells both stationery and charcoal.  She is now requesting a loan to purchase stationery items and 50 bags of charcoal for sale in town. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to increase her stock and improve upon her stationery

loans.use: To purchase stationery items and charcoal (50 bags) mostly from far villages for sale in town

texts.en:
Albetah Akinyi is a thirty year old single lady mother of a boy of 10. She has been operating a photocopying business for the last two years. She began the business with some capital she got from her mother, who later introduced her to KADET Ltd since her monther is actually an existing client. 

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She hopes to use the money to purchase more stationery to prepare for the re-opening of school which is a peak season for this type of business.
She aspires to start big bookshop business.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

Siwema is a member of the Frelimo A borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 5 and 1 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Siwema started her own business selling charcoal 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.


This is Siwema`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Siwema hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business

loans.name: Wanglei A Ouci Teddy Group

texts.en: Teddy O., 26, married and blessed with two children attending school and taking care of one dependent, also in school, has been selling cassava flour and charcoal for the past year. She is applying for a loan to purchase bags of cassava flour and  charcoal to meet customer demand, and her hope is to expand the business and be able to support her family. Teddy's dream is to purchase a bicycle and a goat.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour and charcoal to meet the demand of her customers.

texts.en:
Faraja is a member of the Frelimo A borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 i child.Her child is aged 2 years.

Faraja started her own shop business selling rice,cooking oil, sugar 5 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 350,000 Tanzania shilling.

This is Faraja`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Faraja hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.name: Jumedi West Ongeiira Doreen Group

texts.en: Married and blessed with six children all attending school, Doreen O. is a group representative of Jumedi West.  She has been involved in the fish business for the past 13 years and is requesting a loan to purchase fish in large volume for sale. This will help her to work hard to improve upon her business as well as pay back the loan. Doreen is an encouraging 39-year-old businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children and purchase cows for livestock-raising.

loans.use: To purchase fish in volume for sale.

texts.en:
Domnic Osoro, 28, has been a mechanic for eight years. He is married to Elizabeth and they have two children ages 6 and one. His skills has enabled him to feed his family and cater to their needs.

He did not know how he could access a loan until a his friend told him about KADET Ltd. After making inquiries in he decided to register as a member and client. This is his first loan from KADET Ltd. He hopes to use the money to build a shelter, since he currently he works outdoors.

He aspires to have a big garage with a spare-parts shop one day.

loans.name: Jumedi East Anna Odarowa Group

texts.en:
Anna O. is representing her group. She is forty-three years old and is married with eight children who are schooling. She also looks after two dependents, one of whom is mentally disturbed.

Anna has been a tailor for over nineteen years. She is requesting the loan to purchase material for sewing clothes for sale and, more so, she wants to continue buying and selling fish as a side business.

Anna is hardworking and so encouraging. Her dream is to educate her children and to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase material for sewing clothes and also more fish to sell

texts.en:
Christine Adhiambo is a twenty-eight year old, single mother. She has been selling second hand clothes for the last nine years. Christine thinks her business has great potential due to its location, passion and experience.

She learned of KADET Ltd through her mother, an existing client. This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She hopes to purchase extra stock, since after studying business patterns, she feels the demand is high in September, October, November and December.

She has a long term goal to own a boutique.

-----------------
About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.name: Morice Oruko

texts.en:
Morice Oruko is a forty three year old businessman. He is married to Pamela and they have two children aged 12 and 10 years. He runs a small cybercafe with one employee, and has been in this business for three years.

Morice learnt of KADET Ltd through a friend who is an existing client. This is his third loan from KADET Ltd and he intends to use the money to purchase one more computer and pay for more bandwidth and connectivity to ensure the internet speed is faster than it has been. Since his cafe is located where the demand for internet exceeds the availability, this will be a great step towards enjoying loyalty from his clients.

He aspires to open a computer training college.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and increase internet connectivity.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice R. is a married mother of two: Mitchell and Billy aged 9 years and 4 years respectively. She is married to Nicholas who works in a hotel. Alice owns a beauty salon and also sells beverages in Shanzu. She has been operating the Salon for 6 years.

Alice learned of KADET through a client and she is now borrowing her first loan. She plans to buy cosmetics for her beauty salon and to also purchase a deep freezer for her beverage business. She hopes to open a general merchandise wholesale store in future through subsequent loans from KADET.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer and a variety of cosmetics.

texts.en:
Stumai is a member of the Frelimo Borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 55 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 6 children.Her children are aged 25,21,20,20, and 16 years.

stumai started her own business selling charcoal 18 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Stumai second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 In order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Stumai,hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

K. Julian is the leader of her lending group in Mukono, Nakifuma Sub County. She is 48 years old and a widow taking care of her 8 children of which 2 are in school plus 3 orphans although with the orphans, she only helps to cater for their health and food. Julian is a teacher by profession and she is also a business lady involved in the sale of produce for 10 years like matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes plus greens and vegetables. Although she buys the produce from other farmers, she is also a farmer and only buys out if her quantity is not enough for her customers. She is in need of a loan to help buy more produce for resale since she does not have enough for all her customers in the various markets that she moves to for the trade.

Rebecca is an industrious lady married to Edward, an electrician. They have three children. She sells stationery, photocopying, laminating and more. She has been in business for three years and it is located in the heart of Migori town, a strategic point for this type of business.

Rebecca learned about KADET Ltd through a friend at a time when she needed capital to expand her business. This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the money to purchase another computer to increase the speed at which she can typeset for clients. She has an employee assisting her.

She aspires to start a computer class, which will increase her income and help others improve their literacy skills.

------------- About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

Turfosa Achieng is a forty four year old lady married to Amos, a teacher. They have seven children between the ages of 25 and 11. She runs a small cafe in a semi-permanent building and has done so for the last three years. Income generated from this business has helped her educate her children and uplifted her living standards. Her clients are mainly employees from the town and teachers who are her husband's colleagues.

Turfosa learned about KADET Ltd through a friend who is an existing client and she joined. This is her second loan from KADET Ltd. She intends to use the money to extend her veranda and purchase more seats to accommodate more clients during the lunch time hour.

She aspires to purchase and develop a plot of land, where she can move her business.

--------------- About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.name: Isdora Atieno

texts.en:
Isdora Atieno, 34, is a single mother of two children, ages 11 and 8 years. She operates a small general store and has been in this business for six years. The income generated from this business helps her raise her children and pay their school fees and for an orphaned nephew.

One of her friends, an existing client told her about KADET Ltd and its loan graduation policy and she decided to join. This is her fifth loan from KADET Ltd. She will use this money to restock her shop and expand to selling school bags, since schools are about to reopen.

She aspires to purchase a plot of land and build rental houses.

--------- About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Purchase bags and restock the shop.

texts.en:
Erick Otieno is thirty one years and married to Lilian. They have three children aged 7, 5 and 3. He runs a shoe selling business and is assisted by his wife. He's been in this business for the last three years. Erick buys shoes from vendors in Nairobi and sells them for a profit in Migori, a populous town.

Erick learned about KADET Ltd from a friend who is an existing client. This is his first loan. He is excited about the loan and has ambitions to grow the scale of his business. He intends to use the loan to increase stock in readiness for the school re-opening and the approaching festive season, when he expects to make great sales.

He harbors a dream to expand his business and start importing expensive shoes, thereby changing his target market and profits.

------------ About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.name: Dassan's Group

texts.en:
M. Dassan is the leader of a lending group in Kirinya, Bweyogerere. He is a married man with four children as he cares for two dependants under one roof.

He buys plots of land and houses and rents to people at a fee. He is well known and gets along with them and wins more customers. He also sells construction sand for housing and has a brick laying business. He employs two men. He needs a loan to buy another piece of land where he can get more sand for sale and for laying more bricks. This will help him get more money for his children’s education and for their well being.

loans.use: Buy a piece of land for brick laying and for sand for sale.

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Frelimo A borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 16,14,11 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Maria started her own shop business selling cooking oil,sugar,rice,Colgate 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Maria`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Maria hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.name: Chiku

texts.en:
Chiku is a member of the Kitanzini borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 19,15,13 years.

Chiku started her own business selling food 12 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Chiku`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more food commodities.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Chiku hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,cooking oil.sugar for food

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 45-year-old widowed woman with six children aged 22, 18, 16, 14, 13 and 10 years. Five of her children go to school. Sarah rents a three-roomed house where she stays with all her children. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Sarah resides and works in a semi-urban area.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping as she buys the charcoal from Nakasongola, a far-off rural area. The major challenges she faces in her business are transport costs, rainy seasons and intervention by traffic police. She needs to get a document from police that allows her to transport charcoal. She sells her charcoal door-to-door. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Sarah has been in this business for the last four years and has been with MCDT for four years working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock. Sarah is aspiring to see her business grow to enable her to pay school fees for her children and to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Faridah's Group

texts.en: N. Faridah is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is a married lady with 5 children all school going and has a business of selling produce from a stall in Mukono as well as moving with produce to the various markets on a truck. She gets her produce from the villages where the prices are a bit favorable and loads on a truck together with her fellow farmers to her destination. She is now experienced in the job after 8 years of operation and she hopes that with a loan, she will be able to recapitalize her business to have more of different produce to sell. She will need to buy matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes and many others once given a loan for resale.

loans.use: Buying matooke, cassava, sweet potatoes and others for resale.

texts.en:
Tatu is a member of the KItanzini borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 25 years old woman.she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 7,5, and 2 years.

Tatu started her own clothing business selling kanga and vitenge(fabric)5 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings. 

This is Tatu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes(fabric) for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Tatu hopes to save more money,pay school fees,get more food for her family and expand her business.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a 42-year married with five children aged between 27 and 7 years.  All her children go to school. Teopista takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area.   She incurs extra transport to and from shopping. She buys charcoal from Kiboga, a far away rural area and sells it near her residence. She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and transport and she faces a lot of difficult getting and transporting charcoal during a rainy season. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Teopista has been with MCDT for twelve years servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more charcoal and buy working assets (sacks) in preparation for the forthcoming rainy season. Teopista is aspiring to see her business grow to enable take all her children through school.

loans.use: To stock more charcoal in preparation for the forthcoming rainy season.

texts.en:
Esha is a member of the Kitanzini borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 20,15 years.she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Esha started her own fishing business selling Fish 8 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Esha first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more fish for sale.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Esha hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet is a 45 year old lady and married with six children, ages 23 – 7 years. She takes care of orphans as well. She has run a bar and restaurant business for 15 years. Her major challenge is having limited capital which hinders her business. However her rescue has always been using loans. She wants to supply beer to other retailers.

She would also like to construct a residential house for her family and educate her children for self reliance. Juliet would like a loan to help add capital to her business to buy more food stuffs and beers and save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: Buy more food stuffs and beers to expand business.

texts.en:
Hidaya is a member of the Bwawani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 11,8,4 years.

Hidaya started her own grocery business selling beer,soda 7 years ago,she works 12hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 210,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Hidaya`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more soda and beer.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Hidaya hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Emma is a member of the Bwawani borrower group i Ilala,Iringa,she is 21 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is 3 years.

Emma started her own shop business selling rice,sugar,cooking oil,etc 5 years ago,she works 11 hours and earn monthly profit approximately 240,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Emma`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan.Emma hopes to save money expand her business.

loans.name: Flista's Group

texts.en:
Flista, 45, is the leader of her lending group in Mubende. She is a married lady with three children. Flista also takes care of five dependents as well.

Flista has a retail shop in Kiruuma that has been running for seven years. She is able to make 50,000 profit a week. She is a friendly and very hard working lady. She has a dream of transforming her retail shop into a whole sale shop to sell more and make more profits. She also strives to build a good family house for her children and the rest of those she cares for.

Flista is also a farmer and since it is a rainy season, she would like to buy quality seeds and employ manpower to clear the farm land for fresh planting. She has a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: Buy quality seeds and employ manpower on her farm.

loans.name: Jovilyn

texts.en:
Jovilyn I. is from the town of Dumalinao. She is 24 years old. Jovilyn is single and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jovilyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovilyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1200.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jovilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovilyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jovilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Samuel's Group

texts.en: B. Samuel is a 55 year old leader of his group in Mubende. He is married with 8 children of which 2 are still in school and the rest managing their own business while he also takes care of 6 dependants. Samuel has a retail shop business in Mubende that has been running for 9 years and he is able to make weekly net profits of 20,000/=. Samuel is a good client that also knows how to handle his customers well. In future, he would like to turn his retail shop into a wholesale shop to be managed together with some of his children as well as be able to build a very nice house for his family. Samuel is seeking for a loan to be able to invest more into his shop by buying more products for resale like cooking oil, muffins, bread, toilet rolls and so on since this will enable him pay for his children’s school fees and more business expansion.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more goods.

texts.en:
veronica is a member of the Bwawani C borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 18,17 years.

Veronica started her own business selling potatoes,tomatoes,onions 5 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Veronia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more potatoes,tomatoes,onions for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Veronica hopes to save money and expand her business.

Hermisa P. is from the town of Dumalinao. She is 43 years old. She is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Hermisa owns and operates a general store. Hermisa has been in business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10000.00 PHP a month.

In 2009, Hermisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000.00 PHP from PMPC to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Hermisa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to purchase more fabrics and materials. This loan will be the 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to financially support herbimmediate members.

------------- About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Mwajabu's Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hard working 32 year old lady with a retail shop business that she has owned for seven years.

She is a mother of seven children as she also cares for three dependents. Mwajabu also writes and sells CD's to bring in an extra income. She is a friendly lady and this has helped her win more loyal customers. Mwajabu is able to make a weekly profits of between 100,000 – 200,000. She has hopes of expanding her businesses and would like to increase her stock; like buying more CDs and general merchandise for her shop.

loans.use: Restock her business with more goods for selling.

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is a member of the Kajificheni borower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 50 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 7 children.Her children are aged 29,27,23,21,20,17,14 years.she also cares for other 2 dependent.

Mwanahamis started her own business selling food 20 years ago,she works 14 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mwanahamis`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,cooking oil,sugar for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,MWanahamis hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.name: Tumsifu

texts.en:
Tumsifu is a member of the Lami B in ilala,Iringa,she is 29 yeras old woman,she is single.

Tumsifu started her own business selling fire wood and charcoal 8 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Tumsifu`s first loans from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal and fire wood for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Tumsifu hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and fire wood

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala is a member of the Pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 5 years.

Sala started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sala`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Sala hopes to save more money,pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

texts.en:
Tatu is a member of the Pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 19,15, and 10 years.

Tatu started her own cafe business selling food 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Tatu`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to by more rice,cooking oil,sugar for food.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Tatu hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business

texts.fr: abass D. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis juin 2007.il est plombier de fonction mais il eleve parallelement des moutons chez lui qui sont destines a la vente durant la periode de la tabaski.il sollicite un credit de deux cent mille(200 000)frs pour accroitre le nombre deja existant.l'augmentation de ses benefices lui permettra d'accroitre son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Abass D. has been a member of the bank of Yoff since June 2007. He works as a plumber, but at home he also raises sheep destined to be sold during the Tabaski holidays (muslim feast). He’s requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to increase the number he already has. The growth in his profits will enable him to grow his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Mwantumu

texts.en:
Mwantumu is a member of the Pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 15,7 years.

Mwantumu started her own business selling Ice 5 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mwantumu first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy Freezer for business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Mwantumu hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  freezer for her business

texts.en:
Magreth is a member of the Pangani borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 35 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 20,15 years.

Magreth started her own grocery business selling beer,soda 10 years ago,she works 15 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Magreth`s First loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more Soda and beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Magreth hopes to save money,pay school fees ad expand her business.

Sada is a member of the Idunda B borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 55 years old,she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 29,27,20,17,13 years .she also cares for other 1 dependent.

Sada started her own business selling Ice 12 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Sada`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy freezer for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Sada hopes to save money,pay school fees and expand her business.

texts.fr: bamar N. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis septembre 2008.il evolue dans la menuiserie et gere un atelier dans le meme quartier.il capitalise une experience de plus de dix ans.il sollicite un credit de trois cent mille(300 000)frs qui lui permettra d'acquerir du materiel pour fabriquer des meubles destines a la vente.l'augmentation de ses profits lui permettra d'accroitre son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Bamar N. has been a member of the Yoff bank since September 2008. He is progressing in carpentry and manages a workshop in the same area. He capitalizes on over ten years of experience. He’s requesting a loan of 300,000 francs that will allow him to acquire some supplies and equipment for making furniture to sell. The increase in his profits will enable him to grow his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is a member of the Idunda D borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 31 years old woman,she is married and she cares for 1 dependent.

Magreth started her own food business 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings. 

This is Magreth first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more food commodities for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Magreth hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for food

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a member of the lami B borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 29 years old woman and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 10,03 years.

Rehema started her own business selling Timber 8 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Rehema`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Timber for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Rehema hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more Timber ofr her business

texts.fr: ngone F. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis avril 2009.elle est connue dans la vente de produits divers pour dames tels que sovons lait de toilette sacs a mains etc,et aussi d'habillement pour enfants.elle gere un magasin non loin de la caisse a cote du marche de yoff.elle sollicite un credit de trois cent mille(300 000)frs en vue de renforcer son stock et faire face a l'augmentation de la demande de la clientele de la periode d'avant fetes.l'accroissement de ses profits lui permettent de mieux soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Ngone F. has been a member of the Yoff bank since April 2009. She is known for selling various women’s goods, such as soaps, lotions, handbags, etc., and also children’s clothing. She runs a store not far from the bank and next to the Yoff market. She’s requesting a loan of 300,000 francs with the aim of bolstering her inventory and coping with the increase in customer demand due to the pre-holiday period. The growth in her profits will enable her to support her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a member of the K. borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 43 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 20,17,13, and 9 years.

Veronica started her own business selling Timber 7 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,0000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Veronica`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more Timber for sale.

with the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Veronica hopes to save more money,and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more Timber for sale

texts.fr: marame N. est societaire de la caisse de yoff depuis mai 2000.depuis plus de dix ans elle exerce l'activite de petit commerce(eau frache glace recharge credit).periodiquement aussi elle effectue des voyages dans la sous region et amene des articles pour femmes quelle vend en les placant pour deux ou trois mois.marame est veuve.elle sollicite un credit de deux cent cinquante mille(250 000)frs pour accroitre son fond de roulement mieux valoriser ses benefices afin de faire face a ses charges familiales.

texts.pt:
Alberto T. nasceu no Município da Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira de Suazilândia, tem 44 anos vive maritalmente é pai de 7 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 2 meses aos 16 anos, de mães diferentes,  não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT.

Aberto quando concluiu a 10ª classe faz o curso de professorado que durou três anos, (tempo regular) após concluir é afecto numa localidade que dista 45 km da vila do Município é funcionário permanente a mais de 15 anos com a categoria de director da Escola auferindo mensalmente um valor de 7.799.00MT. Sendo único com fonte de rendimento na família, não consegue satisfazer as suas necessidades e aproxima se ao BIM (Banco Internacional de Moçambique) solicitando um empréstimo para dar inicio da sua obra que devido ao elevado custo do material não foi concluída. 

Então aproxima se a uma outra instituição bancaria ProCredito solicitando um empréstimo para dar continuidade da mesma que pagou com muito sucesso. Mas devido à distância opta em trabalhar com a Hluvuku e solicita um valor de 15.000.00MT para concluir as mínimas partes da sua obra (compra de material de construção).


Este é primeiro empréstimo de Alberto na Hluvuku e Kiva. Serão usados para fazer a conclusão da sua obra, pois esta muito ansiosa em concluir porque seus bens estão dispersos e sem cuidados pessoais. Esta confiante que vai pagar sem nenhum problema e pedir novo empréstimo para fazer um murro em sua residência.
texts.en:
Alberto T. was born in the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland. He is 44 years old and lives with his common-law wife. He has 7 children between the ages of 2 months and 16 years, with different mothers. He doesn't support anyone else economically and is able to save 1000 meticals a month. When Alberto finished 10th grade he did a three-year teacher training course. When he finished, he went to a community 45 km from Namaacha, where he's been a school principal for more than 15 years, earning 7799 meticals a month. Since his salary is his family's only source of income, he's not able to meet all their needs and approached BIM (International Bank of Mozambique) requesting a loan to begin building a house, which he was unable to finish because of the high cost of materials. He then approached another bank, ProCredito, requesting a loan to continue the work, which he paid back successfully. But because of the distance, he has now chosen to work with Hluvuku and has requested another loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals to buy construction materials and finish the work. This is Alberto's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. He will use the money to finish his project, since he's eager to finish his possessions are scattered and neglected. He is confident that he will be able to pay back the loan with no difficulty and then request another to build a wall around his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

texts.pt:
Francilia Abel S. nasceu na capital Maputo, tem 36 anos de idade é viúva e mãe de uma rapariga de 14 anos de idade que freguenta a 8ª classe na escola secundária da Namaacha. Responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em Boane enviando lhes mensalmente um valor de 1.000.00MT e pelo seu sobrinho que vive com ela na casa.

Apos seu pai perder emprego, a vida da Francilia fica muito difícil, já não tinha dinheiro de transporte para ir a Escola e tinha assim que percorrer grandes distâncias a pé, quando frequentava a 6ª classe do antigo sistema esta fica doente durante 2 anos internada e sem poder ir a Escola. Anos depois, entra na Cruz vermelha de Moçambique onde trabalhou primeiro como servente e, devido a sua dedicação ganha uma bolsa para tirar um curso na Acção Social. Foi enquadrada em Nampula onde junta se com seu falecido marido. Devido à perda do seu marido ela pede uma transferência e é enquadrada em Namacha como técnica no Serviço Distrital de Saúde Mulher e Acçao Social, onde trabalha a mais de 10 anos das 7:30 as 15:30h excepto nas segundas e quintas-feiras onde tem estado a prestar serviços no Município do mesmo distrito auferindo um valor de 3.324.00MT.

 Para alem de ser técnica na Accao social é também membro da Assembléia Municipal há 8 meses auferindo um valor mensal de 5.314.00MT num contrato de 5 anos.

Por estar cansada de viver na casa da instituição, aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando o primeiro empréstimo para fazer a legalização do seu terreno no valor de 5.000,00MT.

Obteve informações através de amigos e clientes da instituição.
Este é o segundo empréstimo de Francilia na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00MT para compra de material de construção e fazer o lançamento da primeira pedra. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e sem problemas, para poder aceder a mais créditos ate a conclusão da casa e posterior apetrecha mento.
texts.en:
Francilia Abel S. was born in the capital Maputo. She is 36 years old and is a widowed mother of a 14 year old girl, who is in the 8th grade at the Namaacha secondary school. She also support her parents, who live in Boane, and to whom she sends 1.000,00MT each month, and her nephew, who lives with her in her home.

After her father lost his job, Francilia's live was very difficult, as she no longer had money for transportation to get to school and had to traverse long distances on foot. When she was attending 6th grade classes in the old system she was sick for 2 years in the hospital and unable to go to school. Years later, she entered the Red Cross of Mozambique where she worked at first as a servant and, because of her dedication, she earned a scholarship to take a course in the Institute of Social Action. She was assigned to Nampula where she married her late husband. Because of her husband's death, she asked to be transferred and she was assigned to Namacha as a technician in the District Service of Women's Health and Social Action, where she has worked for more than 10 years from 7:30 a.m. until 3:30 p.m., except on Mondays and Thursdays when she provides services to the municipality of the same district, earning 3.324,00MT.

Besides being a technician for Social Action, she has also been a member of the Municipal Assembly for the past 8 months, earning a monthly salary of 5.314MT in a 5 year contract.

As she is tired of living in a house of the Institute, she approached Hluvuku and Kiva, looking for her first loan to secure the title to her land for the amount of 5.000,00MT. She heard about the organizations through friends and clients of the Institute.

This is her second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva in the amount of 20.000,00MT for the purchase of construction materials and in order to break ground. She trusts that she will pay back the loan ahead of time and without problems, in order to have access to future loans to help her complete and furnish her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Victorino Ernesto

texts.pt:
Victorino nasceu em Inhambane tem 37 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de quatro filhos com compreendidas entre os 5 aos 12 anos, todos eles vão a escola. Não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT. 

Sai de Inhambane para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório durante 2 anos é afecto em Matutuine concretamente Catuane como guarda prisional, mas devido à guerra ele abandona o emprego e passa a viver na Capital Maputo onde faz um curso de acção ambiental  e é afecto na Direccao da Agricultura no Município da Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia, como agente de serviço na irrigação das plantas auferindo mensalmete 1.900.00MT.

Para alem de trabalhar na Agricultura, tem prestado serviços de jardineiro na Paróquia da Nossa Senhora de Fátima nas 2ª, 3ª e 5ª feira no período da manha auferindo 1.000.00MT e nas 4ª e sábados no mercado informal shoprite onde faz seus negócios de venda de material de construção de pequena escala tais como (prego, estribos, fios de energia, quadros e outros). Para aumentar o volume do seu negocio, aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Victorino na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 6.000.00MT foi usado para reforçar o seu negocio ( comprando materiais de construção para vender) e estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto porque conta com ajuda da sua esposa que acaba de ser empregada no conselho Municipal da Vila de Namaacha. e por ser ansioso esta confiante que dentro em breve construir a sua própria ferragem e uma capoeira em sua casa. Para tal, vai precisar de outros empréstimos.
texts.en:
Victorino was born in Inhambante, he is 37 years old and lives with his wife and their 4 children who are between 5 and 12 years old, all of them go the school. He doesn’t have any other responsibility besides his family and is able to save 1,000MT a month. He left Inhambane to fulfill the military service which is obligatory for 2 years and lived in Matutuine to be exact in Catuane as prison guard, but because of the war he leaves the job and went to live in the capital Maputo where he studied environmental action and obtained a job at the Direction of Agriculture in the Municipality of Villa de Namaacha in the frontier with Suazilandia, as agent of irrigation service for plants, obtaining 1,900MT monthly. Besides working in agriculture, he has been working as gardener at the Church of Nossa Senhora de Fatima on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays in the mornings earning 1,000MT and on Wednesdays and Saturdays at the informal market he sells construction materials in small scale. To increase the volume of his business he approached Hluvuku requesting a loan of 10,000MT. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first of 6,000MT was used to improve his business (buying construction materials to sell) and the 10,000MT will be used on the same way. He is confident he will be able to pay back on time because he also counts with his wife’s help who has been hired by the Municipality of Vila de Namaacha, and he is anxious and confident in the short he will be able to build his own hardware store and farm at his house. For this he will need other loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell construction materials

texts.es: Es un grupo  antiguo, y  a partir del anterior ciclo marcharon muy bien sin problemas en sus pagos , formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio,  que se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "VALLE HERMOSO", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su  8º Ciclo y esta organizado de la siguiente manera como presidenta la señora Carmen L. de C., quien dirige al grupo,  y a partir de su ingreso como presidenta el grupo mejoro bastante,  tiene 5 hijos y solo mantiene a dos de ellos, el credito lo utiliza para mantenimiento de su auto, como taxi de linea fija, lo conduce su esposo. Como tesorera esta la socia Claudia C., una socia muy responsable y ademas  maneja y conoce bien el dinero, ella trabaja con taxi de linea fija, es soltera y conduce su movilidad, el credito lo utiliza para compra de accesorios y llantas para su movilidad, ella vive y colabora a sus padres. Como Secretaria del grupo esta la socia Janeth B. R., socia nueva en el grupo, responsable, tiene 2 hijos, vive en alquiler ayuda al esposo en su trabajo, trabaja en taxi de linea fija (llamado en Bolivia "Trufi"), tambien utulizan el credito para mantenimiento de su auto, ella siempre esta presente en las reuniones.
texts.en:
This is an older group. Since their last loan, things have gone very well without any problems with their payments. This is a group of women that live in the same neighborhood. Their group is called, "Valle Hermoso" (Beautiful Valley), where the communal bank is on its eighth loan. In terms of their income, the group has improved considerably. The president of the group has 5 children, but only 2 of them are still her dependents. She will use the credit for maintenance on her car, since she has a taxi that her husband drives. The treasurer is Claudia C., a very responsible member who also manages and knows money very well. She has a taxi as well, and she is single and drives it herself. She will use the credit for accessories and wheels for her car. She lives with and helps out her parents. The secretary is Janeth B. R., a new member in the group. She is responsible and has two children. She lives in a rented home and helps her husband with his work. He has a taxi (which is called a Trufi in Bolivia. They will also use the credit to maintain their car. She always attend the group's meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Antonio Chico

texts.pt:
( nao foi possivel a foto no local do negocio devido a distancia)
 Antonio Chico N. nasceu em Maputo no distrito de Matutuine concretamente na localidade de Catuane, é casado e pai de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 2 aos 9 anos. o mais velho é  que vai a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua tia que vive na mesma zona dando lhe 1.000.00MT em cada três meses e ainda consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT.

Antonio perde seus pais ainda criança e cresce na responsabilidade dos seus avos maternos, no tempo da guerra sai de Matutuine para Suazilândia onde estudou ate a 5ª classe e teve que interromper quando regressa a Moçambique onde começa a trabalhar como pedreiro. Saiu de Catuane e fixou sua residência em namaacha na zona fronteiriça de Goba. Consegue comprar um camião com o fundo que havia colectado e inicia com o negócio de venda de batatas e cebolas a grosso adquiridas na áfrica do sul a 500x125. 00mt e revendidas em Boane a 500x200mt.  Tem viajado uma vez por mês e tendo lucro de 10.000.00MT.

Aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00MT para aumentar o volume do seu negócio comprando batata e cebola para revender.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Antonio na Hluvuku e Kiva. Está confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo credito para aumentar mais uma camioneta e ir avante com seu negócio, no futuro.
texts.en:
(It wasn’t possible to take a picture of the store because of the distance) Antonio Chico N. was born in Maputo in the district of Matutuine in the location of Catuane, he is married and has 3 children who are between 2 and 9 years old, the oldest one goes to school. Besides his children he is responsible for his aunt who lives in the same area, and he gives her 1,000MT every 3 months, and yet he is able to save 1,000MT a month. Antonio lost his parents when he was still a child and was raised by his grandparents (mother’s parents), when the war started he left Matutuine and went to Suazilandia where he studied until 5th grade and had to stopped his studies when he came back to Mozambique where he started working as bricklayer. He left Catuane and finally stayed in Namaacha near the frontier with Goba. He was able to buy a truck with the savings he made and started buying potatos and onions at wholesale prices bought in South Africa at 500x125MT and selling them at retail price for 500x200MT. He travels once a month and obtains a profit of 10,000MT. He approached Hluvuku and Kiva to request a loan for 25,000MT to increase the volume of his business buying and selling potatoes and onions. This is the first loan for Antonio with Hluvuku and Kiva. He is confident he will be able to pay back before the deadline arrives and will request a new loan to buy another truck and improve his business in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell potatoes and onions

texts.en:
Abundia P., 54, is from the town of Dumalinao. She is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Abundia does clothing alterations and tailoring. She has been in business for over 20 years and earns about 5000.00 PHP a month.

In 2007, Abundia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Abundia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000.00 PHP from PMPC. This was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Abundia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to buy additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her 3rd loan with PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

--------------------------- Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

texts.pt:
( nao foi possivel a foto no local do negocio devido a natureza do trabalho do frenk)
Frenk Ernesto D. nasceu no município da vila de namaacha na fronteira da suazilandia, está divorciado da sua mulher e é pai de quatro filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 2 aos 10 anos. Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe enviando lhe uma sexta básica de 500.00MT mensalmente e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT.

Frenk emigra para África do Sul quando tinha 21 anos de idade à procura de emprego após a morte do seu pai. Começa a trabalhar como mecânico durante 7 anos e faz a 5ª classe, interrompe quando teve que regressar a Moçambique para cuidar da sua mãe. Anos depois começa a trabalhar como segurança, mas devido ao baixo salário abandona o emprego e trabalha como camioneiro (transporte de carros da áfrica do sul a suazilândia) ganhando mensalmente 2.000.00MT e tem feito quatro viagens ao mês. Faz venda de roupa diversa, por encomenda, aproveitando a facilidade de transporte, tendo mensalmente um lucro de 4.000.00MT.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Frenk na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. Os primeiros dois créditos de 5.000.00MT todos foram usados para iniciar o negócio de venda de roupas. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para construir uma capoeira com objectivo de iniciar outra actividade alternativa (avicultura).
texts.en:
(It wasn’t possible to take a photo of the business because of the nature of Frenk’s work) Frenk Ernesto D. was born in the municipality of Villa de Namaacha in the frontier with Suazilandia, he is divorced and has 4 children who are between 2 and 10 years old. He is also responsible for his mother and sends her a monthly allowance of 500MT and is able to save 1,000MT. Frenk went to South Africa when he was 21 years old and obtained a job after the death of his father. He worked for 7 years as a mechanic and finished 5th grade, which he had to interrupt when he came back to Mozambique to take care of his mother. Years later he started working as a security officer, but because of the low salary he left the job and currently works as a truck driver (he transports vehicles from South Africa to Suazilandia) he earns 2,000MT monthly and travels 4 times a month. He sells diverse clothing under request, taking advantage of the travels, obtaining 4,000MT monthly. This is Frenk’s third loan with Hluvuku and first one with Kiva. The first ones were for 5,000MT and were used to start his business selling clothes. He is confident he will pay before the due date and request a new loan to build a small farm to start another activity option (agriculture).

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: EL SEÑOR ALBERTO O.  A.,TIENE COMO ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA VENTA DE MOTORES Y REPUESTOS DE AUTOMOVILES; EL CREDITO LE SERVIRA PARA  INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL DE TRABAJO, YA QUE PIENSA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO CON LA COMPRA DE ACCESORIOS PARA MOVILIDADES, ES CASADO TIENE 4 HIJOS, A LOS CUALES LOS HACE ESTUDIAR, AL MAYOR EN LA UNIVERSIDAD Y LOS TRES MENORES AUN EN COLEGIO.
texts.en:
Alberto O. A. sells motors and spare parts for automobiles. The loan is for working capital. He will expand his business by purchasing auto accessories. He is married and has four children. The oldest child goes to the university, and the three younger children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: khady seck D. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis mars 2003.elle s'active dans le domaine du commerce et gere une mercerie non loin de la caisse depuis plus de cinq ans.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs afin de renforcer son stock de marchandise.l'evolution croissante de ses benefice pourra lui permettre d'augmenter son capital de roulement.
texts.en:
Khady Seck D. has been a member of the Yoff bank since March 2003. She is active is the domain of commerce, and she has been managing a sewing supplies store, not far from the bank, for over five years. She’s requesting a loan of 100,000 francs in order to bolster her stock of merchandise. The growing progression of her profits will enable her to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Maria Eugenia García S. tiene la edad de 23 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica esta actividad. Ella dio inicio con muy poca mercadería, ella ofrecía ropa interior a ella siempre la ha caracterizado por el espíritu luchador y las ganas de salir adelante. En la actualidad ella continúa con este negocio, ya que es su único medio de trabajo y disfruta mucho el conversar con sus clientes. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como es el tiempo por lo que tiene que buscar sus productos en donde se encuentran mucho mas favorable.

Ana tiene 50 años D. edad, vive con su esposo, quien es chofer, y con su hijo D. 25 años que trabaja con ella. Hace 4 años construyó un local al costado D. su casa para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. bebidas (gaseosas y cervezas). Para ello, cuenta con el apoyo D. su hijo, quien es el encargado D. atender a los clientes y ella D. administrar los ingresos que produce dicho negocio. Pero la actividad a la que más se dedica Ana desD. hace 10 años es la costura, es así como se siente más a gusto, elaborando ropa para niños y adultos. Además, gracias a sus negocios está cumpliendo sus objetivos, pues ambos le son rentables; tanto su pequeño bar porque está ubicado en una zona muy transitada y con la costura, pues por su experiencia y buena labor tiene una larga lista D. clientes. Por otro lado, el deseo a futuro D. Ana es tener un restaurante, especializado en pollo a la brasa, el cual es llamado “pollería”. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP  lo que más le gusta D. trabajar con su banco comunal es que se siente bien con sus compañeros y todos son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará más cervezas y gaseosas, además D. telas y otros materiales D. costura para seguir activa en lo que más le gusta.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: La señora Wilma se dedica a hacer manualidades como manteles pintados y bordados, muñecos en soft, set de baño, set de cocina, esta 10 años con esta actividad, sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes, ayuda a su hija con los quehaceres de la casa, ya que ella trabaja. Doña Wilma cuida y quiere mucho a sus nietos y siempre está pediente de ellos. Ella también dicta cursos de bordado y pintado en tela, es muy creativa y le gusta lo que hace. El crédito será invertido en la compra de tela, hilos y demás material para los cursos que está dando.Es una cleinte  puntual y antigua de la institución.
texts.en:
Wilma makes handicrafts like painted and embroidered table cloths, dolls, bathroom sets, and kitchen sets. She has been doing this for ten years. Her children are grown and independent. Wilma helps her daughter with the household chores because she works. Wilma takes care of and loves her grandchildren very much. She always pays attention to them. She also teaches classes on embroidery and painting on fabric. She is very creative, and she likes what she does. The loan is to buy fabric, thread, and other material for the courses she teaches. She is an old and punctual client of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Graciela es casada, tiene 61 años y 4 hijos, Graciela tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Graciela necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. dulces, gaseosas.
Los sueños D. Graciela son tener una tienda en el centro D. la ciudad y cambiar D. negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de dulces, gaseosas.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one daughter and three sons, who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Faustina lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Faustina is a trader, running a palm oil production business. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

texts.es: Dan tiene 36 años, vive junto a su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 12 años y es estudiante. Viven en la casa de sus suegros. Dan es muy emprendedor y polifacético laboralmente. Anteriormente contaba con 12 computadoras con las que brindaba el servicio de Internet en su casa. Sin embargo, por no ser compatibles a la nueva tecnología, tuvo que venderlas e invirtió el dinero en la compra de un carro, con el cual ahora brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros. Por otro lado, su necesidad de sentirse ocupado lo llevó también a vender líneas de teléfono, celulares y tarjetas telefónicas, actividad que viene ejerciendo desde hace 6 meses y no le es tan difícil vender estos artículos, pues sus principales clientes son sus pasajeros. A Dan le gusta su trabajo porque se mantiene ocupado y trabaja tranquilo, además está satisfecho que son negocios propios y no depende de nadie. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son responsables en sus pagos y muy unidos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará algunos repuestos para mandar a reparar su automóvil.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Madeley

texts.es:
Madeley es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Madeley es casada, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Madeley se dedica a la venta de bebidas, pero en los últimos meses tuvo que cerrar su negocio, ahora esta buscando un nuevo local donde implementar su negocio.
Madeley necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la implementación de un nuevo local.
Los sueños de Madeley son que sus hijos estudien fuera del país.

loans.use: Para la implementación de un nuevo local.

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Jesús es viuda, tiene 69 años y 6 hijos, Jesús tiene un puesto en el mercado Santa Elena en donD. venD. ropa variada, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Jesús venD. leña en el mismo lugar.
Jesús necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. chompas, ropas interiores.
Los sueños D. Jesús son construir su casa.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Jesús, 69, is a widow with six children. Jesús has a stall in the Santa Elena market. She sells various clothing items there; she does this every day. Also, Jesús sells wood in the same place. Jesús needs a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy sweaters and underwear. Jesús’ dream is to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: one daughter and one son, who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Janet lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Janet is a trader, running a palm oil production business. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Jane

texts.es: Jane es madre soltera de 3 niños que ya están estudiando. Desde hace un año implementó un local al frente de su casa para la venta de comida, donde todos los sábados y domingos ofrece parrilladas (pollo asado acompañado con yuca y ají), bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, desde las 9am hasta las 4pm. Adicionalmente, de lunes a viernes, se dedica a la atención de un cafetín para los alumnos de una universidad cercana a su casa, labor que viene ejerciendo desde hace 6 meses. Jane dice que todo esto lo hace por sus hijos, a quienes tiene que darles lo necesario para salir adelante. Le gustan mucho sus actividades porque se distrae y se mantiene ocupada, además que ambas le son rentables. Lo bueno de su venta de pollo a la parrilla es que ella misma cría los pollos y procura que estén en un peso y tamaño adecuado para cuando los prepare, pues así la presentación en sus platos es más atractiva para el cliente, porque son grandes porciones a un precio adecuado. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que entre todos se comprenden, se ayudan en sus diferentes negocios y son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más pollos y alimento para éstos. Por otro lado, Jane mandó a construir otro local en su casa adecuado para una bodega, entonces con lo que le reste de su préstamo comprará también comestibles para habilitar su tienda.
texts.en:
Jane is the single mother of three children who go to school. One year ago she set up a place in front of her house to sell food. Every Saturday and Sunday from 9 a.m. until 4 p.m. she sells grilled food (barbecued chicken with yucca and chili), soft drinks, and beer. Also, on Mondays through Thursdays she works in a small student cafeteria at a university near her house. She has been doing this for six months. Jane says that she does all of this for her children. She has to give them what is needed to get ahead. She likes her activities a lot because they entertain her and keep her busy. Also, both are profitable. The good thing about selling grilled chicken is that she raises the chickens herself. She makes sure they are the right weight and size when it is time to prepare them. This way her dishes are more appealing to her customers; they are large portions for a good price. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She likes working with her group. They understand each other, help each other in their different businesses, and are punctual with their payments. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy chicken and food for them. Jane will have another location for a store made in her house. She will use the rest of the loan to buy food for the store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens and invest in a new business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en:
Rehema R., age 32, is married with one child who is 1 year old. She has had a fish business for a year now. She works from 5:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $150.

This will be Rehema’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more fish for sell and has paid her loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her stock.

Rehema will share this loan with the loan group, Mtama Kulangwa. The group has 19 members. In the picture, Rehema is 4th from right with a pink head-wrapper, back row.

texts.fr: bineta S. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis aout 2002.elle gere une cantine devant chez elle non loin de la caisse ou elle vend du pain du thon de la mayonnaise et tout ce qui va avec le petit dejeuner.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs.elle capitalise une experience de plus de six ans.avec ce credit elle envisage d'amenager sa cantine dans le but de mieux attirer la clientele et un peu diversifier son offre.

texts.es:
Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Elvira es casada, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, de profesión profesora de inicial, Elvira tiene una tienda en una galería que esta ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende ropa.
Elvira necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sacos.
Los sueños de Elvira son tener otras sucursales y surtir con otros productos como ropa sport.

Albertina es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Albertina es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Albertina vende emoliente (bebida caliente elaborada con hierbas y semillas de lino) de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de las Américas, actividad que realiza todos los días por las noches. Albertina tiene proyectado implementar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Albertina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos para su tienda.
Albertina sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Albertina is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Albertina is 31, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Albertina is a street vendor who sells “emoliente” (a warm drink made with herbs and flax seeds) at the Américas market. She sells every evening. Albertina plans to set up a grocery store in her house. Albertina needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy products for her store. Albertina dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is fifty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two daughters and three sons, who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader, running a palm oil production business. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for over twenty-five years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

texts.es: Marcos tiene 28 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres y su hermana de 19 años. Desde hace 12 años brinda servicios eléctricos, pues estudió este oficio.
