Sin embargo, como esta actividad no tiene ingresos regulares, se asoció con dos amigos para la apertura de un taller de electricidad, vulcanizadora y una sala de billar desde hace un año, donde cada uno de ellos cumple sus funciones y labores, pero al momento de pagar el alquiler D. local todos colaboran en partes iguales. Marcos se considera un joven muy proactivo, es por eso que también se dedica, en sus ratos libres, a la compra y venta de granos y de animales, esto lo hace desde hace 8 años y le va muy bien. Le gusta su nuevo negocio porque el local de su taller es muy acogedor y se encuentra ubicado en una buena zona para la captación de clientes. Para más adelante Marcos piensa independizarse, pero por ahora seguirá trabajando de la misma manera hasta cumplir su objetivo. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP y está muy satisfecho de su trabajo con su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son cumplidos y muy buenas personas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más herramientas para implementar su taller, además de granos y animales para la venta.
texts.en:
Marcos is a 28-year old single man who lives with his parents and 19 year-old sister. For twelve years he has offered electrical services, as he studied to be an electrician. However, since this work does not provide steady income, a year ago, he joined two friends to open an electricity workshop, tire repair shop, and a pool hall. Each man does his own separate work but when paying rent all colloborate in equal amounts. Marcos considers himself a proactive young man and, for the past eight years, has dedicated his free time to the buying and selling of grains and animals. The business is going very well. He likes his new business because the site of the workshop is very inviting and located in a good area for attracting customers. In the future, Marcos hopes to become more independent, but for now he will continue working in the same way to achieve his goals. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, which is satisfied with his work with their community bank because his partners are considerate and good people. With the money he is requesting he will buy more tools to set up his workshop as well as grains and animals to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Georgina Guadalupe Cáceres Ramírez tiene 50 años. Hace más de 8 años que dio inicio a este negocio como es una pulpería. Anteriormente Georgina ofrecía de manera ambulante en un triciclo gaseosas, jugos refrescos, pero con el tiempo no pudo continuar ya que debido a sus problemas de salud tuvo que dejar de recorrer los lugares en donde ofrecía sus productos. Pero esto no la detuvo a seguir adelante con su negocio ya que todavía tiene el triciclo pero esta cargo de una persona que se encarga de vender los refrescos, jugos entre otras cosas.  Pues ella tiene que hacerse cargo de la pulpería. Su deseo es obtener un carro para que preste el servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Georgina is 50 years old. For more than eight years she has had a small grocery store. Before that Georgina used a tricycle to sell sodas, juices and drinks as a roving salesperson. Because of health problems she had to abandon selling her products in this manner. But this has not stopped her from moving forward with her business. She stills has her tricycle but now she has another person that she has hired to use it to sell drinks and juices among other things. She now has to attend to the small grocery store. Her desire is to buy a car that she will use as a taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

Asoma is twenty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: one boy and one girl who are both in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Asoma is a trader, trading in meat. She procures the meat from nearby towns at moderate prices and supplies to food vendors and chop-bar (a place to eat, not necessarily a bar) operators in her community. She has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk to expand her business.

texts.es: María, D. 31 años, tiene 2 hijos menores que estudian y son su razón D. ser, vive junto a su esposo, quien es policía, en su casa propia. DesD. hace 5 años se dedica a la venta D. ropa para damas y caballeros, este negocio lo desarrolla desD. su casa. Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado conseguir muchos clientes quienes son lo que acuden a ella para adquirir sus prendas D. vestir, pero cuando le quedan prendas por vender sale a ofrecerlas por los distintos lugares D. su zona. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es vender, pues ahí tiene un contacto directo con sus clientes y ella se preocupa mucho por darles un buen trato para que siempre retornen a comprar sus artículos y mejor aún, la recomiendan con otras personas. Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta D. su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son buenos amigos, con quienes comparte sus experiencias y momentos agradables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más ropa y también zapatos, pues sus clientes se lo están pidiendo.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is sixty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two daughters and three sons, who are all out of school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader, running a palm oil production business. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Hilda es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Hilda tiene una tienda en donde vende ropa, el local es alquilado y se ubica cerca del mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo que también vende ropa en las ferias de la región.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y casacas.
Los sueños de Hilda son construir su casa y tener otra sucursal mas.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Hilda is 38, married, and has four children. Hilda has a store where she sells clothes. The place is rented, and it is located near the central market in the city of Ayacucho. She runs her business with the help of her husband. He also sells clothes in the regional fairs. Hilda needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy pants and jackets. Hilda’s dreams are to build her house and to have another branch.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 46 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 19 y 12 años de edad que están estudiando. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la costura y a la repostería. Pero adicionalmente, hace 4 años, logró adquirir un motocarro, el cual maneja su esposo y brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, mientras ella se encarga de la administración de las ganancias y el mantenimiento adecuado de la moto. A Maritza le gusta trabajar con su esposo para la obtención del dinero necesario para las necesidades de su hogar y aunque sus oficios particulares (costura y repostería) no le generan ingresos regulares, igualmente cuenta con varios clientes quienes la buscan para solicitarle algún arreglo de prendas de vestir o tortas y bocaditos para una fiesta, y con esto logra obtener ingresos adicionales para su casa. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, a Maritza le gusta se parte de su banco comunal porque es un grupo de personas solidarias y muy trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro y también adquirirá materiales textiles para elaborar ropa interior.

loans.use: Reparación de su motocarro y compra de materiales textiles

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Maria es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada, además Maria junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una congeladora.
Los sueños de Maria son tener otro restaurante y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Maria is 31, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Maria travels to different regional fairs to sell various articles of clothing. Also, Maria and her husband have a restaurant in a rented location. She works there every day. Maria needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy a freezer. Maria’s dreams are to have another restaurant and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Miguelina tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer de motocarro y tienen un hijo de 14 años que es estudiante de nivel secundario. Desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo a pedido, además en su casa cuenta con una pequeña vitrina donde exhibe los productos que tiene en stock y puede vender al momento, sin necesidad de hacer el pedido por la revista. Adicionalmente, su esposo trabaja con un motocarro (propio) realizando transporte de pasajeros y ella es quien se encarga de administrar los ingresos diarios de este negocio. A Miguelina le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, hace buenas relaciones y eso la ayuda a incrementar su lista de clientes, de esa manera sigue incrementando sus ventas. Para un futuro cercano, le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa y accesorios, donde también pueda seguir vendiendo sus cosméticos. Con MFP ya tiene 13 préstamos y ella menciona que lo que más le gusta de su banco comunal es que no es un grupo muy numeroso, trabajan bien organizados y con mucha responsabilidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, Miguelina comprará más productos de belleza, en un monto de 1000 soles, con lo que resta comprara materiales de construcción para mandar a refaccionar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguelina, 43, lives with her husband. He is a driver of a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart). They have a 14 year old son who is in secondary school. For 11 years she has been selling beauty products by catalog order. Also, she has a small display case in her house where she displays the products she has in stock. She can sell these products immediately without having to place an order from the catalog. Additionally, her husband works with his own motocarro transporting passengers. She is the one who manages the daily income from this business. Miguelina likes her work very much because she meets lots of people, makes nice relationships, and this helps her increase her list of customers. This way she keeps increasing her sales. In the near future, she would like to have a clothing and accessories store where she could keep selling her cosmetics. She has had 13 loans with MFP. What she likes best about her community bank is that it is not a large group. They work in a well organized manner and are very responsible about their payments. With the money she is asking for Miguelina will buy beauty products for 1,000 PEN. She will use the rest of the money to buy construction materials to have her house refurbished.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en:
Mary is forty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: three sons and one daughter, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Mary is a trader and runs a cold-store business. Mary procures the goods from nearby towns at moderate prices and supplies to food vendors and chop bar (a place to eat, not necessarily a bar) operators in her community. She has been in business for two years now and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk to expand her business.

texts.es: Rodolfo tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hija de 6 añitos, quien ya cursa estudios primarios, por el momento viven en la casa de sus padres. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica, a tiempo completo, al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 10 años y gracias a su esfuerzo en la actualidad es propietario de tres motocarros. La encargada de recibir y administrar las ganancias de este negocio es su esposa, pues él admite que ella lo hace mucho mejor que él. Para el manejo de 2 motocarros contratan a dos choferes y el otro lo conduce Rodolfo. Sin embargo, es tan grande su anhelo de seguir progresando, que en sus ratos libres aplica su arte manual confeccionando collares, pulseras, aretes y aros a base de materiales oriundos de una zona indígena de su región (selva peruana) y lo beneficioso es que vive en una zona turística, por lo que sus artículos tienen muy buena acogida, pues los vende de forma ambulante. Rodolfo se preocupa en ser una persona activa y sana para seguir adelante con sus labores y está muy contento con lo que hasta ahora ha conseguido en beneficio de su familia. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y desde su primer contacto con su banco comunal, está muy contento de trabajar junto a personas solidarias y muy responsables. Con el dinero que viene solicitando mandará a reparar y hacer mantenimiento mecánico a sus motocarros.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a 29-year-old man who lives with his wife, his mother, and their 6-year-old daughter who is in elementary school. For the time being, they live in their parents’ home. He is a very hard-working man who has been providing public transportation services full-time for 10 years. Thanks to his efforts, he now owns three motorcycle taxis. His wife is the one who is in charge of handling the business finances because he admits that she is much better at it than he is. Rodolfo drives one of the motorcycle taxis, while he hired two other drivers to drive the other taxis. However, his wish to keep making progress is so big that he also utilizes his artistic skills in his free time by making necklaces, earrings, hoops, and bracelets out of local material in the indigenous zone (the Peruvian jungle). He has an advantage because he lives in a tourist section, which means that his jewelry sells well because he is a street vendor. Rodolfo is concerned with being an active and healthy person so that he can continue with his work. He is very pleased with what he has managed up to now for the benefit of his family. This is the first time that he requests a loan with MFP. Ever since he first got in touch with his microfinance institute, he has been happy to work with people who are united and responsible. With this loan that he is requesting, he will have his motorcycle taxis repaired and maintained.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en: Kwasi is forty – two years old. He is married and has given birth to two children, both sons and still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for the family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Kwasi is a trader. He trades in food stuffs and cereals such as plantain, yam, beans, maize, etc. He sells in his community and also supplies to other food vendors. Kwasi procures the goods from nearby communities. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business.

texts.es:
Manuela es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Manuela es casada, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Manuela viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales, queso, carne, productos que venD. en los mercados y también D. casa en casa.
Manuela necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales.
Los sueños D. Manuela son tener mas capital, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the Community Bank “Despertar”. She is 45 years old, married and has 2 children. Manuela travels to different fairs in the region to buy cereal, cheese and meat, products that she sells to grocery shops and door to door.

Manuela is asking for a loan of $350 which will be invested in the purchase of grains. Manuela's dreams are to improve her business and proviD. good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Julia  es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Julia es casada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Julia viaja a las ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales, producto que venD. en el mercado, además Julia venD. leña al por mayor, reparte a los negocios.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. leña.
Los sueños D. Julia son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Gloria es soltera, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Gloria vende medicina natural que vende en las diferentes ferias de la región a donde viaja 2 veces por semana, también vende a pedido de casa en casa.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural.
Los sueños de Gloria son aumentar su negocio, sus hijos culminen sus estudios y tener un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Community Bank”Despertar”. She is 38 years old, single and has 3 children.

Gloria sells natural medicines at different fairs in the region, where she travels 2 times per week. She also sells door to door. Gloria needs a loan of $1025 that will be invested in the purchase of natural medicines.

Gloria’s dreams are to grow her business, start a new business and that her children graduate from school.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: two daughters and three sons, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Elizabeth is a trader, running a palm oil production business. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for barely a year now and wants a loan to buy palm fruits in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa se dedica a la venta de joyas como sombrereras, topos, prendedores, anillos y aretes para señoras de pollera, ella trabaja por pedidos, sus clientes le dicen que joya quieren, ella los compra y se los vende. Su esposo trabaja con su minibús, en transporte público, viven en la casa de sus suegros tiene tres niños en edad escolar. También trabaja medio tiempo en costura, ayudándose así con los gastos de la casa, es una cliente puntual, el crédito será invertido en la compra de joyas ya que tiene mas pedidos.

loans.use: INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA JOYAS (TOPOS, SOMBRERAS, ANILLOS, ARETES)

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is thirty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two boys and two girls, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Emilia is a food vendor. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi and cooks and sells rice and stew on the street in her community in the mornings. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice to make rice and stew

texts.es:
Iliana es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Iliana es soltera, tiene 25 años y vive con sus padres, Iliana tiene un bar Discoteca llamado de Parranda, en un local alquilado, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de personal, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Iliana necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bebidas.
Los sueños de Iliana es estudiar otra carrera, tener otro negocio y apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Iliana is a member of the Kausachun Community Bank (the name means “Long Live!” in Quechua). She is single, 25 years old, and lives with her parents. Iliana has a bar-discotheque called “Of Revelry” in a rented locale. She has employees and is busy there everyday.

Iliana needs a loan of $375 to buy drinks to sell. Her dreams are to study for another career, to have another business, and to assist her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Maria es viuda, tiene 60 años y 5 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, gas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su nieto.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Maria son aumentar su negocio y que su hijo tenga un negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Kausachun”, which means “Long Live!” in Quecha. She is 60 years old, widowed, and has 5 children. She operates a store out of her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and gas. Maria works every day with the help of her grandson.

Maria needs a loan in the amount of 1050 soles to buy rice and sugar. She dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her son will also open his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

Akua is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akua is a trader, trading in foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, maize, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities and sells in her community and also supplies to other food vendors. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy food items in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: three sons and one daughter. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Janet is a food vendor. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi and prepares and sells kenkey which is produced from corn dough. She sells it with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. Janet has been in business for barely one year and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to expand her business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is forty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: three sons and three daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Hannah is a trader, trading in foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, maize, etc. She sells in her community and also supplies to other food vendors. She procures the goods from nearby communities and has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy food items in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk to expand her business

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Marina es casada, tiene 44 años y 5 hijos, Marina junto a su esposo tienen una ferretería en la selva ayacuchana, productos que también reparte al por mayor, además venD. gas, y D. la selva compra café.
Marina necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gas.
Los sueños D. Marina son que sus hijos sean profesionales, tengan un trabajo estable y tener una tienda en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Adela es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Adela es casada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Adela tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Adela necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gas, azúcar y arroz.
Los sueños D. Adela son educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de gas, azúcar y arroz.

texts.es: La señora Lucy A. que trabajo con el grupo solidario Concordia hace 5 años atras, actualmente tiene una tienda  surtida de varios productos  el mismo que  esta ubicada en su mismo domicilio. El credito que saca de la institución le sirve de mucho ya que con ello trabaja para aumentar su capital.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one son and two daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Afia is a trader, trading in foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, maize, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities and sells in her community and also supplies to other food vendors. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy food items in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk to expand her business

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Hilda es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Hilda vende quesos de casa en casa que adquiere en las diferentes ferias, también compra cereales que luego comercializa en la ciudad de Lima.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Hilda son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the village bank Kausachun which means "¡Que Viva!" or "Living" in Quechua.

Hilda is married, 38 years old, and has two children. Hilda sells cheeses house to house that she buys at different markets in addition to cereals that she buys in the city of Lima.

Hilda needs a loan of 900 soles which she will invest in buying more cheese.

Hilda's dreams are that her children will become professionals and to better her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Honoria es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun que significa ¡Que Viva! En quechua.
Honoria es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Honoria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, carne.
Honoria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Honoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Honoria is a member of the Kausachun Microfinance Institute—which means “Long live!” in Quechua.

Honoria is a 37-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 3 children. She has a general store in her home in which she sells general provisions, fruits, vegetables, and meats.

Honoria needs a 900.00 PEN loan in order to invest in purchasing sugar and rice. She dreams that her children may one day become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Sonia Lilliam Ramírez R. tiene 70 años de edad. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Sonia es una mujer muy luchadora y a pesar de tener esa edad, ha logrado sacar adelante a su hijo y ofrecerle la oportunidad de estudio. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos. El sueño de Sonia es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda, par que el día de mañana sea de provecho para su hijo.

texts.en: Catherine is thirty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, a son and four daughters who are all in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Catherine lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in textiles – under wears for ladies and ready-made clothes. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. Catherine procures her goods from Accra. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

Suzy is thirty – eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all daughters who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Suzy is a trader. She trades in second hand textiles – clothes for unisex, bed sheets, etc. She hawks and treks to sell in other communities. She procures bales of second hand textiles from Accra. Suzy has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.
Margarita es casada, tiene 64 años y 8 hijos, Margarita junto a su esposo tienen un pequeño restaurante llamado El Amigo en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días, los días sábados y domingos venD. comida típica.
Margarita necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. platos y ollas.
Los sueños D. Margarita son mejora su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de platos y ollas.

texts.es:
Fany es socia del Banco Comunal Dignidad.
Fany es soltera, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Fany viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego vende en los mercados. Además Fany trabaja como almacenera.
Fany necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Fany son terminar de construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fany is a member of the Dignidad Microfinance Institute.

Fany is a 35-year-old single mother with 3 children. She travels to the different open-air markets of the regions to purchase grains, then sells them at the markets. Additionally, she works at a warehouse.

Fanny needs a 1,200.00 PEN loan to invest in purchasing grains. She dreams of finishing construction of her house and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Escarleth de 38 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos (de 18, 14 y 12 años) todos estudiando la primaria y secundaria, vive en union libre con el Sr. Bartolo Mercado.  Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para mejorar su casa de habitacion en el Residencial Bosques de Juigalpa, contruyendo la cocina, hacer el pantry y terminar el porche, pues desea tener mayor comodidad para su familia.  Doña Escarleth y su compañero son comerciantes y viajan a las comarcas a vender zapatos, ropa y otras cositas obteniendo ingresos que le permiten el sustento de su familia y el pago de sus compromisos.  El mayor sueño de esta familia es poder contar con una vivienda con todas las comodidades necesarias para que sus hijos puedan crecer y desarrollarse felices.
texts.en:
Escarleth is 38 years old and has 3 children (ages 18, 14, and 12), all of whom are currently in primary school or high school. She lives with her partner Bartolo Mercado.

She is asking for her first loan to better her home in the neighborhood Bosques de Juigalpa by building a kitchen, a pantry, and finish the porch so that her family will be more comfortable. Ms. Escarleth and her partner are merchants and travel to different counties to sell shoes, clothing, and other things to help them make money to support their family and pay the bills.

The dream of this family is to be able to live a life with all the amenities necessary for their children to grow up and develop happily.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one son and three daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Victoria is a trader. She runs a cold-store business selling pork. She procures the goods from nearby towns and supplies to food vendors and chop bar (a place to eat, not necessarily a bar) operators in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is thirty-nine years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a daughter, who is in school. As a single parent, Anna works very hard to be able to provide for her family. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Anna is a trader. She runs a provision store located by the roadside in her community. She procures her inventory from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand her business

texts.es:
Cledy  es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Cledy es casada, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Cledy junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos de manera artesanal, los ladrillos los vende sin quemarlos, además en algunas épocas Cledy compra y vende tara y cochinilla.
Cledy necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido para labrar los ladrillos.
Los sueños de Cledy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Cledy is a member of the Orcasitas II community bank.

Cledy is 25 years old, married, and she has 2 children. Cledy, together with her husband, makes artisanal bricks. She sells the bricks without firing them. In addition, at times Cledy purchases and sells tara (a native Peruvian plant used to make leather tanning powder) and cochinilla (an insect used to make natural pigments).

Cledy needs a loan of 750 PEN, which will be be invested in making bricks.

Cledy’s dreams are to get ahead and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Hilda es casada, tiene 37 años y 6 hijos, Hilda se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos de manera artesanal, para lo cual cuenta con su propio horno, sus ventas los realiza en la misma comunidad. Además Hilda vende comida los días domingos.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido para labrar los ladrillos.
Los sueños de Hilda son que sus hijos sean profesionales y salgan adelante.

Cristian Maria C. J. tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en general es una joven de 48 años. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por lo que tenía 4 hijos que mantener. Ella ha comercializado mercadería por encargo y siempre ha mantenido estabilidad en el negocio y su buen record. Cristian tiene muchos clientes y en su mayoría son jóvenes, además tiene a su hermana quien le ayuda a mostrar sus productos y juntas han logrado realizar lo necesario para mantener a la familia. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, cremas, calzado y ropa interior. Su mayor deseo es seguir con este negocio ya que la situación es muy difícil y ella quiere lograr lo que se propone.
texts.en:
Cristian Maria C. J. is a general merchant and is 48 years old. She began this business because she had 4 children for which to care. She has sold by order and has always maintained stability in her business, and a good record. Cristian has many customers, the majority of which are young. In addition, her daughter helps her to show her products and together, they have been able to achieve what is necessary to support the family. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, creams, footwear, and underwear. Her biggest dream is to continue with the business, since the situation is very difficult and she wants to achieve what she has set out to do.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Edith de 40 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, pero con ella viven 2 sobrinos los cuales estan a su cargo, labora en el MISA SILAIS Chontales desde hace 9 años como responsable de proyecto Fonsalud, esta solicitando su 8vo credito para mejorar su vivienda terminando la construccion de su porche y poniendole el piso ya que actualmente ni siquiera esta embaldosado y con las lluvias se le hace lodo, cuenta con el apoyo de compañero de vida quien asume los gastos del hogar.  El mayor sueño de Edith es poder tener una vivienda bonita para sus hijos y con las condiciones basicas para que puedan desarrollarse en un ambiente estable y alegre.
texts.en:
Edith is 40 years old and single. She has 2 children, but she also has 2 nephews and nieces living with her, of whom she is in charge. She has worked in the Chontales branch of the Ministry of Health’s Comprehensive Local Health System (SILAIS) for 9 years, and has been responsible for the Fonsalud project. She is requesting her 8th loan to improve her house, finishing the construction of her porch and putting in the floor because it is not currently tiled and the rain creates mud. She has the support of her life companion, who assumes housing expenses. Edith’s biggest dream is to be able to have a nice house for her children with basic conditions so that they can develop in a stable and happy environment.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: La señora María vive en Villa Salomé hace muchos y actualmente tiene su casa en construcción. Su esposo, Máximo H., es contratista (persona que realiza contratos D. construcción, donD. guía y controla que la constucción termine). Ellos tienen 4 hijos, tres D. ellos estudian en la escuela primaria y el otro es aún pequeño. Ella se dedica a vender en su tienda D. barrio, el local esta en alquiler. Es muy conocida por sus vecinos como una persona responsable y dedicada con su familia y su trabajo. Uno D. los deseos D. María es ver a sus hijos como profesionales. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. abarrotes como ser arroz, azúcar y fideo.

Inocenta es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Inocenta es casada, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Inocenta junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos de manera artesanal, sus ventas los realiza a los intermediarios, además Inocenta vende comida los días domingos.
Inocenta necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido para labrar los ladrillos.
Los sueños de Inocenta son ampliar sus negocios y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Inocenta is a member of the Orcasitas II cooperative bank. Inocenta is 48 years old and has 1 son. Together with her husband, she dedicates herself to making hand-crafted bricks. She makes her sales through intermediaries. In addition, Inocenta sells food on Sundays. Inocenta needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in making her bricks. Inocenta’s dreams are to expand her businesses and to continue forging ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Víctor Hugo M. G. tiene 51 años. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. El tiene 2 hijos pero ninguno está a su cargo ya que trabajan de manera independiente. El señor se ha desempeñado como un buen cliente. Junto a su esposa han logrado salir adelante con su negocio ya que ella le ayuda a realizar las tareas del hogar y hacerse cargo de la pulpería. Por lo que su prioridad es abastecer de variedad de productos. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales y jugos. Su deseo es seguir con vida para proporcionarle a su esposa lo necesario.
texts.en:
Víctor Hugo M. G. is 51 years old. His economic activity is a grocery store. He has 2 sons, but neither is still in his care as they now work independently. This man has been a good client. Together with his wife, they have managed to get ahead in their business as she takes care of the home and helps to manage the store. His priority is to supply his business with a variety of products. His store is located in his own home. He is requesting this financing for working capital, to buy basic needs items such as snacks, natural beverages and juices. His wish is to continue providing his wife with life’s necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce le commerce de l’alimentation générale à Lomé depuis 1984. Elle a très vite compris qu’elle doit exercer une activité génératrice de revenus pour aider financièrement son mari soudeur à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 04 enfants. Sa boutique d’alimentation générale assure l’approvisionnement du quartier Agoè BKS. Actuellement elle pense aussi vendre des articles scolaires pour préparer cette rentrée et assurer la fourniture scolaire aux élèves de ce quartier populaire. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 04 bidons d’huile, 01 carton de tomate en boîtes, 01 sac de riz, 03 cartons de spaghetti, 02 cartons de savon de toilette, 20 cahiers de 100 pages, 15 cahiers de 200 pages ainsi que d’autres articles solaires.
texts.en:
This woman has been operating a general store in Lomé since 1984. She quickly understood that she must operate an income-generating business to help her husband, a welder, to provide for their four children financially. Her general store makes sure that the Agoè BKS district is kept supplied. Currently, she is also thinking of selling school items to get ready for the coming return-to-school season and to ensure that the students in this district have school supplies. And so, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy four containers of oil, a box of canned tomatoes, a sack of rice, three boxes of spaghetti, two boxes of bath soap, twenty 100-page notebooks, and fifteen 200-page notebooks, as well as other school items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Magnoudéwa

texts.fr: Cette dame est célibataire et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle vend uniquement du charbon de bois et du maïs pour subvenir à ses besoins. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2004 dans le quartier Démakpoè à Lomé. Elle vend ces deux produits au bord d’une route secondaire très fréquentée de beaucoup de piétons et automobilistes, ce qui fait qu’elle réalise de bons chiffres d’affaires. Pour renouveler son stock, elle voudrait avoir un prêt de WAGES pour acheter  05 sacs de charbon de bois et 02 sacs de maïs. Le reste du montant servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers Atakpamé, son lieu d’approvisionnement.

loans.use: Achat de charbon de bois et de maïs

texts.en:
This is Mohamed B. K., Hawa K., Sidikie S. and Marie K.. They called their group Future for Life. This is the first loan they are receiving from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. They’re requesting a loan of Le 500,000 for each to enable them expand their businesses. This will helped them a lot. They will able to make a lot of profit from the loan, thus able to solve much of their household problems. 

Mohamed B. K. is the leader of this group. Mohamed was born in Kabala town, in Koinadugu district, northern Sierra Leone.  He is twenty-seven years of age, married with two children. One of her children is in class two and the other is in class one.  Mohamed owns a small kiosk where he repairs mobile phones, recharge mobile batteries for a fee of Le 1,000.00. Mohamed also sells phone accessories and top-up cards for all five mobile network companies in the country. Mohamed’s hope is to be able to expand his business, make enough money so that he will be able to travel to neighboring Guinea to buy mobile phones and sells in Waterloo town.
(The lady whose picture is attached below is a member of the group but was not present during the scheduled date of disbursement).

loans.name: Mawuéna

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé où elle s’est spécialisée dans la restauration de fufu et de sauces de viandes de mouton. Elle vend également une pâte alimentaire dénommée « mankumé » très appréciée de la population. C’est pour avoir un nouveau stock pour continuer sa restauration qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 08 sacs de maïs pour préparer « mankumé », 12 tas d’ignames pour préparer le fufu et 50kg de viande de mouton. Le reste du prêt servira à payer les frais de location du bar et couvrir certains de ses frais de transport.
texts.en:
This lady lives in the Adidogomé district in Lomé, where she became specialized in food service offering fufu and mutton sauces. She also sells a mash called mankumé which people appreciate very much. To obtain new supplies to continue her food service, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 8 sacks of corn to make mankumé, 12 loads of yams to make fufu, and 50 kg of mutton. The rest of the loan will be used for covering the cost of leasing the bar and certain transport costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, yams, and meat

texts.es: Francisca del Rosario B. García tiene 39 años, ella es una joven que vive con su esposo y juntos tienen 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, la mayoría de sus clientes son sus vecinos que siempre asisten a su local ya que la atención de Francisca es la mejor. Ella solicita este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de detergentes, carnes, golosinas, pan refrescos y jugos. El sueño de Francisca es poseer una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Francisca del Rosario B. García is 39 years old. She is a young woman who lives with her husband, and together they have 2 children. Her economic activity is a grocery store. The business is located in her home, and the majority of her customers are neighbors. They always visit this local establishment as Francisca provides the best service. She requests this financing for working capital, in order to buy supplies such as detergents, meats, snacks, fresh bread and juices. Francisca’s dream is to have a distribution center.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: Cette dame vend depuis 2005 des produits d’alimentation générale pour se prendre en charge. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a pas non plus d’enfant. Cette activité lui permet d’aider son petit frère à poursuivre ses études universitaires à l’Université de Lomé. Elle vend aussi des savons en poudre de cuisine, de la brosse dentifrice, des papiers hyégéniques, des savons de toilette. Pour renouveler son stock de produits alimentaires, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 10 bidons d’huile, 05 sacs de riz, 05 sacs de sucre, 10 paniers de tomates naturelles, 10 paniers de piments gros et bien d’autres produits.
texts.en:
Since 2005, this lady has been selling grocery items to support herself. She is not married and neither has she any children. This business allows her to help her younger brother pursue his university education at the University of Lomé. She also sells powdered kitchen soaps, toothbrushes, toilet paper, and bath soaps. To renew her inventory of goods, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 10 containers of oil, 5 sacks of rice, 5 sacks of sugar, 10 baskets of natural tomatoes, 10 baskets of big chili peppers, and many other items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
